original: dper na me dang zangs ma'i zhu ba nyid lhan cig na yod pa grogs byed pa me yod pa las zangs kyi zhu ba nyid skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na me dang zangs ma'i zhu ba nyid lhan cig na yod pa grogs byed pa me yod pa las zangs kyi zhu ba nyid skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, the melting of copper and the heat of fire exist simultaneously and the heat of fire assists the melting of copper.

original: de bzhin du sems ni lus kyi grogs byed pa can nam /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems ni lus kyi grogs byed pa can nam /
translated: In the same way, the body assists the mind,

original: lus kyang sems kyi grogs byed pa can te /
analyzed: lus kyang sems kyi grogs byed pa can te /
translated: and the mind assists the body.

original: gong nas gong du lus dang sems skyed pa'i phyir lus dang sems dag ni lhan cig tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gong nas gong du lus dang sems skyed pa'i phyir lus dang sems dag ni lhan cig tu gnas pa'o //
translated: The body and mind exist simultaneously because they assist each other in the generation of higher and higher bodies and minds.

original: de ltar na 'gyur mod kyi gal te lus sems kyi nye bar len ba ma yin yang rten du ni 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'gyur mod kyi gal te lus sems kyi nye bar len ba ma yin yang rten du ni 'gyur te /
translated: Even if the body is not the appropriator of the mind, it is still its support.

original: des na lus zhig na shes pa ldog par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: des na lus zhig na shes pa ldog par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Therefore, when the body is destroyed, consciousness ceases.

original: lus gzhan la 'pho ba med de /üîΩdper na rtsig pa la brten pa'i ri mo rtsig pa @329a * //
analyzed: lus gzhan la 'pho ba med de / dper na rtsig pa la brten pa'i ri mo rtsig pa @329a * //
translated: It does not transfer to another body.

original: zhig pa na 'jig cing /
analyzed: zhig pa na 'jig cing /
translated: For example, when a wall is destroyed, the painting on the wall is destroyed.üîΩIt does not transfer to another wall.

original: rtsig pa gzhan la 'gro ba med pa bzhin no zhe na de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: rtsig pa gzhan la 'gro ba med pa bzhin no zhe na de ni mi bden te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir ri mo la sogs pa ras la sogs pa la gnas pa ni rten gzhan las 'ongs par shes pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ri mo la sogs pa ras la sogs pa la gnas pa ni rten gzhan las 'ongs par shes pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Because a picture, etc., that exists in cloth, etc., is not known to come from another basis.

original: sems ni rmi lam gyi mtha' can gyi lus dang bred pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi rjes su 'brang ba las sad pa'i gnas skabs dang / dang po skyes pa'i tshe skye ba gzhan gyi lus la gnas pa'i 'du byed kyi rjes su 'gro bar rtogs pa yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: sems ni rmi lam gyi mtha' can gyi lus dang bred pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi rjes su 'brang ba las sad pa'i gnas skabs dang / dang po skyes pa'i tshe skye ba gzhan gyi lus la gnas pa'i 'du byed kyi rjes su 'gro bar rtogs pa yin pa de bas na /
translated: But the mind is known to follow the body of the dream state, the body of fear, etc., and the body of the waking state, and the body of another birth at the time of first being conceived.

original: ri mo bzhin rten so sor nges pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ri mo bzhin rten so sor nges pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not like a picture, with a definite, individual basis.

original: so sor nges pa'i rten nyid ni lus zhig na 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i rten nyid ni lus zhig na 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the body is destroyed, it is destroyed.

original: gzhan yang lus sam gzhan la yang rten nyid med pa'i phyir lus zhig na 'jig par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang lus sam gzhan la yang rten nyid med pa'i phyir lus zhig na 'jig par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, how could it be destroyed when the body is destroyed, since it has no basis either in the body or elsewhere?

original: ri mo la sogs pa ni rtsig pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid de pas na rang bzhin nyid kyis 'jig par gyur gyi rten zhig pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ri mo la sogs pa ni rtsig pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid de pas na rang bzhin nyid kyis 'jig par gyur gyi rten zhig pas ni ma yin no //
translated: A picture, etc., is not different from the wall, and therefore it is destroyed by its very nature, not by the destruction of its basis.

original: 'o na tha dad pa med pas rten dang brten pa'i dngos por ma gyur mod /
analyzed: 'o na tha dad pa med pas rten dang brten pa'i dngos por ma gyur mod /
translated: But if they are not different, they are not the entities of the supported and the supporter.

original: lus dang sems dag rten dang brten pa ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: lus dang sems dag rten dang brten pa ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can the body and mind be the supported and the supporter?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: yod med dag la rten med phyir //
analyzed: yod med dag la rten med phyir //
translated: Because the existent and the nonexistent do not have a support,

original: rten ni gnas pa'i rgyu ma yin //
analyzed: rten ni gnas pa'i rgyu ma yin //
translated: the support is not the cause of endurance.

original: yod pa yin na 'di rten med //
analyzed: yod pa yin na 'di rten med //
translated: If it exists, it does not have a support,

original: gnas pa po las gzhan min phyir //üîΩtha dad na yang de yi rgyu //
analyzed: gnas pa po las gzhan min phyir // tha dad na yang de yi rgyu //
translated: because the endurer is not different from the other.

original: de yi dngos po la ci bya //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yi dngos po la ci bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: If they are different, what would be the point of its entity?

original: yod pa ma yin pa la ni rten med de /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa la ni rten med de /
translated: Here, the nonexistent does not have a support,

original: nam mkha'i me tog la rten med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog la rten med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a sky flower does not have a support.

original: 'o na kyang rgyu las skye ba nyid du 'dod la yod pa ma yin pa med pas rgyu nyid med na rten ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na kyang rgyu las skye ba nyid du 'dod la yod pa ma yin pa med pas rgyu nyid med na rten ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, if it is asserted that it arises from a cause, since the nonexistent does not exist, if there is no cause, it is not a support.

original: yod na yang gzhan la rag ma las pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yod na yang gzhan la rag ma las pa'i phyir //
translated: Even if it exists, because it does not depend on another,

original: lus rten ma yin no //
analyzed: lus rten ma yin no //
translated: the body is not a support.

original: yod kyang gnas pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rten ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yod kyang gnas pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rten ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But if it exists, because it is the cause of endurance, it is a support?

original: 'di ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'thad de /
translated: This is not tenable.

original: gnas pa 'di gnas pa po la tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa 'di gnas pa po la tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the abiding is different from the abiding one.

original: gal te lus la sogs pas shes pa gnas pa yin na de nyid kyis byas par gyur pa las shes pa ni lus las skyes pa ma yin no zhes 'di ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: gal te lus la sogs pas shes pa gnas pa yin na de nyid kyis byas par gyur pa las shes pa ni lus las skyes pa ma yin no zhes 'di ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: If consciousness abides due to the body, etc., then it would be produced by them. But it has been shown previously that consciousness is not produced from the body.

original: dngos po grub pa la yang cung zad ma grub pa'i cha yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dngos po grub pa la yang cung zad ma grub pa'i cha yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: And is there not a part of something established that is not established?

original: rgyu de'i phyir rten yin la /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir rten yin la /
translated: For that reason, it is a basis.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis bskyed pa ni rgyur brjod do //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis bskyed pa ni rgyur brjod do //
translated: But that which produces it by its whole nature is called a cause.

original: gang la la chos skyed pa de ni gzhi yin gyi dngos po la brten pa tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la la chos skyed pa de ni gzhi yin gyi dngos po la brten pa tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: That which produces a phenomenon is its basis, but it is not a different thing that is dependent on a thing.

original: lhung ba ni dngos po yang dngos po yang ngo bor yod pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: lhung ba ni dngos po yang dngos po yang ngo bor yod pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because a fall is an existent thing.

original: @329b gal te gnas pa tha dad pa ma yin na /
analyzed: @329b gal te gnas pa tha dad pa ma yin na /
translated: If abiding is not different,

original: de'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyi gnas pa ni rtag tu yod par ; gyur ba de lta bas na gnas pa tha dad pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyi gnas pa ni rtag tu yod par ; gyur ba de lta bas na gnas pa tha dad pa'o zhe na /
translated: then the abiding by its own nature would always exist. Therefore, abiding is different.

original: 'di ni de'i rten ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de'i rten ma yin te /
translated: This is not its basis.

original: de bas na shes pa'i dngos po la ci zhig byed na /
analyzed: de bas na shes pa'i dngos po la ci zhig byed na /
translated: Therefore, what function does consciousness perform?üîΩIf you ask, ‚ÄúBy what is this consciousness supported?‚Äù

original: gang gis 'di rten yin zhe na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gis 'di rten yin zhe na brjod par bya ste /
translated: we will respond:

original: 'di ltar gnas pa dang / dngos po la bdag nyid gcig pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas pa dang / dngos po la bdag nyid gcig pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, the support and the supported are not identical.

original: dngos po skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that the entity would arise again.

original: de las byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de las byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does the support arise from the supported,

original: dngos po nyid gnas par skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po nyid gnas par skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the entity itself would generate the support.

original: rten gzhan pa rtags pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten gzhan pa rtags pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is meaningless to impute another support.

original: gal te yang lus sems kyi rten yin te gnas pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang lus sems kyi rten yin te gnas pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If the body is the support of the mind, because it is the cause of its endurance,

original: de'i tshe lus gnas pa na sems kyang gnas pas /üîΩ'jig pa med par thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe lus gnas pa na sems kyang gnas pas / 'jig pa med par thal bar 'gyur /
translated: then when the body endures, the mind also endures.üîΩTherefore, it would follow that the mind would not be destroyed.

original: de 'jig rgyu las 'dod pa ni //
analyzed: de 'jig rgyu las 'dod pa ni //
translated: If you assert that it is destroyed by a cause of destruction,

original: de yang thal ba mtshungs pa ste //
analyzed: de yang thal ba mtshungs pa ste //
translated: then the same consequence applies.

original: gnas pa'i rgyus kyang ci zhig bya //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyus kyang ci zhig bya // ces bya ba la /
translated: What function does the cause of endurance perform?

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las /üîΩbam po ldab /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las /üîΩbam po ldab /
translated: This is the commentary on the fourth chapter, having eight verses, calledüîΩ‚Äúthe examination of the prior entity.‚Äù

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi sems 'jig pa 'jig pa'i rgyu las khas len par byed de //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi sems 'jig pa 'jig pa'i rgyu las khas len par byed de //
translated: But we do accept that the destruction of a thing is caused by the cause of its destruction.

original: 'gal ba'i rkyen yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rkyen yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because there is a contradictory condition.

original: de la yang rtag pa mtshungs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la yang rtag pa mtshungs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But in that case, the same consequence follows: it is permanent.

original: 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because what is called ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù is not different from the thing.

original: 'jig pa tha dad na yang 'jig pa'i rgyus ci zhig byed de /
analyzed: 'jig pa tha dad na yang 'jig pa'i rgyus ci zhig byed de /
translated: And if destruction is different, what does the cause of destruction do?

original: de'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyus ci yang mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyus ci yang mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, the cause of destruction does nothing.

original: de bas na mi 'jig pa'i phyir rang nyid gnas pa yin pas gnas pa'i rgyus ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de bas na mi 'jig pa'i phyir rang nyid gnas pa yin pas gnas pa'i rgyus ci zhig bya /
translated: And because it does not perish, it remains by itself. So what does the cause of endurance do?

original: gal te yang ji srid 'jig pa'i rgyus 'jig pa mi skyed pa de srid du rang nyid gnas pa yin pa'i phyir gnas pa'i rgyus ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: gal te yang ji srid 'jig pa'i rgyus 'jig pa mi skyed pa de srid du rang nyid gnas pa yin pa'i phyir gnas pa'i rgyus ci zhig bya ste /
translated: And if it remains by itself as long as the cause of destruction does not produce destruction, what does the cause of endurance do?

original: cung zad kyang gnas pa'i rgyus mi byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: cung zad kyang gnas pa'i rgyus mi byed pa nyid do //
translated: The cause of endurance does not do anything at all.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs par du de la gnas na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs par du de la gnas na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it remains until the cause of destruction arrives,

original: 'jig pa po ma 'ongs pa ste /üîΩma byung ba'i bar te sngar sems kyi gnas pa lus de las yin no zhe na /üîΩlan smras pa /
analyzed: 'jig pa po ma 'ongs pa ste / ma byung ba'i bar te sngar sems kyi gnas pa lus de las yin no zhe na / lan smras pa /
translated: The one who is destroyed is the future,üîΩthat is, the not yet arisen mind that is the basis of the body.üîΩThe reply is stated:üîΩüîΩ

original: 'jig pa ni /üîΩdngos chos nyid 'gyur gnod med 'di //üîΩgnas pa'i rgyu yis ci byar yod //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni / dngos chos nyid 'gyur gnod med 'di // gnas pa'i rgyu yis ci byar yod //
translated: The one who is destroyed is the future,

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.

original: 'o na de ltar na 'jig pa'i rgyu don med du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rang gi rgyu nyid las 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin pas 'jig pa dngos po'i chos nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar na 'jig pa'i rgyu don med du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rang gi rgyu nyid las 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin pas 'jig pa dngos po'i chos nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir /üîΩ'di la 'gal med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir / 'di la 'gal med pa ste /
translated: The one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.

original: 'gal ba med pa 'di @330a * //üîΩla yod pas /
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa 'di @330a * // la yod pas /
translated: The one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gang gis kyang gzhan du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir /üîΩgnas pa'i rgyu yis ci zhig byed /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gang gis kyang gzhan du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir / gnas pa'i rgyu yis ci zhig byed /
translated: The one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.

original: 'on te gnas pa'i rgyu med na 'jig pa de gnas pa'i rgyu yod na 'jig pa bkag par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gnas pa'i rgyu med na 'jig pa de gnas pa'i rgyu yod na 'jig pa bkag par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one.üîΩThe one who is destroyed is the future, that is, the not yet arisen one

original: de lta na 'o na ni 'jig pa 'gegs pas 'jig pa 'di las gzhan la byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni 'jig pa 'gegs pas 'jig pa 'di las gzhan la byed pa nyid do //
translated: But if that is so, then since it prevents destruction, it is the agent of destruction.

original: des na 'jig pa la ci yang ma byas pas 'jig pa med pa kho nar 'gyur na /
analyzed: des na 'jig pa la ci yang ma byas pas 'jig pa med pa kho nar 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, since it does not do anything to destruction, destruction would not exist.

original: ji ltar sems mi gnas pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar sems mi gnas pa yin /
translated: How could it be that the mind does not endure?

original: chu la gzhi mthong pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: chu la gzhi mthong pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the ground on which water rests seen?

original: de la rtag pa rgyus kyang gnod pa ma yin pa de bas na rten yin no //
analyzed: de la rtag pa rgyus kyang gnod pa ma yin pa de bas na rten yin no //
translated: Since it is not harmed by the cause of permanence, it is a support.

original: des na yod pa dang med par rtog pa don med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na yod pa dang med par rtog pa don med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the conception of existence and nonexistence is meaningless, he says:

original: dper na chu la sogs pa'i gzhi bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na chu la sogs pa'i gzhi bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, it is like the ground on which water rests.

original: chu la sogs pa'i gzhi sa phyogs na mthong ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: chu la sogs pa'i gzhi sa phyogs na mthong ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the ground on which water rests is seen,

original: shes pa'i yang rten lus yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa'i yang rten lus yin no zhe na /
translated: so too the body is the support of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: 'di la'ang mtshungs /
analyzed: 'di la'ang mtshungs /
translated: This is also similar.üîΩThings are destroyed moment by moment,

original: dngos rnams skad cig re rer 'jig / dngos rgyun de ltar skye ba'i phyir //
analyzed: dngos rnams skad cig re rer 'jig / dngos rgyun de ltar skye ba'i phyir //
translated: because a continuum of things arises in that way.

original: rgyun nyid yin phyir de rten yin //
analyzed: rgyun nyid yin phyir de rten yin //
translated: Since it is a continuum, it is a support.

original: de ltar min na rig pa min /
analyzed: de ltar min na rig pa min /
translated: If it were not so, it would not be cognition.

original: 'bo ba yis ni gegs byed phyir //
analyzed: 'bo ba yis ni gegs byed phyir //
translated: because the water is supported by the ground,

original: chu la sogs pa'i rten 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: chu la sogs pa'i rten 'gyur gyi //
translated: and the ground is the support of the water.

original: 'gro ba med can yon tan spyi //üîΩlas rnams la rten gyis ci bya /
analyzed: 'gro ba med can yon tan spyi // las rnams la rten gyis ci bya /
translated: But the universal of fluidity is not supported by the action of flowing,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: for what use has the action of flowing in the universal of fluidity?üîΩThis is similar to the objection:

original: 'di yang chu'i gzhi sa'i steng la sogs pa la yod pa dang / med pa dag gi rten ma yin zhes bya ba'i brtsad pa mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang chu'i gzhi sa'i steng la sogs pa la yod pa dang / med pa dag gi rten ma yin zhes bya ba'i brtsad pa mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe ground, etc. are not the support of the water that exists and does not exist on the ground, etc.‚Äù

original: chu'i gzhir gyur pa'i gzhi la sogs pa mthong pa'i phyi ma yin nam /
analyzed: chu'i gzhir gyur pa'i gzhi la sogs pa mthong pa'i phyi ma yin nam /
translated: Is the ground, etc. that is the support of the water seen or not seen?

original: des na brtsad par mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: des na brtsad par mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: If it is seen, then the objection is not appropriate.

original: de ni bden pa ma yin te /üîΩsa phyogs ni chu mi 'bo ba'i rten du 'gyur bas rten yin gyi /üîΩ'bo ba gang yin pa de'i ni rten ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni bden pa ma yin te / sa phyogs ni chu mi 'bo ba'i rten du 'gyur bas rten yin gyi / 'bo ba gang yin pa de'i ni rten ma yin la /
translated: This is not true,üîΩbecause the ground is the support of the water that does not flow, but it is not the support of that which flows.

original: rten gang yin pa de'i 'bo ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir 'bo ba dang / mi 'bo ba dag phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten gang yin pa de'i 'bo ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir 'bo ba dang / mi 'bo ba dag phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that which is the support of the water that does not flow is not the support of that which flows, because that which flows and that which does not flow are mutually exclusive.

original: sngar ni 'bo ba la phyis nas mi 'bo ba ma yin nam des na 'gal pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: sngar ni 'bo ba la phyis nas mi 'bo ba ma yin nam des na 'gal pa med do zhe na /
translated: But it is not the case that it was moving before and later does not move. Therefore there is no contradiction.

original: de ltar ni gang 'bo ba de'i rten ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni gang 'bo ba de'i rten ma yin te /
translated: We reply: It is not the case that what moves is the support of what does not move.

original: mngon sum gyis g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba dag gcig pa nyid du mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba dag gcig pa nyid du mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because we do not perceive movement and nonmovement as identical.

original: 'bo ba dang mi 'bo ba dus gcig pa nyid du dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bo ba dang mi 'bo ba dus gcig pa nyid du dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: We do not perceive movement and nonmovement as simultaneous.

original: dus mig cig na ni ji ltar gnas par byed de /
analyzed: dus mig cig na ni ji ltar gnas par byed de /
translated: How could it be that it is at rest at one time?

original: dus gsum du gnas par byed pas bzung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dus gsum du gnas par byed pas bzung ba yin gyi /
translated: It is apprehended as being at rest in the three times.

original: dus mang po dang 'brel pa can nyid cig car 'dzin pa ma @330b yin no //
analyzed: dus mang po dang 'brel pa can nyid cig car 'dzin pa ma @330b yin no //
translated: It is not apprehended as being related to many times simultaneously.

original: rim gyis rtogs par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: rim gyis rtogs par byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is apprehended successively,

original: rim po'i don nyid bsam bya ste /
analyzed: rim po'i don nyid bsam bya ste /
translated: then consider the meaning of ‚Äúsuccession.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar rim pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad ni yod pa dang med pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rim pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad ni yod pa dang med pa dag ste /
translated: The convention ‚Äúsuccession‚Äù is used for what is existent and what is nonexistent.

original: de yang tha dad pa'i dus dag ma yin nam /
analyzed: de yang tha dad pa'i dus dag ma yin nam /
translated: And is that not a different time?

original: yod pa dang med pa dag kyang gzung pa'am 'dzin pa yin /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag kyang gzung pa'am 'dzin pa yin /
translated: And is it not the case that what is existent and what is nonexistent are either apprehended or are the apprehender?

original: de la bzung ba'i yod pa dang / med pa 'jog na 'dzin pa gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la bzung ba'i yod pa dang / med pa 'jog na 'dzin pa gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you posit the existence or nonexistence of the object, it is not the same as the apprehension.

original: 'dzin pa dus ma yin na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dus ma yin na /
translated: If the apprehension is not simultaneous with the object,

original: gzung ba yang rim par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dzin pa'i gnas skabs can gcig pa nyid ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: gzung ba yang rim par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dzin pa'i gnas skabs can gcig pa nyid ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: then the object would also be sequential. Therefore, it is not the same as the apprehension.

original: chu mi 'bo ba da ltar 'dzin cing /
analyzed: chu mi 'bo ba da ltar 'dzin cing /
translated: The water that is not flowing is apprehended in the present,

original: 'bo ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i rtog pa'i spyod yul yin bas 'bo ba dang / mi 'bo ba'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i chu gcig pa nyid du mngon sum gyis mthong ba ma yin no /
analyzed: 'bo ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i rtog pa'i spyod yul yin bas 'bo ba dang / mi 'bo ba'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i chu gcig pa nyid du mngon sum gyis mthong ba ma yin no /
translated: but the flowing water is the domain of the future thought. Therefore, the water that exists in the state of flowing and not flowing is not seen by direct perception to be the same.

original: 'di'i don ni //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni //
translated: The meaning of this is

original: yod med dag la rten med phyir /
analyzed: yod med dag la rten med phyir /
translated: because existence and nonexistence are not supported.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what it says.

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: The supported and the support are not seen.

original: 'o na ji ltar mthong ba ma yin par rten dang brten pa'i dngos por brtag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar mthong ba ma yin par rten dang brten pa'i dngos por brtag par bya zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWell then, how are the supported and the support to be imagined if they are not seen?‚Äù

original: de lta mod kyi da ni phyin ci log tu rtog pa la ni med par 'gyur gzhan yang dngos po rnams skad cig re re la 'jig par khas blangs par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi da ni phyin ci log tu rtog pa la ni med par 'gyur gzhan yang dngos po rnams skad cig re re la 'jig par khas blangs par gyur pa ni /
translated: Moreover, you accept that things are destroyed at every moment.

original: dngos po'i rgyun te /üîΩngo bo'i rgyun ltar de ltar brtags pas nye bar len par dang mtshungs pa'i yul du chu skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po'i rgyun te / ngo bo'i rgyun ltar de ltar brtags pas nye bar len par dang mtshungs pa'i yul du chu skye ba'i phyir /
translated: The continuum of a thing is not like the continuum of its nature.

original: sa phyogs de rgyu yin pas rten yin no //
analyzed: sa phyogs de rgyu yin pas rten yin no //
translated: Since it is imagined to be the object that is similar to the appropriated aggregates, the place is the support because it is the cause of the arising of water and so on.

original: de ltar na ma yin te skye bar khas mi len na rten nyid du de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ma yin te skye bar khas mi len na rten nyid du de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so, for if arising is not accepted, it is illogical that it is the support.

original: yang na rgyu ma yin pa yang rten yin no zhes bya ba 'di khas len na de lta na yang 'bo ba'i chos can gyi chu la sogs pa rnams 'gro ba'i gags byed pa'i phyir sa phyogs la sogs brten du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yang na rgyu ma yin pa yang rten yin no zhes bya ba 'di khas len na de lta na yang 'bo ba'i chos can gyi chu la sogs pa rnams 'gro ba'i gags byed pa'i phyir sa phyogs la sogs brten du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Or if you accept that even that which is not a cause is a support, then even water and so on that are not the support of movement would be the support of movement because they obstruct the movement of water and so on.

original: 'gro ba dang bral ba'i yon tan rnams ji ltar rten yin /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang bral ba'i yon tan rnams ji ltar rten yin /
translated: But how could the qualities that are devoid of movement be a support?

original: rdzas 'bo ba'i gags byed ba'i phyir rten du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzas 'bo ba'i gags byed ba'i phyir rten du 'gyur ro //
translated: They would be a support because they obstruct the movement of substances.

original: yon tan la sogs pa ni byed pa med pa'i phyir 'bo ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan la sogs pa ni byed pa med pa'i phyir 'bo ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But qualities, etc. do not have a basis because they are not actions.

original: de bas na sems yon tan nam /
analyzed: de bas na sems yon tan nam /
translated: Therefore, the mind is not the basis of the body, which is a quality,

original: las sam / spyir gyur pa'i rten lus ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: las sam / spyir gyur pa'i rten lus ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: an action, or a universal.

original: sems la 'gro ba med kyang yon tan yin pa'i phyir so sor nges pa'i lus la brten pa ma yin nam /üîΩde log na ldog ste /üîΩdper na ldog ste /
analyzed: sems la 'gro ba med kyang yon tan yin pa'i phyir so sor nges pa'i lus la brten pa ma yin nam / de log na ldog ste / dper na ldog ste /
translated: But the mind is not the basis of a particular body, because it is a quality, even though it does not move.üîΩWhen the body is destroyed, the mind is destroyed, just as when a pot is destroyed, its capacity is destroyed.

original: dper na gzugs rang gi rten zhig na 'jig pa bzhin /
analyzed: dper na gzugs rang gi rten zhig na 'jig pa bzhin /
translated: For example, when the support of form is destroyed, the form is destroyed.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:üîΩThe cause of the combination of the twoüîΩis the body.

original: des ni 'phrod pa dang // 'phrod pa 'du ba'i rgyu dang ni //
analyzed: des ni 'phrod pa dang // 'phrod pa 'du ba'i rgyu dang ni //
translated: The arrangement of the body,

original: rigs la sogs pa'i rnam gzhag nyid @331a * //üîΩrten med phyir na gsal ba yin //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa'i rnam gzhag nyid @331a * // rten med phyir na gsal ba yin //
translated: the qualities, and the actionsüîΩis not possible without a basis.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúbasis‚Äù means a self.

original: 'dis ni 'gro ba med par rten dang / brten pa rtag par rigs pa ni ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'gro ba med par rten dang / brten pa rtag par rigs pa ni ma yin zhing /
translated: This shows that it is not reasonable for the body, which is the basis, and the mind, which is based on it, to be permanent and not to move.

original: yon tan med pa la rten med do zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan med pa la rten med do zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: And it shows that a self is not the basis of the qualities, because it is not a basis.

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po spangs pa de dag gis ni 'phrod pa 'du ba yang gsal ba dang / 'du ba'i rgyu yang gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po spangs pa de dag gis ni 'phrod pa 'du ba yang gsal ba dang / 'du ba'i rgyu yang gsal ba yin te /
translated: By these, the contact of the conjunction is clear, and the cause of the conjunction is clear.

original: 'di ltar 'du ba yin na rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du ba yin na rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Thus, if there is a conjunction, it is not the relation of support and the supported.

original: cig car yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they exist simultaneously.

original: 'on te 'du ba ma yin na de'i tshe 'phrod pa 'du ba'i rgyu nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te 'du ba ma yin na de'i tshe 'phrod pa 'du ba'i rgyu nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if there is no conjunction, then the cause of the contact of the conjunction does not exist.

original: rigs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa ste /
translated: The class, etc.

original: sogs ba'i sgras ni nam mkha' dang / 'gro ba dang gcig pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs ba'i sgras ni nam mkha' dang / 'gro ba dang gcig pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to space, the one nature of the goer, etc.

original: rnam gzhag nyid ni rdzas la brten pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam gzhag nyid ni rdzas la brten pa nyid de /
translated: The very arrangement is based on substance.

original: 'bras bu nyid ma gtogs par rten du brjod pa gang yin pa de yang gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ma gtogs par rten du brjod pa gang yin pa de yang gsal ba yin no //
translated: Whatever is said to be the support, except for the effect, that also is the manifest.

original: gal te yang rigs la sogs pa rten pa nyid yin yang rdzas la sogs pa so sor nges pa gnas pa nyid bkag pa ste /
analyzed: gal te yang rigs la sogs pa rten pa nyid yin yang rdzas la sogs pa so sor nges pa gnas pa nyid bkag pa ste /
translated: Even if the class, etc. are the supported, the individual determination of substance, etc. is still refuted as the very support.

original: 'di ltar gsal ba la brten pa'i rig gsal ba'i khyad par so sor nges pa nyid la brten pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsal ba la brten pa'i rig gsal ba'i khyad par so sor nges pa nyid la brten pa ni ma yin te /
translated: In this way, the difference between the clarity of the dependent consciousness and the clarity of the awareness of the self-knowing mind is not based on the individual ascertainment of the clarity of the dependent consciousness.üîΩ

original: gsal ba gzhan gyi yang rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan gyi yang rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the difference between the clarity of consciousness and the clarity of the object is not based on the individual ascertainment of the object, because the clarity of the object is also present in other objects.

original: de bzhin du lus la brten pa'i sems lus med kyang lus gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus la brten pa'i sems lus med kyang lus gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the mind that is based on the body is not present in the body, but it is present in other bodies.

original: de bas na 'jig rten pha rol ma grub ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten pha rol ma grub ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the world beyond is not unestablished.

original: de'i phyir bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa la ma gtogs par gang la yang rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa la ma gtogs par gang la yang rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, apart from the produced and the producer, there is no other entity that is the basis and the based.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gzhan las dngos po 'jig na ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gzhan las dngos po 'jig na ni //
translated: If an entity is destroyed by another,

original: de yi gnas rgyus ci zhig bya //
analyzed: de yi gnas rgyus ci zhig bya //
translated: what function does the cause of its endurance perform?

original: de gzhan med par 'jig na yang //
analyzed: de gzhan med par 'jig na yang //
translated: If it is destroyed without another,

original: gnas pa'i rgyu rnams nus med 'gyur //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu rnams nus med 'gyur //
translated: the causes of its endurance are powerless.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: gal te tho ba la sogs pa gzhan nyid las dngos po 'jig na ni /
analyzed: gal te tho ba la sogs pa gzhan nyid las dngos po 'jig na ni /
translated: if an entity is destroyed by another, such as a hammer,

original: de'i tshe 'bras bu'i rdzas de'i yon tan la sogs pa de'i gnas pa'i rgyu rten gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bras bu'i rdzas de'i yon tan la sogs pa de'i gnas pa'i rgyu rten gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: At that time, what would be the point of the cause of endurance of the substance of the effect, such as its qualities and so on?

original: 'on te rdzas la sogs pa de ni mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba rnams med par yang 'jig bar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'on te rdzas la sogs pa de ni mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba rnams med par yang 'jig bar 'gyur na ni /
translated: But if that substance and so on would be destroyed even without the application of opposing conditions,

original: de ltar na'o na ni rang gi rgyu nyid las 'jig par 'byung ba'i phyir rdzas la sogs pa rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu skyed pa'i rdzas rnams la nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na'o na ni rang gi rgyu nyid las 'jig par 'byung ba'i phyir rdzas la sogs pa rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu skyed pa'i rdzas rnams la nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then in that case, because it would arise from its own cause, the substance that generates the cause of the endurance of substance and so on would be without efficacy.

original: 'di dag gis ni yon tan la sogs pa 'gro ba dang bral ba rnams la rten med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni yon tan la sogs pa 'gro ba dang bral ba rnams la rten med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: These arguments demonstrate that qualities and so on that are devoid of motion have no basis.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that if they have a basis and substance, they would never be destroyed,

original: de ni dngos po dang rten dang bcas @331b pa nyid yin na gang la yang 'jig par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩrten bcas thams cad gnas ldan pas //
analyzed: de ni dngos po dang rten dang bcas @331b pa nyid yin na gang la yang 'jig par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir / rten bcas thams cad gnas ldan pas //
translated: it is said:üîΩAll that has a basis endures.

original: skye ba can kun rten bcas yin //
analyzed: skye ba can kun rten bcas yin //
translated: All that arises has a basis.

original: de phyir dngos po thams cad ni //
analyzed: de phyir dngos po thams cad ni //
translated: Therefore, all things

original: nam yang 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: would never be destroyed.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here it is said:

original: dngos po gang cung zad gnas pa dang ldan pa de thams cad rten dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po gang cung zad gnas pa dang ldan pa de thams cad rten dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Whatever things exist, all of them are supported,

original: rten dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they function together with a support.

original: skye ba thams cad kyang rten dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba thams cad kyang rten dang bcas pa ste /
translated: And all that is produced is supported,

original: skye ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar rang gi rgyu yod pa dang / 'du ba ni skye ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba can yin pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar rang gi rgyu yod pa dang / 'du ba ni skye ba ste /
translated: because it has a cause.

original: des na gang cung zad skye ba de thams cad rang gi rgyu la brten pa'o //
analyzed: des na gang cung zad skye ba de thams cad rang gi rgyu la brten pa'o //
translated: Thus, whatever is produced is supported by its cause.

original: de'i phyir rdul phra rab la sogs pa rgyu rtag pa la gnas pas ji ltar de la brten pa'i 'bras bu thams cad 'jig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phra rab la sogs pa rgyu rtag pa la gnas pas ji ltar de la brten pa'i 'bras bu thams cad 'jig par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, how could the effect that is supported by a permanent cause, such as a subtle particle, be destroyed?

original: 'di ltar rten zhig pa nyid na 'jig par rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rten zhig pa nyid na 'jig par rigs te /
translated: For it is reasonable that what is destroyed is destroyed when its support is destroyed.

original: gzhan du na rten du mi rung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na rten du mi rung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be reasonable for it to be a support.

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po thams cad 'gegs pa bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po thams cad 'gegs pa bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: A concluding verse on the refutation of the relation of support and supported in all things:

original: gal te rang 'jig ngang tshul bdag / yin na de gnas byed gzhan gang //
analyzed: gal te rang 'jig ngang tshul bdag / yin na de gnas byed gzhan gang //
translated: If the self has the character of self-destruction, what other thing makes it endure?üîΩIf the self does not have the character of self-destruction, what other thing makes it endure?

original: gal te rang 'jig ngang tshul bdag / min na de gnas byed gzhan gang //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te rang 'jig ngang tshul bdag / min na de gnas byed gzhan gang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: If things have the character of self-destruction,üîΩthen what other thing makes them endure?üîΩIf things have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?üîΩIf things have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?üîΩIf things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa'i ngang tshul gyi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po yin pa de lta na yang /üîΩde'i gnas par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa'i ngang tshul gyi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po yin pa de lta na yang / de'i gnas par byed pa ste /
translated: If things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?

original: gnas pa'i rgyu gzhan gang zhig yod de /üîΩmed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu gzhan gang zhig yod de / med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?üîΩIf things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?

original: 'on te rang nyid 'jig pa'i ngang tshul gyi bdag nyid can ma yin pa de lta na yang /üîΩrang nyid gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te rang nyid 'jig pa'i ngang tshul gyi bdag nyid can ma yin pa de lta na yang / rang nyid gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: If things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?üîΩIf things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?üîΩIf things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?üîΩIf things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?üîΩIf things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?üîΩIf things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?üîΩIf things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?

original: dngos po la gzhan gnas pa'i rgyu yis ci zhig bya /üîΩde ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: dngos po la gzhan gnas pa'i rgyu yis ci zhig bya / de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: If things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?üîΩIf things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?üîΩIf things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?üîΩIf things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?üîΩIf things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?

original: sgron ma dang / 'od dag gzhi dang / gzhi can ma yin yang rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: sgron ma dang / 'od dag gzhi dang / gzhi can ma yin yang rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: If things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?üîΩIf things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what other thing makes them endure?üîΩIf things do not have the character of self-destruction, then what

original: 'od 'bo pa'i gnas ma yin yang gang gis de'i rten sgron mar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od 'bo pa'i gnas ma yin yang gang gis de'i rten sgron mar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it is not the basis of the light, it becomes the support of the light.

original: 'on kyang sgron ma la rten gyi dngos po yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sgron ma la rten gyi dngos po yin te /
translated: However, the light is the support of the lamp,

original: de log na 'od ldog gi sgron ma gzhan la 'bo pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de log na 'od ldog gi sgron ma gzhan la 'bo pa ni ma yin no //
translated: because when the lamp is overturned, the light is overturned, but not the other way around.

original: de bzhin du lus la brten pa'i shes pa yang lus log na de yang ldog par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus la brten pa'i shes pa yang lus log na de yang ldog par 'dod kyi /
translated: In the same way, it is accepted that when the body is overturned, the consciousness that is based on the body is overturned.

original: 'di na sgron la 'pho ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di na sgron la 'pho ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But in this case, the light is not overturned when the lamp is overturned.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: lus kyi 'phel 'grib med par yang //
analyzed: lus kyi 'phel 'grib med par yang //
translated: Even without the body increasing or decreasing,

original: blo yis byed pa'i khyad par gyis //
analyzed: blo yis byed pa'i khyad par gyis //
translated: due to the difference in the mind‚Äôs activity,

original: shes rab la sogs phul byung zhing //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs phul byung zhing //
translated: wisdom and so on will be excellent

original: 'grib pa dag tu 'gyur ba yin //üîΩ'di ni sgron ma 'od la sogs//
analyzed: 'grib pa dag tu 'gyur ba yin // 'di ni sgron ma 'od la sogs//
translated: and will decrease.üîΩThis is not the case for the light of the lamp

original: @332a * // rten pa rnams la yod ma yin //
analyzed: @332a * // rten pa rnams la yod ma yin //
translated: and so on that are based on the body.

original: sems la phan pa mi 'dogs pas //
analyzed: sems la phan pa mi 'dogs pas //
translated: Since it does not benefit the mind,

original: de las khyad par du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de las khyad par du mi 'gyur /
translated: it does not become different from that.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: 'di'i don ni sgron ma'i 'od ni de 'gyur bas 'gyur ba'i phyir rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni sgron ma'i 'od ni de 'gyur bas 'gyur ba'i phyir rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of this is that the light of the lamp is the support and the supported because it changes and because it changes.

original: 'dir lus kyi yon tan 'phel ba dang 'grib pa ste lhag pa dang 'grib pa med par yang /
analyzed: 'dir lus kyi yon tan 'phel ba dang 'grib pa ste lhag pa dang 'grib pa med par yang /
translated: Here, the qualities of the body increase and decrease, that is, they do not remain the same.üîΩThis is due to the special activity of the mind, that is, due to the special formation.

original: blo'i bya ba'i khyad par gyis te 'du byed pa'i khyad par can gyi dbang gis shes rab dang / yid gzhungs ba'i la sogs pas 'phel ba dang / 'grib par 'gyur bas te /
analyzed: blo'i bya ba'i khyad par gyis te 'du byed pa'i khyad par can gyi dbang gis shes rab dang / yid gzhungs ba'i la sogs pas 'phel ba dang / 'grib par 'gyur bas te /
translated: Also, when wisdom and mental agility and so on increase and decrease,

original: gang yang lus 'du bya ba'i khyad par med par yang blo sbyangs bas shes rab la sogs pa mchog tu 'gro ba na /üîΩde'i tshe ji ltar lus la yid brten par rigs te de yod pa min par bstan pa'i phyir lus sbyangs pa med kyang 'di ste /
analyzed: gang yang lus 'du bya ba'i khyad par med par yang blo sbyangs bas shes rab la sogs pa mchog tu 'gro ba na / de'i tshe ji ltar lus la yid brten par rigs te de yod pa min par bstan pa'i phyir lus sbyangs pa med kyang 'di ste /
translated: then, even without a special formation of the body, when wisdom and so on become supreme through training the mind,üîΩat that time, how could it be logical for the mind to depend on the body?

original: sngon du blo sbyangs pa'i khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyi sems gang yin pa de ltar /
analyzed: sngon du blo sbyangs pa'i khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyi sems gang yin pa de ltar /
translated: To demonstrate that this is not the case, it is said that even without training the body, the mind that follows the special training of the mindüîΩis like that.

original: sgron ma la sogs pa'i chos can rnams la yod pa ma yin no//
analyzed: sgron ma la sogs pa'i chos can rnams la yod pa ma yin no//
translated: It does not exist in phenomena such as lamps.

original: 'di ltar sbrul gyi sgron ma'i 'od 'gyur bar byed kyi de'i rten na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbrul gyi sgron ma'i 'od 'gyur bar byed kyi de'i rten na ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the light of a lamp is transformed by a snake, but not its support.

original: sgron ma ma bslad par yang /
analyzed: sgron ma ma bslad par yang /
translated: Even if the lamp is not transformed,üîΩisn‚Äôt the light transformed by a snake and so on?

original: 'od sbrul la sogs pa rnams kyis 'gyur ba nyid ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'od sbrul la sogs pa rnams kyis 'gyur ba nyid ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: mar me nyid gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: mar me nyid gyur pa yin te /
translated: The lamp itself is transformed.

original: 'od mi gsal pa'i mtshan nyid can du byed pas de bas na sgron ma gyur pas /
analyzed: 'od mi gsal pa'i mtshan nyid can du byed pas de bas na sgron ma gyur pas /
translated: Since it is made to have the characteristic of unclear light, therefore, the lamp is transformed.

original: ring du 'phro ba'i 'od 'gyur par byed do //
analyzed: ring du 'phro ba'i 'od 'gyur par byed do //
translated: It makes the light that shines far away be transformed.

original: bcud kyis len la sogs pa rnams kyis lus khyad par can du byas na shes rab la sogs pa khyad par can du snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bcud kyis len la sogs pa rnams kyis lus khyad par can du byas na shes rab la sogs pa khyad par can du snang ba'i phyir /
translated: If the body is transformed by elixirs and so on, since wisdom and so on appear to be transformed,

original: lus nye bar len pa'am rten du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: lus nye bar len pa'am rten du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: the body becomes the appropriator or the support of that.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: sems la phan 'dogs par mi byed na /
analyzed: sems la phan 'dogs par mi byed na /
translated: If it does not benefit the mind,

original: bcud gyis len la sogs pas sbyangs pa'i lus de las kyang shes rab la sogs pa khyad par du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcud gyis len la sogs pas sbyangs pa'i lus de las kyang shes rab la sogs pa khyad par du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Also, wisdom and so on do not become distinctive on the basis of a body purified by means of elixirs and so on.

original: bcud kyis len la sogs pas bcos pa'i lus las sems la phan btags pa'i sgo nyid kyis shes rab la sogs pas da par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bcud kyis len la sogs pas bcos pa'i lus las sems la phan btags pa'i sgo nyid kyis shes rab la sogs pas da par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The point is that wisdom and so on are enhanced by the mind being helped on the basis of a body modified by means of elixirs and so on.

original: 'di ltar bcud kyis len la sogs pa brten pas yid mi 'khrugs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcud kyis len la sogs pa brten pas yid mi 'khrugs te /
translated: Thus, by relying on elixirs and so on, the mind is not disturbed.

original: ji ltar sngar myong ba'i 'du byed sad pa las 'ga' zhig kha cig tu shes rab khyad par can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sngar myong ba'i 'du byed sad pa las 'ga' zhig kha cig tu shes rab khyad par can du 'gyur ro //
translated: From the arousing of the formative predispositions experienced previously, wisdom becomes distinctive in some and not in others.

original: dper na bkres pas nyen pa na /
analyzed: dper na bkres pas nyen pa na /
translated: For example, when afflicted by hunger,

original: chos bshad pa 'khrug pa nyid la sogs pa 'byung la /
analyzed: chos bshad pa 'khrug pa nyid la sogs pa 'byung la /
translated: the explanation of the Dharma is disturbed and so on.

original: bkres pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa zhi ba na /
analyzed: bkres pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa zhi ba na /
translated: When the harm of hunger and so on is pacified,

original: @332b sngar goms pa'i bshad pa 'jug par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: @332b sngar goms pa'i bshad pa 'jug par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: the previously familiar explanation is engaged.

original: gal te yang bcud kyis len la sogs pa brten na /
analyzed: gal te yang bcud kyis len la sogs pa brten na /
translated: If one relies on elixirs and so on,

original: sngar med pa'i sems g-yer bag can du 'jug pa de'i tshe kha cig gis shes rab phul du 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: sngar med pa'i sems g-yer bag can du 'jug pa de'i tshe kha cig gis shes rab phul du 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: At that time, some will have excellent wisdom.

original: kha cig gis de bzhin par gnas pa 'di ni nges pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig gis de bzhin par gnas pa 'di ni nges pa ste /
translated: At that time, some people have excellent wisdom, while others remain as they were. This is certain.

original: bcud kyis len gyi sbyor ba mtshungs pa'i phyir de ltar mi 'gyur zhing bstan bcos la thams cad kyis 'dris par gyur pa las kyang /
analyzed: bcud kyis len gyi sbyor ba mtshungs pa'i phyir de ltar mi 'gyur zhing bstan bcos la thams cad kyis 'dris par gyur pa las kyang /
translated: It is not so, because the application of the elixir is the same.

original: ci'i phyir bstan bcos las nges pa med par shes par snang /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bstan bcos las nges pa med par shes par snang /
translated: In that case, why is it seen that there is no certainty in the treatises?

original: de bas na sngar goms par byas pa gang yin pa de shes par bcud kyis len la sogs pas bag chags sad par byed par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sngar goms par byas pa gang yin pa de shes par bcud kyis len la sogs pas bag chags sad par byed par nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that whatever was previously cultivated is activated by the elixir and so on.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa blo'i ngo bo nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa blo'i ngo bo nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Aren‚Äôt desire and so on the nature of the mind?

original: de rnams kyang bcud kyis len la sogs pas lus rgyas na /
analyzed: de rnams kyang bcud kyis len la sogs pas lus rgyas na /
translated: If they are nourished by the elixir and so on,

original: gsal zhing 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin blo yang lus la brten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal zhing 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin blo yang lus la brten par 'gyur ro //
translated: they become clear and increase. Therefore, like desire and so on, the mind also depends on the body.

original: de lta ma yin na de'i rjes su 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de'i rjes su 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it were not so, then it would not follow it.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: chags sogs lus rgyas la sogs pas //
analyzed: chags sogs lus rgyas la sogs pas //
translated: because attachment, etc. increase through the growth of the body, etc.

original: 'phel zhing res 'ga' bde sdug las //üîΩskye ste de dag khams snyoms pa //üîΩla sogs nang don nye phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phel zhing res 'ga' bde sdug las // skye ste de dag khams snyoms pa // la sogs nang don nye phyir ro //
translated: and sometimes arise from pleasure and pain,

original: zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba las /
translated: because the internal sense-fields are more intimate.

original: lus rgyas pa la sogs pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa 'phel ba ni thams cad du ma yin gyi 'on kyang res 'ga' ba nyid de /
analyzed: lus rgyas pa la sogs pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa 'phel ba ni thams cad du ma yin gyi 'on kyang res 'ga' ba nyid de /
translated: From the growth of the body, etc. attachment, etc. increase, but not always; rather, it is only sometimes.

original: gang gi tshe tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la mngon du phyogs pa na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la mngon du phyogs pa na'o //
translated: When one is inclined toward incorrect mental activity.

original: gang zhig mi sdug pa sgom pa de la ni de nyid bzlog nas chags pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig mi sdug pa sgom pa de la ni de nyid bzlog nas chags pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: For one who cultivates the contemplation of the foul, attachment is eliminated and does not arise.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'phel bde yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal bdag las kyang skye ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'phel bde yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal bdag las kyang skye ste /
translated: Moreover, attachment, etc. increase from pleasure and pain.

original: bde ba myong na 'dod chags 'phel la /
analyzed: bde ba myong na 'dod chags 'phel la /
translated: When one experiences pleasure, attachment increases.

original: sdug bsngal myong ba ni zhe sdang skye par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong ba ni zhe sdang skye par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one experiences pain, aversion arises.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal ba las zhe sdang skye zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal ba las zhe sdang skye zhe na /
translated: How can hatred arise from suffering?

original: nyon mongs pas ni thams cad mi phod de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas ni thams cad mi phod de /
translated: Hatred is not possible in the presence of all defilements,

original: sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod ba 'di dag nyid ni zhe sdang kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod ba 'di dag nyid ni zhe sdang kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the desire to be separated from suffering is itself hatred.

original: 'dir sdug bsngal bar gyur na zhe sdang skye zhes nges pa ni med de /
analyzed: 'dir sdug bsngal bar gyur na zhe sdang skye zhes nges pa ni med de /
translated: Here, it is not certain that hatred arises when suffering occurs,

original: yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa sdug bsngal bar gyur kyang /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa sdug bsngal bar gyur kyang /
translated: because those who possess complete knowledge, even though they experience suffering,

original: rang sdug bsngal myong ba las gzhan gyi sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa lhag par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: rang sdug bsngal myong ba las gzhan gyi sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa lhag par 'jug pa'i phyir ro // de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: are engaged in the desire to be separated from the suffering of others, which is greater than their own suffering.

original: blo'i ngo bo nyid bde ba dang sdug @333a * //
analyzed: blo'i ngo bo nyid bde ba dang sdug @333a * //
translated: This is so, but if pleasure and pain are the intrinsic nature of consciousness,

original: bsngal ba yin na ni gal te blo las lus skye ba bzhin lus las kyang blo nyid skye bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: bsngal ba yin na ni gal te blo las lus skye ba bzhin lus las kyang blo nyid skye bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then just as the body arises from consciousness, so consciousness would arise from the body.

original: de ni ma yin te bde ba dang / sdug bsngal de dag khams snyoms pa las kyang 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te bde ba dang / sdug bsngal de dag khams snyoms pa las kyang 'byung ste /
translated: This is not so, because pleasure and pain arise from the equilibrium of the elements.

original: sogs pa'i sgras khams ma snyoms pa bzung ste /üîΩrgyu de las nang gi don reg bya'i bye brag gang zhig nye ba de las 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras khams ma snyoms pa bzung ste / rgyu de las nang gi don reg bya'i bye brag gang zhig nye ba de las 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the humors of the body that are not in balance.üîΩFrom these causes, whatever specific tangible object is present, pleasure increases.

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni nang gi reg bya'i bye brag la dmigs nas bde ba skye'i /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni nang gi reg bya'i bye brag la dmigs nas bde ba skye'i /
translated: The intended meaning is that pleasure arises in dependence on a specific tangible object that is present internally,

original: rten gyi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten gyi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: not in dependence on a physical basis.

original: de bas na lus rten du gyur pa las bde ba dang sdug bsngal bskyed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na lus rten du gyur pa las bde ba dang sdug bsngal bskyed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, pleasure and pain are not produced by the body as a physical basis.

original: 'on kyang yul du gyur ba las so //
analyzed: 'on kyang yul du gyur ba las so //
translated: Rather, they are produced by a specific object.

original: yul yin pas bde ba la sogs pa rgyu nyid kyi phyir gyi rten yin na ni phyir rol la yang yul yin pas rten du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul yin pas bde ba la sogs pa rgyu nyid kyi phyir gyi rten yin na ni phyir rol la yang yul yin pas rten du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If pleasure, etc., were produced by a physical basis, then external objects would also be physical bases, because they are objects.

original: gang gi tshe nang gi bye brag dmigs pa yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa mthong ba de'i tshe bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag phyi rol la brten par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nang gi bye brag dmigs pa yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa mthong ba de'i tshe bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag phyi rol la brten par 'gyur gyi /
translated: When a specific internal object, such as a pleasant visual form, is seen, then pleasure and pain are said to be based on external objects.

original: yul rten ni ma yin zhing de log na ldog pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yul rten ni ma yin zhing de log na ldog pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But they are not physical bases, and they do not cease when the body ceases.

original: ji ltar nang gi yul la bde ba 'byung ba ngo bor nas sdug pa yid du 'ong ba de mthong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ltar nang gi yul la bde ba 'byung ba ngo bor nas sdug pa yid du 'ong ba de mthong ba'i tshe /
translated: Just as one sees the arising of pleasure in an internal object as a pleasant, attractive entity,

original: phyi rol gyi yul la 'pho ba de bzhin du 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa'i lus gzhan la bde ba 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul la 'pho ba de bzhin du 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa'i lus gzhan la bde ba 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: so too one transfers pleasure to another body in a future world and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa'i stobs kyis rnam par shes pa skye ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i stobs kyis rnam par shes pa skye ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt consciousness produced by the power of the eye and so on?

original: rab rib la sogs pas bsgyur ba'i mig gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rab rib la sogs pas bsgyur ba'i mig gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the eye is transformed by cataracts and so on,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa de la brten pa yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du 'dus pa'i nad kyis bsgyur ba'i lus la yid 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa de la brten pa yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du 'dus pa'i nad kyis bsgyur ba'i lus la yid 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: the eye consciousness is based on it. Just as the mind is transformed by the illness of the body,

original: de'i stobs kyis bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir yid lus la brten pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir yid lus la brten pa'o zhe na /
translated: the mind is based on the body because it is produced by its power.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩdes ni 'dus pa la sogs las //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / des ni 'dus pa la sogs las //
translated: Here we say:üîΩBy that, memory loss and so on

original: dran pa nyams pa la sogs bshad //üîΩnang gi khyad par las skye ba'i //
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa la sogs bshad // nang gi khyad par las skye ba'i //
translated: are explained from the collection and so on.üîΩThe mind itself is transformed

original: blo nyid 'gyur bar byed pa yin //
analyzed: blo nyid 'gyur bar byed pa yin //
translated: by the arising of internal differences.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal las skyes pa nyid du bstan pa des ni dran pa nyams pa la sogs pa yang bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal las skyes pa nyid du bstan pa des ni dran pa nyams pa la sogs pa yang bshad pa yin te /
translated: The statement that desire, etc. arise from pleasure and pain also explains the loss of mindfulness, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni glen pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni glen pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes stupidity, distraction, etc.

original: der yang 'dus pa la sogs pas nang gi don gyi khyad par la dmigs pa'i blo nyid kyis yid 'gyur ba skyed par byed pa yin gyi lus ni ma yin te /
analyzed: der yang 'dus pa la sogs pas nang gi don gyi khyad par la dmigs pa'i blo nyid kyis yid 'gyur ba skyed par byed pa yin gyi lus ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the internal sense base is the mind that observes the specific internal object, and it generates the transformation of the mind, not the body,

original: lus @333b 'dus pa la sogs pas bsgyur ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus @333b 'dus pa la sogs pas bsgyur ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that the body, as a collection, etc. is the basis of the mental consciousness.

original: mig la sogs pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang de gyur na 'gyur ba'i phyir rten gyi dngos po yin gyi /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang de gyur na 'gyur ba'i phyir rten gyi dngos po yin gyi /
translated: The eyes, etc. are the basis because they are concomitant with the mental consciousness, and when they change, it changes.

original: lus ni rten gyi dngos por mi rigs te /
analyzed: lus ni rten gyi dngos por mi rigs te /
translated: But it is not tenable that the body is the basis of the mental consciousness.

original: lus 'gyur ba med par yang srin po la sogs pa mthong ba las dran pa nyams pa la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus 'gyur ba med par yang srin po la sogs pa mthong ba las dran pa nyams pa la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even without a change in the body, one can see a rƒÅk·π£asa and so on, and then memory and so on will be impaired.

original: phyi rol la dmigs nas kyang ji ltar yid 'gyur ba yin zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / dper na sngar ma'i rgyud kha cig / khrag sogs stag la sogs pa dag //
analyzed: phyi rol la dmigs nas kyang ji ltar yid 'gyur ba yin zhe na / smras pa / dper na sngar ma'i rgyud kha cig / khrag sogs stag la sogs pa dag //
translated: How can the mind change when it observes external objects?üîΩIt is like the following analogy:üîΩSome people, when they hear the words ‚Äútiger‚Äù and so on,

original: mthong ba dang ni thos pa las //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ni thos pa las //
translated: or see blood and so on,

original: rmongs pa la sogs 'byung ba bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rmongs pa la sogs 'byung ba bzhin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: become confused and so on.

original: dper na stag dang / sha za la sogs pa thos pa dang / khrag dang bu shi ba la sogs pa mthong ba las shin tu sngar ma'i skyes bu kha cig rmongs ba la sogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na stag dang / sha za la sogs pa thos pa dang / khrag dang bu shi ba la sogs pa mthong ba las shin tu sngar ma'i skyes bu kha cig rmongs ba la sogs par 'gyur te /
translated: For example, some people, when they hear the words ‚Äútiger‚Äù and ‚Äúpi≈õƒÅca‚Äù and so on, or see blood and the death of a child and so on, become confused and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras yid g-yeng ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras yid g-yeng ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include distraction and so on.üîΩSince it is not based on external blood, even when that is removed, the mind is not removed.

original: phyi rol gyi khrag la brten pa ni ma yin pas de log kyang yid mi ldog pa de bzhin du nang gi don la dmigs pa nye ba las /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi khrag la brten pa ni ma yin pas de log kyang yid mi ldog pa de bzhin du nang gi don la dmigs pa nye ba las /
translated: In the same way, when the internal object is observed, the mind is not removed.

original: 'dus pa la sogs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: 'dus pa la sogs pa'i dus na /
translated: because at the time of the assembly, etc.,

original: dran pa nyams pa la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir blo lus la brtan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir blo lus la brtan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: the mind is not stable in the body, because of the loss of memory, etc.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig 'dus byas nyid //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig 'dus byas nyid //
translated: Therefore, the mind is dependent on the body,

original: nges par rjes su 'jug pa yi //üîΩsems ni de med mi 'byung ste //
analyzed: nges par rjes su 'jug pa yi // sems ni de med mi 'byung ste //
translated: because the mind definitely follows the conditionedüîΩand does not occur without it.

original: de'i phyir sems la brten pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems la brten pa'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind is conditioned, not the body.üîΩWhat is the mind?

original: sems gang zhig 'dus byas par nges par rjes su 'jug pa ni sems yin gyi lus ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems gang zhig 'dus byas par nges par rjes su 'jug pa ni sems yin gyi lus ni ma yin te /
translated: That mind which definitely follows the conditioned is the mind, not the body,

original: rten nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not appear as the support.

original: yul gzhan la yengs pa'i sems ni yul gzhan la gal te tha mi dad na ni de'i tshe rma mthong na sdug bsngal yang dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan la yengs pa'i sems ni yul gzhan la gal te tha mi dad na ni de'i tshe rma mthong na sdug bsngal yang dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mind distracted by another object is not different from the mind that sees the wound, then at that time, the mind that sees the wound would also perceive the suffering.

original: 'o na gal te srog chags rnams 'byung ba chen po tsam las ma skyes kyi /
analyzed: 'o na gal te srog chags rnams 'byung ba chen po tsam las ma skyes kyi /
translated: If living beings are not born from the great elements alone,

original: 'on kyang skye bo gzhan nas 'ongs pa yin na de'i tshe mi gtsang ba'i phyogs su skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang skye bo gzhan nas 'ongs pa yin na de'i tshe mi gtsang ba'i phyogs su skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: but come from another person, then they would not be born in an impure place.

original: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba ni gnas ngan par 'ong ba byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dbang phyug gis bskul nas srog chags gnas ngan pa len par yang mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba ni gnas ngan par 'ong ba byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dbang phyug gis bskul nas srog chags gnas ngan pa len par yang mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: And it is not reasonable that a living being would take up an unfortunate realm of life when impelled by God.

original: 'dir lan btab pa /
analyzed: 'dir lan btab pa /
translated: Here is the reply:

original: bdag la chags pa dang ldan pas //
analyzed: bdag la chags pa dang ldan pas //
translated: Because of attachment to self,

original: bde sdug dor thob 'dod pa yis //
analyzed: bde sdug dor thob 'dod pa yis //
translated: one desires to obtain pleasure and avoid pain,

original: sems can gzhan gyis bkri min par //
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyis bkri min par //
translated: and so, not led by other sentient beings,

original: dman pa'i gnas ni yongs su len //üîΩsdug bsngal phyin ci log @334a * //
analyzed: dman pa'i gnas ni yongs su len // sdug bsngal phyin ci log @334a * //
translated: one takes up an inferior realm of life.üîΩThe cause of the bondage of cyclic existence is

original: blo dang // srid pa'i 'ching ba rgyu yin te //
analyzed: blo dang // srid pa'i 'ching ba rgyu yin te //
translated: the mind that is distorted with regard to sufferingüîΩand the desire to obtain pleasure.

original: skye bo gang la de med pa //
analyzed: skye bo gang la de med pa //
translated: One who is free of these

original: de ni skye ba mi len to //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni skye ba mi len to // zhes bya ba la /
translated: does not take up birth.

original: sems can gzhan gyis khrid pa ma yin pas sems can gzhan gyis bkri ba min pa'i srog chags de dman pa'i gnas can mngal du yongs su len bar bdag la chags pa gang la yod pa de /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyis khrid pa ma yin pas sems can gzhan gyis bkri ba min pa'i srog chags de dman pa'i gnas can mngal du yongs su len bar bdag la chags pa gang la yod pa de /
translated: The living being who is not led by other sentient beings, who is not led by other sentient beings, takes up an inferior realm of life, a womb, where there is attachment to self.

original: ci rigs par bde ba dang sdug bsngal dor ba dang thob par 'dod pa gang yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci rigs par bde ba dang sdug bsngal dor ba dang thob par 'dod pa gang yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: and it is the desire to avoid or obtain pleasure and pain as appropriate.

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni gal te rtog pa po dang ldan pa yin na de'i tshe rang la rang gi ngo bo rtogs kyi thob par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni gal te rtog pa po dang ldan pa yin na de'i tshe rang la rang gi ngo bo rtogs kyi thob par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is this: if the thinker is endowed with a self, then at that time it is its own nature that is cognized, not something to be obtained.

original: des na su yang grong la sogs pa gang du yang 'jug par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des na su yang grong la sogs pa gang du yang 'jug par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, no one would enter any town, etc.

original: 'khor ba pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'khor ba pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: because there would be no transmigrator, as has already been explained.

original: 'on kyang 'bras bu 'dod pas ci zhig ltar grong la sogs par 'gro ba'i rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'bras bu 'dod pas ci zhig ltar grong la sogs par 'gro ba'i rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can ni ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not the case that the one who desires the result is the one who previously had the thought to go to the town, etc.

original: de lta na bdag la chags pas bskul ba yang dman pa'i gnas len par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de lta na bdag la chags pas bskul ba yang dman pa'i gnas len par 'gyur te ;
translated: In that case, one who is impelled by attachment to the self would take up an inferior state,

original: dman pa yang phyin ci log gi dbang gis len par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dman pa yang phyin ci log gi dbang gis len par 'gyur ro //
translated: and even an inferior person would take it up by the power of error.

original: 'di lta bu yang 'dir las kyi nus pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di lta bu yang 'dir las kyi nus pa nyid de /
translated: This is also the power of karma here.

original: gang gis sems can gzhan gyis ma bkris par yang gzhan gyis bskul ba bzhin dman pa'i gnas su 'gro ste /
analyzed: gang gis sems can gzhan gyis ma bkris par yang gzhan gyis bskul ba bzhin dman pa'i gnas su 'gro ste /
translated: Even without being urged by others, sentient beings go to inferior states as if urged by others.

original: 'di ltar dman pa'i len pa yang sdug bsngal spang bar 'dod pa dang / bde ba blang bar 'dod nas dge sbyong smad 'tshong ma'i khyim du 'gro ba bzhin du 'byung ngo //
