analyzed: 'di ltar dman pa'i len pa yang sdug bsngal spang bar 'dod pa dang / bde ba blang bar 'dod nas dge sbyong smad 'tshong ma'i khyim du 'gro ba bzhin du 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, even the acceptance of an inferior state occurs because of the desire to abandon suffering and the desire to obtain happiness, just like a religious mendicant who goes to the house of a prostitute.

original: dbang phyug gis bskul ba ni ji ltar dman pa'i gnas len par mi rigs pa de bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: dbang phyug gis bskul ba ni ji ltar dman pa'i gnas len par mi rigs pa de bzhin du bstan to //
translated: It has been demonstrated that it is not reasonable that God urges one to accept an inferior state.

original: de'i phyir bdag la chags pa nyid ni dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag la chags pa nyid ni dbang phyug ste /
translated: Therefore, the one who is attached to the self is God.

original: des bskul ba'o //
analyzed: des bskul ba'o //
translated: He urges one to accept an inferior state.

original: gal te rang dbang can dang / mi gtsang ba'i gnas su shes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rang dbang can dang / mi gtsang ba'i gnas su shes pa ma yin nam /
translated: If he is independent and not a locus of impurity, how does he engage in action?

original: ji ltar 'jug ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug ste /
translated: How does he engage in action?

original: mi shes na ni mi 'jug pa'i phyir ji ltar 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro zhe na /
analyzed: mi shes na ni mi 'jug pa'i phyir ji ltar 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro zhe na /
translated: If he does not know, he does not engage in action. How does he go to another world?

original: 'di ni gal te phyin ci log med na rigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni gal te phyin ci log med na rigs par 'gyur te /
translated: This would be reasonable if he were not mistaken.

original: gang gi phyir sdug bsngal la phyin ci log gi blo can te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sdug bsngal la phyin ci log gi blo can te /
translated: Because of the mind that is distorted with regard to suffering,

original: bde ba'i blo can dang sred pas bskul ba'i 'ching ba ni skye ba gzhan len pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i blo can dang sred pas bskul ba'i 'ching ba ni skye ba gzhan len pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: the fetters that are impelled by craving for pleasure are the cause for taking up another birth.

original: gang la srid pa dang phyin ci log gi blo de dag med pa 'di ni skye ba len par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la srid pa dang phyin ci log gi blo de dag med pa 'di ni skye ba len par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But when there is neither craving nor the mind that is distorted, one does not take up birth.

original: gal te 'gro 'ong ma mthong na //
analyzed: gal te 'gro 'ong ma mthong na //
translated: If you do not see going and coming,

original: dbang po mi gsal phyir mthong ba //üîΩma yin dper mig gsal min can //üîΩdu ba chung du mi dmigs bzhin //
analyzed: dbang po mi gsal phyir mthong ba // ma yin dper mig gsal min can // du ba chung du mi dmigs bzhin //
translated: it is not because of not seeing due to the indistinctness of the sense faculties,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: just as, for example, one does not see a small firefly due to the indistinctness of the eye.

original: gal te skye ba snga ma nas 'ongs shing /
analyzed: gal te skye ba snga ma nas 'ongs shing /
translated: Here, if one does not come from a previous birth

original: ma 'ongs ba'i skye @334b bar 'gro ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: ma 'ongs ba'i skye @334b bar 'gro ba ma yin nam /
translated: and does not go to a future birth,

original: de'i tshe 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag mthong bar 'gyur na //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag mthong bar 'gyur na //
translated: then going and coming would be seen.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag mthong ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag mthong ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But going and coming are not seen.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gal te yang 'gro 'ong ma mthong na yang de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang 'gro 'ong ma mthong na yang de lta mod kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúEven though going and coming are not seen, still they exist.

original: de dag med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not nonexistent.

original: dbang po rnams g-yer bag med pas mthong ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po rnams g-yer bag med pas mthong ba ste /
translated: The mind is seen to be dependent on the prior mind, because the mind does not occur without a mind.

original: dper na mig ni gsal ba can gyi du ba phra mo mi dmigs la skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na mig ni gsal ba can gyi du ba phra mo mi dmigs la skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, a subtle smoke is not perceived by the clear eye, because it does not exist.

original: sems ni sems med par mi 'byung bas sems snga ma la brten pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni sems med par mi 'byung bas sems snga ma la brten pa'o //
translated: The mind is dependent on the prior mind, because the mind does not occur without a mind.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe 'du byed pa stobs can du gyur pa de'i tshe g-yeng ba ldog par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe 'du byed pa stobs can du gyur pa de'i tshe g-yeng ba ldog par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, when the powerful formative forces occur, distraction is stopped.

original: gang gi tshe g-yeng ba stobs dang ldan pa de'i tshe 'du byed pa yod kyang rang dang mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skyed do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe g-yeng ba stobs dang ldan pa de'i tshe 'du byed pa yod kyang rang dang mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skyed do //
translated: When distraction is powerful, even though the formative forces exist, the consciousness that is in conformity with it does not arise.

original: de bas na sems ni sems snga ma'i rjes thogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na sems ni sems snga ma'i rjes thogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the mind is the immediate antecedent of the mind, because it is the immediate consequence of the prior mind.

original: sems kyi de ma thag pa yin pas de log pa nyid kyis de yang ldog par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi de ma thag pa yin pas de log pa nyid kyis de yang ldog par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that it is stopped by the cessation of that, because it is not stopped by the cessation of that.

original: 'o na sems ni sems kyi rten yin mod /
analyzed: 'o na sems ni sems kyi rten yin mod /
translated: Well, the mind is certainly the basis of the mind.

original: de lta na yang 'jig rten pha rol mi 'grub cing 'jig rten 'di sems la brten pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'jig rten pha rol mi 'grub cing 'jig rten 'di sems la brten pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa ste /
translated: Thus, although the existence of a future world is not established, the establishment of this world as based on mind is established.

original: pha ma'i sems la rten par 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pha ma'i sems la rten par 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is asserted that it is based on the mind of the parents.

original: 'jig rten pha rol gyi sems la brten pa ni ma nges pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol gyi sems la brten pa ni ma nges pa ste /
translated: But the establishment of the future world as based on mind is uncertain.

original: pha ma'i ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /üîΩde'i phyir gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: pha ma'i ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems na / de'i phyir gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because it follows the nature of the parents.üîΩIf you think this, then the root text states, ‚ÄúBut it is not certain that the child‚Äôs mind is the same as the parents‚Äô mind.‚Äù

original: gdon mi za bar pha dang ma'i ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar pha dang ma'i ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not certain that the child‚Äôs mind follows the nature of the parents‚Äô mind.

original: pha ma'i sems ma gyur par yang 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir dang / de dag gyur kyang mi 'gyur bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha ma'i sems ma gyur par yang 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir dang / de dag gyur kyang mi 'gyur bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we see that the child‚Äôs mind changes even when the parents‚Äô minds do not change, and we see that the child‚Äôs mind does not change even when the parents‚Äô minds change.

original: gal te yang pha ma'i 'du byed pa las byung na mkhas pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang pha ma'i 'du byed pa las byung na mkhas pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if the child‚Äôs mind arises from the parents‚Äô formative actions, then the child would possess the qualities of the parents‚Äô knowledge and so on.

original: de bas na rang gi rgyud la 'jug pa'i shes pa'i 'du byed pa sems la 'jug pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na rang gi rgyud la 'jug pa'i shes pa'i 'du byed pa sems la 'jug pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the instigation of the consciousness that enters one‚Äôs own continuum is the instigation of the mind.

original: rgyud gzhan gyi 'du byed la 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan gyi 'du byed la 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the instigation of the continuum of another.

original: mkhan po'i 'du byed slob ma la 'jug par mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mkhan po'i 'du byed slob ma la 'jug par mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it seen that the instigation of the teacher enters the student?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: rang gi rgyud kyi shes pa snga ma nyid 'dod pa'i khyad par las mkhan po'i 'du byed kyis bzhag pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud kyi shes pa snga ma nyid 'dod pa'i khyad par las mkhan po'i 'du byed kyis bzhag pa ste /
translated: The instigation of the teacher is established by the special desire of the prior consciousness of one‚Äôs own continuum.

original: 'dod pa med na ni mkhan po'i bshad pa'i lugs 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi rgyu nyid rgyud nas bla ma'i 'du byed kyi 'jug pa nyan pa po la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa med na ni mkhan po'i bshad pa'i lugs 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi rgyu nyid rgyud nas bla ma'i 'du byed kyi 'jug pa nyan pa po la gnas pa yin no //
translated: If there were no desire, the student would not hold the teacher‚Äôs system of explanation. Therefore, the instigation of the teacher‚Äôs continuum is present in the listener through one‚Äôs own continuum.

original: @335a * // lus dang sems dag dbyer med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: @335a * // lus dang sems dag dbyer med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the body and mind inseparable?

original: lus log na sems skye ba gzhan du 'pho ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lus log na sems skye ba gzhan du 'pho ba ni ma yin te /
translated: When the body is destroyed, the mind does not transfer to another birth.

original: sems skye ba gzhan du 'pho ba ni tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems skye ba gzhan du 'pho ba ni tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mind transferred to another birth, it would be different.

original: lus dang sems dag tha dad par ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lus dang sems dag tha dad par ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical for the body and mind to be different.

original: lus nyid la nang gi bde ba la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir sems de las tha dad pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: lus nyid la nang gi bde ba la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir sems de las tha dad pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Because the body itself is the object of internal pleasure and so on, the mind is not different from it.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: lus dang sems dag tha dad pa med cing 'byung ba chen por gyur pa yin na yang /
analyzed: lus dang sems dag tha dad pa med cing 'byung ba chen por gyur pa yin na yang /
translated: Even though the body and mind are not different and are the great elements,

original: 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'byung ba chen po rjes su dpag tu rung ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'byung ba chen po rjes su dpag tu rung ba ste /
translated: the great elements of the next world are not suitable to be inferred,

original: gnyid log pa las sad pa bzhin no /
analyzed: gnyid log pa las sad pa bzhin no /
translated: like waking from sleep.

original: tha dad par yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: tha dad par yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also not tenable that they are different,

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: because

original: ji ltar thos pa sogs 'du byed //üîΩbyams pa sems dang sems las dus //
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa sogs 'du byed // byams pa sems dang sems las dus //
translated: the mental factors of hearing and so on

original: kyis gsal tha dad med pa'i phyir //üîΩde ltar lus la'ang yon tan 'gyur //
analyzed: kyis gsal tha dad med pa'i phyir // de ltar lus la'ang yon tan 'gyur //
translated: are not different from the mind and mental states.

original: zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la //
translated: Thus the body also would have qualities.

original: gang dang gang thos pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed sems la byas pa ni rmi lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na mi gsal ba /
analyzed: gang dang gang thos pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed sems la byas pa ni rmi lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na mi gsal ba /
translated: The mental factors of hearing and so on that are produced in the mind are not clear in the context of dreams and so on.

original: sad pa'i tshe dus kyi gsal ba de bzhin du lus la yang mi gsal ba sems lta bur shes par bya ste dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sad pa'i tshe dus kyi gsal ba de bzhin du lus la yang mi gsal ba sems lta bur shes par bya ste dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as the clarity of the waking state is the same as that of the dream state, so too should the body be understood to be like the mind, that is, not clear, because they are inseparable.

original: dper na lus kyi yon tan rig pa la sogs pa pha rol gyi mthong ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na lus kyi yon tan rig pa la sogs pa pha rol gyi mthong ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the qualities of the body, such as knowledge, are seen by others,

original: sems kyi yon tan yang ci ste mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems kyi yon tan yang ci ste mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: why are the qualities of the mind not seen?

original: de lta yin na /
analyzed: de lta yin na /
translated: If that were so,

original: dmigs ba'i rig byar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs ba'i rig byar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it would be an object of perception.

original: rtog pa ni nang gi reg bya'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin yin pas gzhan gyis mi mthong ngo zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa ni nang gi reg bya'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin yin pas gzhan gyis mi mthong ngo zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that conceptual thoughts are by nature internal tactile objects and are not seen by others, that is not so,

original: phyi rol gyi reg bya rma gzhan gyis mthong yang /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi reg bya rma gzhan gyis mthong yang /
translated: because although external tactile objects are seen by others,

original: de la yod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the pain and so on that exist in them are not perceived.

original: de bzhin du bar ma do'i lus dang pa'i phyir nying mtshams sbyor ba dang 'pho ba mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du bar ma do'i lus dang pa'i phyir nying mtshams sbyor ba dang 'pho ba mi mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, the body of the intermediate state is not seen because it is not connected to the body of the previous life.

original: bar ma do'i srid pa'i lus gzugs can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bar ma do'i srid pa'i lus gzugs can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the body of the intermediate state is a physical form,

original: ji ltar rtsig pa la sogs pa sna tshogs kyis chod pa la 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar rtsig pa la sogs pa sna tshogs kyis chod pa la 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: How can it go where it is obstructed by various things, such as walls?

original: rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pas da lta ba'i lus bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pas da lta ba'i lus bzhin no zhe na /
translated: It is like the present body, which is obstructed by walls, etc.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: lus can yin yang phra ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lus can yin yang phra ba'i phyir //
translated: Even though it has a body, it is subtle,

original: su yang la lar thogs bcas min //
analyzed: su yang la lar thogs bcas min //
translated: so no one is obstructed anywhere.

original: chu bzhin gser la dngul chu bzhin /üîΩma mthong phyir na'ang med yid min /
analyzed: chu bzhin gser la dngul chu bzhin / ma mthong phyir na'ang med yid min /
translated: Like water in water, mercury in gold,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is not that it does not exist because it is not seen.

original: bar mdo'i srid pa'i lus phra ba ste /
analyzed: bar mdo'i srid pa'i lus phra ba ste /
translated: The body of the intermediate existence is subtle.

original: dang ba'i phyir khyim la sogs pa la lar thogs pa med do /
analyzed: dang ba'i phyir khyim la sogs pa la lar thogs pa med do /
translated: Because it is clear, it is not obstructed anywhere, such as in a house, etc.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa la chu bzhin dang / @335b shel la sogs pa'i mdangs bzhin dang / gser la dngul chu 'jug pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa la chu bzhin dang / @335b shel la sogs pa'i mdangs bzhin dang / gser la dngul chu 'jug pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like water in a pot, etc., like the luster in crystal, etc., and like mercury in gold.

original: yang na chu bzhin dang / gser la dngul chu bzhin yod pa ma yin pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: yang na chu bzhin dang / gser la dngul chu bzhin yod pa ma yin pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Or, like water in water, mercury in gold, it does not exist.

original: yang srid pa bar ma'i lus ma mthong bas med pa nyid de /
analyzed: yang srid pa bar ma'i lus ma mthong bas med pa nyid de /
translated: Or, it is not that it does not exist because the body of the intermediate existence is not seen.

original: 'di ltar 'chi ba dang skye ba'i srid pa dag gi bar ma ni bar ma do'i srid bar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'chi ba dang skye ba'i srid pa dag gi bar ma ni bar ma do'i srid bar 'dod ce na /
translated: The intermediate existence is the existence that occurs between death existence and birth existence.

original: ngar 'dzin pa de ni med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa de ni med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The self-grasping that is the basis of the view of the transitory collection is not nonexistent.

original: chong  par gyur pa yang /
analyzed: chong  par gyur pa yang /
translated: It is also not permanent.

original: dus dang yul dag tu skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dus dang yul dag tu skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is born in time and place.

original: 'di ltar rmi lam dang / bar ma chad bar sngar pat li pu tra la sogs par 'gro ba na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam dang / bar ma chad bar sngar pat li pu tra la sogs par 'gro ba na /
translated: Thus, when one goes to Patalipu·π≠a and so on in a dream or in a dream interrupted by waking,

original: bar na yod pa'i yul dang grong khyer la sogs pas mchod par kha cig skad cig tsam yul gzhan du bdag nyid kyis phyin par mthong ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: bar na yod pa'i yul dang grong khyer la sogs pas mchod par kha cig skad cig tsam yul gzhan du bdag nyid kyis phyin par mthong ba de bzhin du /
translated: one sees oneself arriving in another place in an instant.

original: 'gro bar bya ba'i yul du 'jig rten pha rol du srid pa bar ma'i lus thogs pa med par 'gro zhing 'pho ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gro bar bya ba'i yul du 'jig rten pha rol du srid pa bar ma'i lus thogs pa med par 'gro zhing 'pho ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, the body of the intermediate existence moves and transfers to the other world, the place to which one is going, without obstruction.

original: rmi lam ni mi bden pas srid pa bar ma'i lus kyang yod pa ma yin pa ma zhe na /
analyzed: rmi lam ni mi bden pas srid pa bar ma'i lus kyang yod pa ma yin pa ma zhe na /
translated: If you say that the body of the intermediate existence does not exist because a dream is false,üîΩthen why does one see oneself in a dream?

original: dpe dang don bdag nyid thams cad kyis mtshungs pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / bag chags mthug po las yod pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpe dang don bdag nyid thams cad kyis mtshungs pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / bag chags mthug po las yod pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is not similar in all respects to the example, and because it would exist through the force of habitual propensities.

original: rmi lam las sad pa'i tshe dang 'jig rten pha rol du bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong ba la bye bag med do zhes bshad par bya'o /
analyzed: rmi lam las sad pa'i tshe dang 'jig rten pha rol du bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong ba la bye bag med do zhes bshad par bya'o /
translated: We would say that there is no difference between the experience of pleasure and pain in this life and the experience of pleasure and pain in the next life.

original: des na rmi lam du gzhan gyi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi mthong ba de lta na yang /
analyzed: des na rmi lam du gzhan gyi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi mthong ba de lta na yang /
translated: Therefore, even though one does not see the coming and going of others in a dream,

original: de dag yod pa nyid kyi phyir ma mthong ba ni nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag yod pa nyid kyi phyir ma mthong ba ni nges pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not certain that they do not exist because they are not seen.

original: de bas na 'gro ba'i rten gyi dngos po med pa nyid kyang ma yin no //üîΩgzhan yang gal te sems lus las tha mi dad pa de lta na yang lus ni rdul phra rab tshogs pa tsam yin pa'i phyir//
analyzed: de bas na 'gro ba'i rten gyi dngos po med pa nyid kyang ma yin no // gzhan yang gal te sems lus las tha mi dad pa de lta na yang lus ni rdul phra rab tshogs pa tsam yin pa'i phyir//
translated: Thus, the state of being the basis of the world is not nonexistent.üîΩMoreover, if the mind is not different from the body, then all the particles of the body would be conscious,

original: rdul phra rab thams cad rig par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: rdul phra rab thams cad rig par 'gyur ro /
translated: because the body is a mere collection of particles.

original: 'on te lus rags pa yan lag can te de ltar mthong pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te lus rags pa yan lag can te de ltar mthong pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the body is a gross, composite whole, and that is why it is seen in that way,

original: de ltar na yang lus ni rdul phra rab la gnas pas rdul phra rab dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang lus ni rdul phra rab la gnas pas rdul phra rab dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: But the body is made of atoms, so the atoms are perceived.

original: rdul phra rab la reg pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te rig pa rdul rab las skyes pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab la reg pa'i phyir ro // 'on te rig pa rdul rab las skyes pa'o zhe na /
translated: Because the atoms are touched.üîΩBut the awareness arises from the atoms.

original: de ltar rdul phra rab las skyes pa'o zhes rig par byed pa ci zhig yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rdul phra rab las skyes pa'o zhes rig par byed pa ci zhig yin te /
translated: What is the awareness that is aware of the atoms?

original: rang gi rang pa ni tha dad pa mi rigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rang pa ni tha dad pa mi rigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible for something to be aware of itself.

original: gzhan kho na rig pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan kho na rig pa ste /
translated: It is another awareness.

original: rang rig par mi rung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rang rig par mi rung ba ma yin nam /
translated: But it is not possible for something to be aware of itself.

original: rang las phyed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhen na /
analyzed: rang las phyed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhen na /
translated: Because it is contradictory for something to be aware of itself.

original: de lta na ji ltar bde ba myong bar 'gyur tha @336a * //
analyzed: de lta na ji ltar bde ba myong bar 'gyur tha @336a * //
translated: If that is so, how is pleasure experienced?

original: dad pa'i shes pas so zhe na /
analyzed: dad pa'i shes pas so zhe na /
translated: By a different awareness.

original: bde ba la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i rig pa mi dmigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i rig pa mi dmigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is not awareness of pleasure not perceived as different from pleasure?

original: de ji ltar bde ba la sogs pa shes pa gzhan gyis rig par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ji ltar bde ba la sogs pa shes pa gzhan gyis rig par 'gyur //
translated: How can pleasure be known by another awareness of pleasure?

original: lus nyid bde ba la sogs pa'i rigs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: lus nyid bde ba la sogs pa'i rigs pa'o zhe na /
translated: The body itself is the awareness of pleasure.

original: bde ba la sogs pa dang / sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i lus mi dmigs pa'i phyir rig bya nyid yin gyi rigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa dang / sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i lus mi dmigs pa'i phyir rig bya nyid yin gyi rigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: because a body that is separate from pleasure, etc., and from blue, etc., is not perceived.

original: de lta na'o na ni mig la sogs pa'i rig pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na'o na ni mig la sogs pa'i rig pa'o zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the eye, etc., are the knower.

original: ri bong gi rva la rig par ci ste khas len par mi byed /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la rig par ci ste khas len par mi byed /
translated: Why not accept that the rabbit‚Äôs horns are the knower?

original: 'on te mig la sogs pa rnams la nus pa yod pas rig pa po yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te mig la sogs pa rnams la nus pa yod pas rig pa po yin gyi /
translated: But the eye, etc., are the knower because they have the capacity to know.

original: ro bong gi rva las nus pas stong pa'i phyir rig pa por mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: ro bong gi rva las nus pas stong pa'i phyir rig pa por mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: The rabbit‚Äôs horns are not suitable to be the knower because they are devoid of the capacity to know.

original: mig la sogs pa la nus pa dmigs par ji ltar nges pa yin /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la nus pa dmigs par ji ltar nges pa yin /
translated: How is the capacity of the eye, etc., ascertained?

original: 'bras bu'i sgo nas nus pa nges so zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sgo nas nus pa nges so zhe na /
translated: The capacity is ascertained from the effect.

original: 'bras bu gang zhig yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhig yin /
translated: What is the effect?

original: gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'o zhe na /
translated: The perception of form, etc.

original: dmigs pa de yang nus pa yin pa'i phyir dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa de yang nus pa yin pa'i phyir dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But that perception is also a capacity, so it would not be a perception.

original: lhag mar gyur pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa kho na rtags yin te /
analyzed: lhag mar gyur pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa kho na rtags yin te /
translated: Form, etc., are the evidence because they are the remainder.

original: des kyang rnam par shes pa'i nus pa 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: des kyang rnam par shes pa'i nus pa 'bras bu ste /
translated: The potential of consciousness is the result.üîΩ

original: mig la sogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid yin na sngar mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid yin na sngar mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the eye and so on were the effect of consciousness, they would not appear prior to it.

original: 'on te mthong bar 'gyur ba'i dus su gzugs la sogs pa rnams mig la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mthong bar 'gyur ba'i dus su gzugs la sogs pa rnams mig la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say that form and so on are the effect of the eye and so on at the time they are seen,

original: de lta na ni rdul phra rab yod tshad dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni rdul phra rab yod tshad dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: then all existing subtle particles would be observed,

original: rdul phra rab rnams la ni 'dus pa'i gnas skabs dang / so so'i dus la khyad par cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams la ni 'dus pa'i gnas skabs dang / so so'i dus la khyad par cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is not the slightest difference between the subtle particles in the state of aggregation and those that are not aggregated.

original: 'dus pa'i gnas skabs na ni nus pa bskyed pa nyid khyad par yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i gnas skabs na ni nus pa bskyed pa nyid khyad par yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the difference lies in the production of the potential in the state of aggregation,

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: then even so,

original: gcig la gcig brten par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig la gcig brten par 'gyur te /
translated: they would be mutually dependent.

original: rdul phra rab rnams kyi khyad par ni mthong du rung ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams kyi khyad par ni mthong du rung ba nyid yin la /
translated: The difference of the subtle particles is that they are visible,

original: mthong du rung ba myong ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ji ltar nus pa grub pa med par rig pa nyid grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong du rung ba myong ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ji ltar nus pa grub pa med par rig pa nyid grub par 'gyur te /
translated: and because the visible is endowed with the potential for experience, how could the visible be established without the establishment of the potential?

original: mthong du rung ba grub na /
analyzed: mthong du rung ba grub na /
translated: If it is established that it is possible to see it,

original: ji ltar nus pa rjes su dpog pa yin /üîΩsngon po la sogs pa grags chod bde ba la sogs pa tsam nyid shes pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar nus pa rjes su dpog pa yin / sngon po la sogs pa grags chod bde ba la sogs pa tsam nyid shes pa ste /
translated: how is the existence of the capacity inferred?üîΩIt is because we see that the mere blue, etc., which is well known to be the object, is the same as the mere pleasure, etc., which is well known to be the subject.

original: shes pa'i bde ba'o zhes gzhi mthun pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i bde ba'o zhes gzhi mthun pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The blue, etc., is the object, and the pleasure, etc., is the subject.

original: sngon po la sogs pa gsal byar dmigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa gsal byar dmigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the blue, etc., perceived as the object?

original: ji ltar shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can it be the subject?

original: rang gi ngo bo myong ba las sngon po gsal byar myong ba @336b nges pa med par nges shing /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo myong ba las sngon po gsal byar myong ba @336b nges pa med par nges shing /
translated: It is certain that the experience of the blue, etc., as the object is not the same as the experience of the subject, because the experience of the blue, etc., is not the same as the experience of the subject.

original: sngon po las de myong ba yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po las de myong ba yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that the experience of the subject is the experience of the blue, etc.

original: de gsal bya'i tha snyad kyang lus la ltos nas brtags pa'o zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de gsal bya'i tha snyad kyang lus la ltos nas brtags pa'o zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: We must explain that the designation of the blue, etc., as the object is a designation based on the body.

original: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa gzhan gyi lus la 'pho ba dang ldan pa ni shes pa de'i bdag nyid kyis yin pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi lus khu ba dang / khrag la yang shes pa 'pho ba dang ldan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa gzhan gyi lus la 'pho ba dang ldan pa ni shes pa de'i bdag nyid kyis yin pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi lus khu ba dang / khrag la yang shes pa 'pho ba dang ldan pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as the blue, etc., which is transferred to another‚Äôs body is the same as the consciousness, in the same way, the consciousness which is transferred to another‚Äôs body, to semen and blood, is the same as the blue, etc.

original: de'i phyir shes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir rdul phra rab rig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir rdul phra rab rig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because consciousness is the very nature of form and so on, it follows that it would cognize the most subtle particles.

original: sangs rgyas pa la yang ci ste rdul phra rab rig par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la yang ci ste rdul phra rab rig par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But why wouldn‚Äôt the Buddhist also cognize the most subtle particles?

original: yul gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa tha dad pa myong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa tha dad pa myong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is experienced as a consciousness that has the aspect of the object.

original: de lta mdo kyi cha shas can gyi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yod kyi /
analyzed: de lta mdo kyi cha shas can gyi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yod kyi /
translated: In that case, the nature of the consciousness that has parts exists,

original: shes pa'i rgyu pha rol po'i yang rdul phra rab tha dad par gyur pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa'i rgyu pha rol po'i yang rdul phra rab tha dad par gyur pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but the cause of consciousness, the most subtle particles, do not exist as different things.

original: cha shas can gyi lus 'ba' zhig yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: cha shas can gyi lus 'ba' zhig yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But doesn‚Äôt the body that has parts exist?

original: de yang gcig pa nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: de yang gcig pa nyid yin na ni /
translated: And if that is also one,

original: lag pa la sogs bsgul na kun //
analyzed: lag pa la sogs bsgul na kun //
translated: then when the hand and so on are moved,

original: 'gul par 'gyur te 'gal ba can //
analyzed: 'gul par 'gyur te 'gal ba can //
translated: all would move, and that is contradictory.

original: las ni gcig la mi rung phyir //
analyzed: las ni gcig la mi rung phyir //
translated: Because it is not tenable for one thing to have action,

original: gzhan du tha dad grub par 'gyur //üîΩgcig la bsgribs pas thams cad la //
analyzed: gzhan du tha dad grub par 'gyur // gcig la bsgribs pas thams cad la //
translated: it would be established as different from the other.üîΩIf one is obscured, all would be obscured,

original: bsgrib par 'gyur ba'am ma bsgribs na //
analyzed: bsgrib par 'gyur ba'am ma bsgribs na //
translated: or if one is not obscured, all would not be obscured.

original: mthong 'gyur gcig tshon gyis bsgyur na //üîΩdmar po'ang mi dmar bar rtogs 'gyur //
analyzed: mthong 'gyur gcig tshon gyis bsgyur na // dmar po'ang mi dmar bar rtogs 'gyur //
translated: If one part is seen to be colored,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: then one would understand that the red is not red.

original: yan lag can gyi rdzas ni bya ba dang ldan ba dang / yon tan dang ldan pa'i rdzas 'phrod pa 'du ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: yan lag can gyi rdzas ni bya ba dang ldan ba dang / yon tan dang ldan pa'i rdzas 'phrod pa 'du ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: The substance of the whole is the cause of the conjunction of the substance that possesses action and the substance that possesses qualities.

original: gal te de'i byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te de'i byed pa yin na /
translated: If it is the activity of that,

original: 'du ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rdzas thams cad 'gul bar 'gyur ba de bas na lus kyi lag pa la sogs pa bskyod cing bsgul na lus thams cad 'gul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rdzas thams cad 'gul bar 'gyur ba de bas na lus kyi lag pa la sogs pa bskyod cing bsgul na lus thams cad 'gul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then because it is the cause of conjunction, all substances would move. Therefore, when the body moves the arm and so on, the whole body would move.

original: 'gul ba dang mi 'gul ba nyid kyis yan lag can gcig pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'gul ba dang mi 'gul ba nyid kyis yan lag can gcig pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the whole is one because of the difference between moving and not moving,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not logical.

original: 'gal ba'i las can gyi cha shas can gcig pa nyid mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i las can gyi cha shas can gcig pa nyid mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is illogical for one part to have contradictory actions.

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni gal te 'gul ba dang bcas pa dang / 'gul ba med pa yan lag can gcig pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni gal te 'gul ba dang bcas pa dang / 'gul ba med pa yan lag can gcig pa nyid yin na /
translated: The intended meaning is this: If the whole is one, possessing both movement and no movement,üîΩthen the whole would be both moving and not moving.

original: lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yang 'gro ba po la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i yan lag can gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yang 'gro ba po la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i yan lag can gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of Devadatta and Yajnadatta, etc., would be the same as the nature of the goer, etc.

original: 'on te lus la 'gul ba dang mi 'gul bar mthong ba'i phyir 'gal ba ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te lus la 'gul ba dang mi 'gul bar mthong ba'i phyir 'gal ba ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: But if you say that there is no contradiction because the body is seen to move and not move,

original: gcig pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin gal te snang ba tha dad pa @337a * //
analyzed: gcig pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin gal te snang ba tha dad pa @337a * //
translated: what is this so-called ‚Äúsameness‚Äù? If it is the non-difference of appearance,

original: med pa yin na ni de ni med de /
analyzed: med pa yin na ni de ni med de /
translated: that does not exist,

original: 'gul ba dang mi 'gul ba dag gcig pu snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gul ba dang mi 'gul ba dag gcig pu snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the moving and the unmoving do not appear as one.

original: 'on te 'bras bu gcig pa yin na ni gal te 'bras bu gcig pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu gcig pa yin na ni gal te 'bras bu gcig pa de lta na yang /
translated: But if it is the same effect, then even if they have the same effect,

original: yan lag can gcig par ji ltar 'gyur te gzhan gcig pas gzhan gcig par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag can gcig par ji ltar 'gyur te gzhan gcig pas gzhan gcig par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: how could they be the same entity? Because one thing would be the same as another thing.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: gzhan du na gal te gcig bsgul ba na thams cad 'gul bar khas mi len na ni /
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te gcig bsgul ba na thams cad 'gul bar khas mi len na ni /
translated: if you do not accept that when one moves, all move,

original: 'gul ba dang bcas pa dang mi 'gul ba dag tha dad par grub cing /
analyzed: 'gul ba dang bcas pa dang mi 'gul ba dag tha dad par grub cing /
translated: then it is established that the moving and the unmoving are different.

original: so so bar grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: so so bar grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is established that they are distinct.

original: 'dis ni bya ba'i 'du ba'i rgyu nyid rdzas yin pa bkag pa yin na //
analyzed: 'dis ni bya ba'i 'du ba'i rgyu nyid rdzas yin pa bkag pa yin na //
translated: This refutes the substance that is the cause of the aggregation of action.

original: gcig yin na sgrib pa yis kyang thams cad la sgrib par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'dres pa'i bye brag gis yan lag la sgrib kyi /
analyzed: gcig yin na sgrib pa yis kyang thams cad la sgrib par 'gyur ro // 'dres pa'i bye brag gis yan lag la sgrib kyi /
translated: If it were one, then even when it is obstructed, it would be unobstructed.

original: yan lag can la ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag can la ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Obstruction is in the parts, not in the whole, because of the difference in the mixture.

original: de lta mod kyi yan lag can la mi sgrib na rdzas thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi yan lag can la mi sgrib na rdzas thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the whole is not obstructed, then all substances would be seen.

original: yan lag gi sgo nas sgrib na cung zad kyang mi mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: yan lag gi sgo nas sgrib na cung zad kyang mi mthong ba nyid do //
translated: If there is obstruction in the parts, then nothing would be seen.

original: thams cad mi dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad mi dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no obstruction, then all would be seen.

original: gcig pa yin yang thams cad mthong bar mi nus pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gcig pa yin yang thams cad mthong bar mi nus pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is one, then it is not possible that all is seen.

original: mthong ba dang mi mthong ba dang ji ltar gcig par 'gyur /
analyzed: mthong ba dang mi mthong ba dang ji ltar gcig par 'gyur /
translated: How can there be one when there is seeing and not seeing?

original: rgya skyegs la sogs pa'i tshon gyis gcig tu bsgyur ba na thams cad dmar por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgya skyegs la sogs pa'i tshon gyis gcig tu bsgyur ba na thams cad dmar por 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is made one by the dye of lac, etc., then all becomes red.

original: phan 'dogs pa'i bye brag gis rdzas gzhan pas yan lag dmar por 'gyur ba yin gyi yan lag can ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i bye brag gis rdzas gzhan pas yan lag dmar por 'gyur ba yin gyi yan lag can ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the whole is a different substance from the parts, then the part would be red, but the whole would not be.

original: dmar po yang mi dmar ba'i rdzas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmar po yang mi dmar ba'i rdzas su 'gyur ro //
translated: And the red would be a substance that is not red.

original: gtan tshigs de gsum gyi phyir yan lag can gyi rdzas tshogs pa gcig yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de gsum gyi phyir yan lag can gyi rdzas tshogs pa gcig yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For these three reasons, the substance of the whole does not exist as a single unit.

original: gal te du ma nyid yin na'ang //
analyzed: gal te du ma nyid yin na'ang //
translated: If it is many,

original: mi rtogs sngon bzhin khyad par ni //
analyzed: mi rtogs sngon bzhin khyad par ni //
translated: it is not perceived, as before.

original: med phyir phra phyir khyad med pa //
analyzed: med phyir phra phyir khyad med pa //
translated: There is no difference, because it is subtle.

original: mi 'grub khyad par can dbang po'i //
analyzed: mi 'grub khyad par can dbang po'i //
translated: It is not established. It is the object of a special sense faculty.

original: yul 'gyur de phyir rdul phran min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yul 'gyur de phyir rdul phran min // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, the atom does not exist.

original: gal te lus du ma yin na de'i tshe lus rtogs pa por mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te lus du ma yin na de'i tshe lus rtogs pa por mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the body is many, then it is not the perceiver of the body.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnas skabs so so bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs so so bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be in different states.

original: rdul phra rab rnams 'dus pa'i tshe yang khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / tha dad pa'i yan lag can ni mi skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams 'dus pa'i tshe yang khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / tha dad pa'i yan lag can ni mi skye ba'i phyir /
translated: Even when the subtle atoms are combined, there is no difference, and a different whole does not arise.

original: snga ma bzhin du phra ba'i phyir //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du phra ba'i phyir //
translated: because it is subtle, as before.

original: zhes bya ba la smos na ni ji ltar rdul phra rab rnams so so ba'i dus na mi dmigs pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab rnams 'dus pa'i tshe yang khyad par med par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la smos na ni ji ltar rdul phra rab rnams so so ba'i dus na mi dmigs pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab rnams 'dus pa'i tshe yang khyad par med par mi 'grub ste /
translated: If you say that, then just as the subtle atoms are not perceived when they are separate, in the same way, they would not be perceived when they are combined, because there would be no difference.

original: nyams su myong ba'i tshe rags @337b bar mthong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i tshe rags @337b bar mthong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But when they are experienced, they are seen as gross.

original: des na khyad par med pa mthong du mi rung ba ni med do //
analyzed: des na khyad par med pa mthong du mi rung ba ni med do //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the difference is not seen.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir nyams su myong ba la snang ba'i khyad par can ni dbang po'i yul nyid de /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir nyams su myong ba la snang ba'i khyad par can ni dbang po'i yul nyid de /
translated: For this very reason, the difference that appears in experience is the object of the sense faculty,

original: rdul phra rab nyid ni grogs mi byed pa'i phyir rdul phra rab ma yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab nyid ni grogs mi byed pa'i phyir rdul phra rab ma yin no //
translated: because the subtle atom itself is not the object of the sense faculty, because it does not assist in the arising of the cognition.

original: de lta na ni yul dmigs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni yul dmigs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how can the object be perceived?

original: de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa dmigs pa nyid kyis yul dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa dmigs pa nyid kyis yul dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The object is perceived because the cognition that has its aspect perceives it.

original: khyed la yang rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa can du ci ste 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: khyed la yang rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa can du ci ste 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But why doesn‚Äôt the cognition have the aspect of the subtle atom?

original: 'di yang le'u gsum pa las bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang le'u gsum pa las bstan par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained in the third chapter.

original: sna tshogs rdul phra mo tsam du khas len pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sna tshogs rdul phra mo tsam du khas len pa ma yin nam /
translated: But don‚Äôt you accept that the atom is as small as it gets?

original: sgrib g-yogs dang gags byed pa la sogs par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgrib g-yogs dang gags byed pa la sogs par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How can it obscure, obstruct, etc.?

original: ji ste 'dus pa'i yan lag can ma gtogs par rdul phra rab nyid gcig pu ni thogs pa med pa phan tshun rjes su 'jug pas ji ltar sgrib pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ste 'dus pa'i yan lag can ma gtogs par rdul phra rab nyid gcig pu ni thogs pa med pa phan tshun rjes su 'jug pas ji ltar sgrib pa yin te /
translated: If the atom is alone, without a composite whole, it is unobstructed, and since it penetrates everywhere, how can it obscure?

original: sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not join with anything.

original: ma sbyar bar sgrib na ni thams cad kyi thams cad la sgrib par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma sbyar bar sgrib na ni thams cad kyi thams cad la sgrib par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it obscures without joining, then it obscures everything, everywhere.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩde ni sgrib byed la sogs pa //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / de ni sgrib byed la sogs pa //
translated: Here we say:üîΩEven though there is no obscuring, etc.,

original: med pa dag kyang gsal ba yin //üîΩgser dang dngul chu la sogs pa'am //
analyzed: med pa dag kyang gsal ba yin // gser dang dngul chu la sogs pa'am //
translated: there is illumination.üîΩHow do you see gold, silver, mercury,

original: rdo tshan la sogs ji ltar snang //
analyzed: rdo tshan la sogs ji ltar snang //
translated: hot stones, etc.?

original: dbang sogs re res nus med rnams //
analyzed: dbang sogs re res nus med rnams //
translated: Since each sense faculty, etc., is ineffective,

original: ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: how can there be cognition?üîΩIf you say that it is due to their combination,

original: ldan pas yin na 'dir thal mtshungs //
analyzed: ldan pas yin na 'dir thal mtshungs //
translated: then the same is true here.

original: gal te gser dang dngul chu yi //
analyzed: gal te gser dang dngul chu yi //
translated: If you say that it is due to the combination of gold, silver, etc.,

original: ma mthong can rten ro dang gzugs //
analyzed: ma mthong can rten ro dang gzugs //
translated: The unseen is the support of the dead and of form.

original: sogs 'brel 'gal bar ji ltar shes //
analyzed: sogs 'brel 'gal bar ji ltar shes //
translated: How can one know that they are mutually exclusive?

original: nye bas brtags pa la 'dod na //
analyzed: nye bas brtags pa la 'dod na //
translated: If you accept that they are distinguished by proximity,

original: blo yis tha dad yod ba ste //üîΩji ltar phreng ring ba zhes bya //
analyzed: blo yis tha dad yod ba ste // ji ltar phreng ring ba zhes bya //
translated: then they exist as different by the mind.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩrdul phra rab rnams ni phra ba dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / rdul phra rab rnams ni phra ba dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: How is it that a long garland is said to be long?

original: ji ltar sgrib bar 'gyur zhes rtsod pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar sgrib bar 'gyur zhes rtsod pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The opponent argues that it is not logical to say that atoms are obstructed because they are devoid of smallness.

original: yan lag can dang 'brel ba'i sgrib g-yogs gang du yang ma mthong ba'i phyir gang gis de med na med pa yin /
analyzed: yan lag can dang 'brel ba'i sgrib g-yogs gang du yang ma mthong ba'i phyir gang gis de med na med pa yin /
translated: But this is not so, because the obstruction of the possessor of parts is not seen anywhere, and if that does not exist, neither does this.

original: de ltar gags byed pa la sogs pa yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gags byed pa la sogs pa yang shes par bya'o //
translated: Obstruction and so on should be understood in the same way.

original: ji ste rdul phra rab rnams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ji ltar sgrib pa la sogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste rdul phra rab rnams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ji ltar sgrib pa la sogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: But if atoms are not conjoined, how can they be obstructed and so on?

original: de lta mod kyi khyod kyi ltar na /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi khyod kyi ltar na /
translated: Even so, according to you,

original: ldan pa med pa'i rdul phra rab kyis kyang ji ltar yan lag can skyed par byed /
analyzed: ldan pa med pa'i rdul phra rab kyis kyang ji ltar yan lag can skyed par byed /
translated: how can an atom that is not conjoined generate a possessor of parts?

original: 'dus nas so zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus nas so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it does so by gathering,

original: 'o na 'dus pa yang bdag nyid thams cad kyis yin nam /üîΩphyogs gcig gis yin te /
analyzed: 'o na 'dus pa yang bdag nyid thams cad kyis yin nam / phyogs gcig gis yin te /
translated: But do the atoms combine in their entirety or in part?

original: de la phyogs gcig gis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la phyogs gcig gis ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not combine in part,

original: rdul phra rab rnams la phyogs gcig med pa'i @338a * //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams la phyogs gcig med pa'i @338a * //
translated: because the atoms have no parts.

original: phyir ro // bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'dus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyir ro // bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'dus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They do not combine in their entirety,

original: gong bu yang rdul phran tsam du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩrdul phra rab kyis ldan ba skyed do zhe na /
analyzed: gong bu yang rdul phran tsam du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // rdul phra rab kyis ldan ba skyed do zhe na /
translated: because the mass would be only the size of an atom.üîΩIf you say that the atoms combine by way of the parts that are not occupied by other atoms,

original: bar dang bcas pas ji ltar ldan pa nyid bskyed de /
analyzed: bar dang bcas pas ji ltar ldan pa nyid bskyed de /
translated: then how can those that are separated combine?üîΩThe objection is the same.

original: de ltar brtsad pa mtshungs pa yin no// de phrad pa yang med do zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ltar brtsad pa mtshungs pa yin no// de phrad pa yang med do zhes bstan zin to //
translated: And it has been shown that they do not come into contact.

original: gal te phrad pa yod na ldan ba dang yan lag can gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /üîΩ'on te bar dang bcas pas ldan ba skyed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phrad pa yod na ldan ba dang yan lag can gzhan gyis ci zhig bya / 'on te bar dang bcas pas ldan ba skyed do zhe na /
translated: If they do come into contact, what is the use of conjunction and the whole?üîΩIf you say that they combine by way of the parts that are not occupied by other atoms,

original: bar dang bcas pas ji ltar ldan ba nyid bskyed de /
analyzed: bar dang bcas pas ji ltar ldan ba nyid bskyed de /
translated: then how can those that are separated combine?

original: de lta na yang 'brel pa nyid kyis gegs byed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir dper na skra shad dang / sbrang ma la sogs pa dag gis kyang bar med pa nyid mthug po'i rnam par snang ba skyed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'brel pa nyid kyis gegs byed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir dper na skra shad dang / sbrang ma la sogs pa dag gis kyang bar med pa nyid mthug po'i rnam par snang ba skyed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Nevertheless, because of their very connection, they perform the function of obstructing, etc. For example, even such things as a hair-tuft and a bee, without an interval, generate the appearance of thickness.

original: rdul phra rab phrad pa med pa nyid gegs byed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab phrad pa med pa nyid gegs byed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, even without contact, atoms perform the function of obstructing, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'dus pa'i gnas skabs na khyad par bstan pa des ni sgrib par byed pa dang / gegs byed pa la sogs pa med par rtsod pa gang yin pa de yang bsal ba yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus pa'i gnas skabs na khyad par bstan pa des ni sgrib par byed pa dang / gegs byed pa la sogs pa med par rtsod pa gang yin pa de yang bsal ba yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚Äúat the time of aggregation, because of the teaching of difference, the objection that there is no obstruction, etc. is also removed‚Äù is made.

original: yang na gser dang dngul chu la sogs pa 'dres par gyur na ni /
analyzed: yang na gser dang dngul chu la sogs pa 'dres par gyur na ni /
translated: Or, when gold, silver, mercury, etc. are mixed,

original: yan lag can med par ji ltar gegs byed pa la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur /
analyzed: yan lag can med par ji ltar gegs byed pa la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur /
translated: how can they, without a whole, be the cause of obstruction, etc.?

original: rdo tshan te la sogs pa bsreg pa la sogs pa'i bya ba mthong ba ji ltar yin /
analyzed: rdo tshan te la sogs pa bsreg pa la sogs pa'i bya ba mthong ba ji ltar yin /
translated: How is it that one sees the function of burning, etc. in a hot stone, etc.?

original: der yan lag can mi skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: der yan lag can mi skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: because the whole does not arise there.

original: gser dang dngul chu dang rdo dang me la sogs pa rnams rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gser dang dngul chu dang rdo dang me la sogs pa rnams rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because gold, mercury, stone, fire, etc. are of different types.

original: yang na gal te rdul phra rab las tha dad pa'i rdul med kyang /
analyzed: yang na gal te rdul phra rab las tha dad pa'i rdul med kyang /
translated: Moreover, even if there is no atom apart from the subtle atom,

original: rags pa gcig ji ltar mi snang ba yin te /
analyzed: rags pa gcig ji ltar mi snang ba yin te /
translated: why does the gross not appear?

original: de'i phyir gser dang dngul chu la sogs pa zhes smos te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir gser dang dngul chu la sogs pa zhes smos te ;
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúgold, mercury, etc.‚Äù

original: de'i dgongs pa ni dper na gser la sogs pa dngul chu dang 'dres pa dang / rdo ba la sogs pa tsha bar gyur bar snang ba de ni yan lag can med kyang de ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dgongs pa ni dper na gser la sogs pa dngul chu dang 'dres pa dang / rdo ba la sogs pa tsha bar gyur bar snang ba de ni yan lag can med kyang de ltar snang ba'o //
translated: The intention is that, for example, gold, etc. mixed with mercury, and stone, etc. appearing as hot, are like that, appearing without a whole.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni chu tshan la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni chu tshan la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes hot water, etc.

original: de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa la yang rdul phra rab kyi stobs nyid kyis rags par snang ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa la yang rdul phra rab kyi stobs nyid kyis rags par snang ba ste /
translated: In the same way, the pot, etc. also appear as gross by the power of the subtle atom.

original: 'di ltar khyad par can gyi rgyu las khyad par can gyi 'bras bu skye ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyad par can gyi rgyu las khyad par can gyi 'bras bu skye ste /
translated: Thus, a special effect arises from a special cause.

original: re re ste so sor dbang po la sogs pa nus pa med pa sna tshogs pas 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed kyi /
analyzed: re re ste so sor dbang po la sogs pa nus pa med pa sna tshogs pas 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed kyi /
translated: Each of the various faculties, such as the eye, etc., individually and without mutual contact, generates the effect, the visual consciousness, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams 'dre ba dang ldan pas yan lag can bskyed @338b pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams 'dre ba dang ldan pas yan lag can bskyed @338b pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The whole, the possessor of the parts, is not generated by the combination of the eye, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams la sbyor ba yod na phyogs la yang sbyor zhing /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams la sbyor ba yod na phyogs la yang sbyor zhing /
translated: If the eye, etc., are applied to the object, then the direction is also applied.

original: phrad pas 'bras bu ji ltar mi skye zhes bya ba'i brtsad pa mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phrad pas 'bras bu ji ltar mi skye zhes bya ba'i brtsad pa mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The objection is the same: ‚ÄúWhy does the effect not arise from the mere contact of the directions?‚Äù

original: gal te mig la sogs pa tshogs pas bskyed pa la /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa tshogs pas bskyed pa la /
translated: If the generation of the effect by the combination of the eye, etc.,

original: 'dre ba gzhan dgos na ni de'i tshe thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dre ba gzhan dgos na ni de'i tshe thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: requires another contact, then there is an infinite regress.

original: 'on te dbang po la sogs pa ngo bo nyid kyi shes pa 'dres pa skyed na ni de lta na ni rdul phra rab kyis kyang 'dre ba dang yan lag can med par sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyed par byed de yan
analyzed: 'on te dbang po la sogs pa ngo bo nyid kyi shes pa 'dres pa skyed na ni de lta na ni rdul phra rab kyis kyang 'dre ba dang yan lag can med par sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyed par byed de yan
translated: But if the combination of the eye, etc., generates the consciousness by its own nature, then even the subtle atom generates the consciousness having the aspect of blue, etc., without contact and without a whole.

original: lag can gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: lag can gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of a whole?

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi gal te gser dang dngul chu dag rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir rdzas bskyed ba ma yin yang /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi gal te gser dang dngul chu dag rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir rdzas bskyed ba ma yin yang /
translated: This is true, but if gold and quicksilver are not substances that generate other substances because they are of a different type,

original: de dag ldan pa snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ldan pa snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: then their mixture is perceived.

original: rten ma mthong ba gang yin pa de ni ji ltar shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rten ma mthong ba gang yin pa de ni ji ltar shes par 'gyur te /
translated: But how can that which is not seen as a support be known?

original: 'di ltar gser dang dngul chu'i rdul phra rab rnams dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir de'i ldan pa yang dbang po las 'das pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gser dang dngul chu'i rdul phra rab rnams dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir de'i ldan pa yang dbang po las 'das pa nyid do //
translated: For in that case, the atoms of gold and quicksilver are beyond the senses, and their mixture is also beyond the senses.

original: dper na mig gi dbang po lkog tu gyur ba'i phyir de la brten pa'i don dang / 'dre ba yang lkog tu gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mig gi dbang po lkog tu gyur ba'i phyir de la brten pa'i don dang / 'dre ba yang lkog tu gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, because the eye faculty is hidden, the object that is based on it and the contact of the object with the eye faculty are also hidden.

original: gzhan yang dbang po rtsa dang 'brel pa las shes pa skye la /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang po rtsa dang 'brel pa las shes pa skye la /
translated: Moreover, consciousness arises from the sense faculty in dependence on the root.

original: gser dang dngul chu 'dres pa ni yon tan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gser dang dngul chu 'dres pa ni yon tan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But because the mixture of gold and quicksilver is a quality,

original: 'dre ba dbang po las 'das pa ma yin pa'i phyir ci'i phyir mthong du rung ba nyid ma yin /
analyzed: 'dre ba dbang po las 'das pa ma yin pa'i phyir ci'i phyir mthong du rung ba nyid ma yin /
translated: why is it not suitable to be seen, since the mixture is not beyond the senses?

original: 'on kyang rten du gyur ba'i rdul phra rab 'dres pa las /
analyzed: 'on kyang rten du gyur ba'i rdul phra rab 'dres pa las /
translated: But the subtle particles which are the basis of the derived matter are mixed.

original: de yang ldan pa skyed do zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ldan pa skyed do zhe na /
translated: And the derived matter is produced from the mixture.

original: de lta mod kyi ldan pa dang 'phrod pa 'du ba las rdul phra rab kyi gzugs kyang 'dzin bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ldan pa dang 'phrod pa 'du ba las rdul phra rab kyi gzugs kyang 'dzin bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But the derived matter is grasped as a form of subtle particles which are mixed and in contact.

original: gal te yang gser dang dngul chu la sogs pa'i phrad pa nyid bltar rung ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang gser dang dngul chu la sogs pa'i phrad pa nyid bltar rung ba'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the contact of gold, silver, water, etc. is visible,

original: de lta na yang btung ba bzang po la sogs pa la bu ram la sogs pa 'dres pa'i rang bzhin gzugs dang ro la sogs pa 'gal te /
analyzed: de lta na yang btung ba bzang po la sogs pa la bu ram la sogs pa 'dres pa'i rang bzhin gzugs dang ro la sogs pa 'gal te /
translated: then the nature of the mixture of sugar, etc. in good drink, etc. is a form which is a taste, etc.

original: btung ba bzang po mngar ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: btung ba bzang po mngar ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Good drink is sweet, etc.

original: yang don gcig la 'dus pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nye bar brtags nas ldan par 'dod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yang don gcig la 'dus pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nye bar brtags nas ldan par 'dod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it not the case that you accept the possession of form, etc. as a mere designation for the collection of the same object?

original: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang rdul phra rab 'dres pa can rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dres pa'i gzugs la sogs ba dang tha dad par snang bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i phyir / blo yi tha dad yod bla ste //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang rdul phra rab 'dres pa can rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dres pa'i gzugs la sogs ba dang tha dad par snang bar 'gyur ro // de'i phyir / blo yi tha dad yod bla ste //
translated: But the form, etc. of the conglomeration of subtle atoms is just that, and it appears as different from the conglomeration of form, etc.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe difference is due to the intellect.‚Äù

original: gzugs dang ro dag gcig par snang ba ni 'dres pa 'dres pa las yin te /üîΩlcags gong @339a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang ro dag gcig par snang ba ni 'dres pa 'dres pa las yin te / lcags gong @339a * //
translated: The appearance of form and taste as one is due to the mixing of the two.üîΩIs it not like a lump of iron

original: mer bsregs pa bzhin ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mer bsregs pa bzhin ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: heated in fire?

original: de lta mod kyi rdzas gzhan brtags te ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi rdzas gzhan brtags te ci zhig bya ste /
translated: But why imagine another substance?

original: rdul phra rab rnams nyid rags pa la sogs pa'i gzugs su snang ba'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams nyid rags pa la sogs pa'i gzugs su snang ba'o //
translated: The subtle atoms themselves appear as gross form, etc.

original: gal te yang khyed rdul phra rab las gzhan pa'i rdzas 'dod na ni de'i tshe phreng ba ring po yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yang khyed rdul phra rab las gzhan pa'i rdzas 'dod na ni de'i tshe phreng ba ring po yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if you assert a substance other than the subtle atom, then a long garland would not exist,

original: phreng ba zhes bya ba'i dngos po cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phreng ba zhes bya ba'i dngos po cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is not the slightest entity called a ‚Äúgarland.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'dres pa med pa'i phyir ma 'dres pa dang / 'dres pa med pa nyid kyi rdzas kyang med pa dang / rigs kyang med pa ste pho brang gcig kyang phreng ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir shing bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dres pa med pa'i phyir ma 'dres pa dang / 'dres pa med pa nyid kyi rdzas kyang med pa dang / rigs kyang med pa ste pho brang gcig kyang phreng ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir shing bzhin no //
translated: because there is no mixing, there is no unmixed, and because there is no substance of unmixedness, and because there is no class, like a tree, because it would follow that a single palace would be a garland.

original: med pa nyid ni ring po nyid du rigs pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: med pa nyid ni ring po nyid du rigs pa ma yin no ;
translated: Nonexistence is not suitable as length.

original: ; de bas na ji ltar bkod pa'i khyad par gyis phreng ba'i blo skyed pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab rnams la rags pa la sogs pa'i blo 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ; de bas na ji ltar bkod pa'i khyad par gyis phreng ba'i blo skyed pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab rnams la rags pa la sogs pa'i blo 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, just as the cognition of a garland arises from the particular arrangement, so the cognition of grossness, etc. arises from atoms.

original: mngon sum nyid kyis rdzas dang grangs dang / ldan pa la sogs pa shes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis rdzas dang grangs dang / ldan pa la sogs pa shes pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't substance, number, possession, etc. known by direct perception?

original: 'di ltar mig gi byed pa'i rjes la bum pa dang ldan pa dag gcig pa'o zhes bya bar rtogs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi byed pa'i rjes la bum pa dang ldan pa dag gcig pa'o zhes bya bar rtogs pa'o zhe na /
translated: Thus, after the function of the eye, one understands that the vase and the possessor are one.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: grangs dang ldan pa la sogs kyang //
analyzed: grangs dang ldan pa la sogs kyang //
translated: Number, possession, etc.

original: de dang ldan pa'i dngos nyid dang // brjod pa dag las tha dad par //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i dngos nyid dang // brjod pa dag las tha dad par //
translated: and the expressions, are not different from them.

original: ngo bo blo la mi snang ngo //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngo bo blo la mi snang ngo // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The entity does not appear to the mind.

original: grangs ni gcig nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: grangs ni gcig nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, number is singularity and so on.

original: ldan pa ni ldan pa'i shes pas gzung ba'o //
analyzed: ldan pa ni ldan pa'i shes pas gzung ba'o //
translated: Possession is apprehended by the consciousness of possession.

original: las ni 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las ni 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Action is going and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rigs la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //üîΩde dag dang ldan pa'i dngos po nyid las te grangs la sogs pa de gang la yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po de rnams las tha dad par dbang po las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rigs la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o // de dag dang ldan pa'i dngos po nyid las te grangs la sogs pa de gang la yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po de rnams las tha dad par dbang po las skyes pa'am /
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include type and so on.üîΩThe nature of things that possess those, such as number, that is, the things such as form that possess those, such as number, are not different from them. They do not appear to the mind that arises from the sense faculties,

original: rtogs pa dang bcas pa'i blo la gnas yan lag can la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid snang bar mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang bcas pa'i blo la gnas yan lag can la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid snang bar mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or to the mind that is conceptual, as the nature of a whole and so on.

original: rdzas la sogs pa rjod par byed pa las tha dad par rtogs pa'i blo la mi snang ste /
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa rjod par byed pa las tha dad par rtogs pa'i blo la mi snang ste /
translated: Or the expressions of substance and so on do not appear to the mind that apprehends them as different from them.

original: 'di ltar yan lag can la sogs pa ma lus pa yon tan sogs pas stong bar 'dod cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yan lag can la sogs pa ma lus pa yon tan sogs pas stong bar 'dod cing /
translated: In this way, it is asserted that wholes and so on are empty of qualities and so on.

original: mig gi shes pas kyang ldan pa can gzugs la sogs pa rtogs par 'gyur gyi rdzas la sogs pa tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi shes pas kyang ldan pa can gzugs la sogs pa rtogs par 'gyur gyi rdzas la sogs pa tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The eye consciousness also cognizes the possessor, form, and so on, but not the different substances and so on.

original: rtogs pa'i shes pa la yang gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid snang ba'am /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i shes pa la yang gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid snang ba'am /
translated: Also, the cognizing consciousness appears to have the nature of clarity,

original: brjod pa'i rang bzhin nang gi shes pas brjod par 'gyur ba nyid yin gyi rigs la sogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid @339b kyis snang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa'i rang bzhin nang gi shes pas brjod par 'gyur ba nyid yin gyi rigs la sogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid @339b kyis snang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: or it is expressed by the internal consciousness that has the nature of expression, but it does not appear to have the nature of the universals and so on.

original: 'di dag gis ni mi dmigs pa bstan pa yin no //üîΩgal te rigs la sogs pa mngon sum gyis mi shes pa de lta na yang brjod pa dang shes pa gcig gi rnam pa can mthong ba'i phyir rigs la sogs pa nges par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni mi dmigs pa bstan pa yin no // gal te rigs la sogs pa mngon sum gyis mi shes pa de lta na yang brjod pa dang shes pa gcig gi rnam pa can mthong ba'i phyir rigs la sogs pa nges par byed pa ste /
translated: These demonstrate nonobservation.üîΩEven if the universals and so on are not known by direct perception, they are ascertained because expression and consciousness are seen to have the same aspect.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rgyu mtshan las rigs la sogs pa mi rtogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rgyu mtshan las rigs la sogs pa mi rtogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Since the sign of the specific nature is not understood, how can universals and so on be ascertained?

original: de mi rigs te gang gi phyir //
analyzed: de mi rigs te gang gi phyir //
translated: That is illogical becauseüîΩthe universals and so on

original: dngos po tha dad rjes 'brang ba'i //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad rjes 'brang ba'i //
translated: are not different from the specific nature.

original: rnam par rtog pas sgra dang shes //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas sgra dang shes //
translated: Sound and cognition are imputed by thought.

original: brtags don can de dper yon tan //
analyzed: brtags don can de dper yon tan //
translated: The meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.

original: sogs pa'am zhig dang ma skyes bzhin /üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sogs pa'am zhig dang ma skyes bzhin / zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like a collection, or like a past or future thing.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.

original: shes pa dang brjod pa'i bye brag mi 'dra ba nyid kyi dngos po tha dad pa ni ma yin gyi /üîΩ'on kyang mngon sum gyi snang ba tha dad pas te /
analyzed: shes pa dang brjod pa'i bye brag mi 'dra ba nyid kyi dngos po tha dad pa ni ma yin gyi / 'on kyang mngon sum gyi snang ba tha dad pas te /
translated: The meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.

original: rtogs pa'i bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba'i rtogs pa'i blo ni rigs la sogs pa nyid du snang gi dngos po'i rgyu can ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba'i rtogs pa'i blo ni rigs la sogs pa nyid du snang gi dngos po'i rgyu can ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.

original: des na rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pas kun du brtags pa'i tha dad pa la brten nas rigs la sogs pa'i blo skye ste /üîΩ'di ltar ba lang gi gong bu la gzhan du dkar po nyid mthong zhing /
analyzed: des na rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pas kun du brtags pa'i tha dad pa la brten nas rigs la sogs pa'i blo skye ste /üîΩ'di ltar ba lang gi gong bu la gzhan du dkar po nyid mthong zhing /
translated: The meaning of the term is like a quality, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the term is like a

original: dkar po nyid la gzhan du ba lang nag po mthong ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa des rigs mi mthun pa rnam par gcod pa'i dngos po tha dad pa'i rjes su 'brangs ba'i rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i don can te /
analyzed: dkar po nyid la gzhan du ba lang nag po mthong ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa des rigs mi mthun pa rnam par gcod pa'i dngos po tha dad pa'i rjes su 'brangs ba'i rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i don can te /
translated: Because a black cow is seen as other than a white cow, the exclusion of the dissimilar class is the object designated by the conception that follows the different things.

original: sgro btags pa'i yul la sgra dang shes pa tha dad pa dag gis rigs dang yon tan la sogs pa tha dad par ji ltar sgrub par byed de /üîΩdper na yon tan la sogs pa rang bzhin gcig la /
