analyzed: sgro btags pa'i yul la sgra dang shes pa tha dad pa dag gis rigs dang yon tan la sogs pa tha dad par ji ltar sgrub par byed de / dper na yon tan la sogs pa rang bzhin gcig la /
translated: How do words and consciousnesses that are different establish the different classes, qualities, and so on of a superimposed object?

original: yon tan nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / las lnga yod kyang yon tan la sogs pa'i grangs yod pa la /üîΩgrangs yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yon tan nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / las lnga yod kyang yon tan la sogs pa'i grangs yod pa la / grangs yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: For example, although the twenty-four qualities and five actions exist in a single nature, the number of qualities and so on exists.

original: de rdzas la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rdzas la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The number does not exist in the substance because it is based on the substance.

original: rten gyi grangs la brtags nas de ltar tha snyad gdags par mi rung ste rten tha dad kyang gcig pu nyid do /
analyzed: rten gyi grangs la brtags nas de ltar tha snyad gdags par mi rung ste rten tha dad kyang gcig pu nyid do /
translated: It is not suitable to impute such conventions by investigating the number of bases because although the bases are different, they are one.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las /
translated: This is the commentary on the twenty-first chapter, having twenty-two verses, called ‚Äúthe examination of the self.‚Äù

original: bam po drug pa /üîΩzhig dang ma skyes rnams la yang //
analyzed: bam po drug pa / zhig dang ma skyes rnams la yang //
translated: Chapter VIüîΩHow can one understandüîΩThe past and futureüîΩTo be the same

original: ji ltar gcig pu nyid du shes //üîΩnye bar btags las 'dir 'dod na //
analyzed: ji ltar gcig pu nyid du shes // nye bar btags las 'dir 'dod na //
translated: As the present?üîΩIf you assert that this is due to

original: de rgyu can 'dod gang yin pa //üîΩde nyid dngos rnams thams cad la //
analyzed: de rgyu can 'dod gang yin pa // de nyid dngos rnams thams cad la //
translated: The designation of the present,üîΩWhy do you not assert

original: de dag gis rgyu cis mi 'dod //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag gis rgyu cis mi 'dod // ces bya ba la /
translated: That all things are like that?

original: gal te zhig pa dang ma byung ba dag la gcig pa nyid nye bar btags @340a * //üîΩnas tha snyad 'dogs pa dang / rtogs pa ni 'das pa la sogs pa la nye bar btags pa 'di ni rtogs pa'i shes pa'i rgyu can te /
analyzed: gal te zhig pa dang ma byung ba dag la gcig pa nyid nye bar btags @340a * // nas tha snyad 'dogs pa dang / rtogs pa ni 'das pa la sogs pa la nye bar btags pa 'di ni rtogs pa'i shes pa'i rgyu can te /
translated: If the past and future were to be designated as the same as the present,üîΩthen the designation and understanding of the past and so on would be due to theüîΩcognition of the present.  That which is posited by the cognition of the past

original: thog ma med pa'i rtogs pas lhag par gzhag pa de nyid dngos po rnams thams cad la sgra dang shes pa dag gi rgyur 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i rtogs pas lhag par gzhag pa de nyid dngos po rnams thams cad la sgra dang shes pa dag gi rgyur 'gyur gyi /
translated: and so on is the cause of the words and consciousnesses of all things, but it is

original: dngos po reg pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: dngos po reg pa ma yin no ;
translated: not the cause of the things themselves.

original: / nye bar 'dogs pa'ang kun du min //
analyzed: / nye bar 'dogs pa'ang kun du min //
translated: The designation is not universal.

original: gal te tha dad khyad par can //
analyzed: gal te tha dad khyad par can //
translated: If it is different,üîΩthen what is it that is called

original: dngos zhes bya ni 'dis ci shes //
analyzed: dngos zhes bya ni 'dis ci shes //
translated: ‚Äúthing‚Äù?

original: gal te tha dad med pa dag //
analyzed: gal te tha dad med pa dag //
translated: If it is not different,

original: tha dad med don can zhe na //
analyzed: tha dad med don can zhe na //
translated: If you say that it has the meaning of non-difference,

original: don gzhan min rgyu can yin yang //
analyzed: don gzhan min rgyu can yin yang //
translated: although it has the meaning of non-difference of object,

original: dkar po sogs la grangs la sogs //
analyzed: dkar po sogs la grangs la sogs //
translated: in white, etc., the number, etc.

original: ldan pa can sgra rnam grangs min //
analyzed: ldan pa can sgra rnam grangs min //
translated: are not synonyms of the word.

original: gal te de la 'ang don gzhan na //
analyzed: gal te de la 'ang don gzhan na //
translated: If there is another object there,

original: yon tan dang rdzas khyad med 'gyur //
analyzed: yon tan dang rdzas khyad med 'gyur //
translated: the quality and substance would be indistinguishable.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what is said.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi nye bar btags pa zhes bya ba dngos kyi rgyu can te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi nye bar btags pa zhes bya ba dngos kyi rgyu can te /
translated: It is indeed so, but it is based on the so-called nominal cause.

original: de ji ltar dngos med na gdags par rung /
analyzed: de ji ltar dngos med na gdags par rung /
translated: How can it be imputed if it is not a real thing?

original: dngos ni tha dad par 'jig rten pa la grags pa'i dbyug pa can la sogs pa'i khyad par can bzhin la tha mi dad pa'i khyad par ces ni btags pa'o //
analyzed: dngos ni tha dad par 'jig rten pa la grags pa'i dbyug pa can la sogs pa'i khyad par can bzhin la tha mi dad pa'i khyad par ces ni btags pa'o //
translated: The real thing is like the distinction of the stick-holder, etc., which is known in the world as different. The distinction of the non-different is imputed.

original: sangs rgyas pa ni snga ma snga mas rtogs pas gzhag pa tsam ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa ni snga ma snga mas rtogs pas gzhag pa tsam ste /
translated: The Buddhist says: It is merely posited by the realization of the former.

original: khyad par can mi srid pas //
analyzed: khyad par can mi srid pas //
translated: Since the distinguished is impossible,

original: tha dad par gyur pa'i khyad par can nyid med na /
analyzed: tha dad par gyur pa'i khyad par can nyid med na /
translated: if there is no distinguished that is different,

original: dngos po med pas kun du btags par med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po med pas kun du btags par med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: since there is no real thing, the imputation would be non-existent.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gang gi phyi tha dad pa'i khyad par can gang yin pa de ni dngos zhes bya na /
analyzed: gang gi phyi tha dad pa'i khyad par can gang yin pa de ni dngos zhes bya na /
translated: That which is qualified by a difference external to itself is called a real thing.

original: de yang cis shes te /
analyzed: de yang cis shes te /
translated: How do you know that?

original: tha dad pa'i khyad par can dang bral ba yang /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i khyad par can dang bral ba yang /
translated: That which is devoid of a difference external to itself

original: rtogs pas mthong ba'i tha dad pa'i khyad par can grags tshod tsam ni dngos po kho na ste /
analyzed: rtogs pas mthong ba'i tha dad pa'i khyad par can grags tshod tsam ni dngos po kho na ste /
translated: is a mere imputation, as is the case with the difference external to itself that is perceived by conceptual cognition.

original: ma bkyogs par rtogs pa'i blo'i yul ni dngos yin la /
analyzed: ma bkyogs par rtogs pa'i blo'i yul ni dngos yin la /
translated: The object of a non-deviating cognition is a real thing.

original: bkyogs pa ni rtogs pa can gyi shes pa'i yul ni btags pa'o zhe na 'jig rten pa la grags pa'o //
analyzed: bkyogs pa ni rtogs pa can gyi shes pa'i yul ni btags pa'o zhe na 'jig rten pa la grags pa'o //
translated: The object of a deviating cognition is an imputation. This is what is accepted in the world.

original: gzhan yang yul tha dad pa can nyid dngos yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang yul tha dad pa can nyid dngos yin la /
translated: Moreover, if the object with a difference external to itself is a real thing,

original: cig shos btags pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: cig shos btags pa'o zhe na /
translated: the other is an imputation.

original: de lta bu thams cad btags pa nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta bu thams cad btags pa nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: All of that is indeed an imputation,

original: tha dad pa'i khyad par can med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i khyad par can med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference external to itself.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa la ni khyad par yang med pa'i phyir nye bar btags par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa la ni khyad par yang med pa'i phyir nye bar btags par 'gyur ro ;
translated: In the case of the past, etc., there is no difference at all, so they are mere imputations.

original: ; gal te tha dad pa'i khyad par can med na /
analyzed: ; gal te tha dad pa'i khyad par can med na /
translated: If there is no difference external to itself,

original: de'i tshe tha mi dad pa'i brjod par bya ba ni tha dad med pa'i don can te rnam grangs pa'i rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i tshe tha mi dad pa'i brjod par bya ba ni tha dad med pa'i don can te rnam grangs pa'i rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur zhing /
translated: At that time, the object of expression that is not different has the meaning of not being different, and it would be a synonym of the nature itself.

original: bum pa gcig ces bya ba gzhi mthun par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bum pa gcig ces bya ba gzhi mthun par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And it would not be a common locus, saying ‚Äúone pot,‚Äù

original: rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu mtshan yod na der 'gyur ba'i phyir ma yin nam @340b zhe na de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu mtshan yod na der 'gyur ba'i phyir ma yin nam @340b zhe na de ni mi bden te /
translated: because if there were a reason for differentiation, it would be that.

original: gang gi phyir 'di la don gzhan pa'i rgyu med pa can de'i dngos po 'di ni don gzhan min pa'i rgyu can te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la don gzhan pa'i rgyu med pa can de'i dngos po 'di ni don gzhan min pa'i rgyu can te /
translated: That is not correct, because in this case, the entity that lacks a cause of another object has a cause that is not another object.

original: dkar po la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams la grangs la sogs pa'i ldan pa can gzugs gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnam grangs ma yin par mthong ba de bzhin du rdzas la sogs pa rnams kyang rnam grangs ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams la grangs la sogs pa'i ldan pa can gzugs gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnam grangs ma yin par mthong ba de bzhin du rdzas la sogs pa rnams kyang rnam grangs ma yin pa'o //
translated: Just as the word ‚Äúone‚Äù is seen to be a synonym for qualities such as white and so on that possess number and so forth, so too substances and so on are not synonyms.

original: dkar po la sogs pa de la yang grangs la sogs pa don gzhan ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa de la yang grangs la sogs pa don gzhan ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But are number and so on not different objects in white and so on?

original: de lta na ni rdzas dang / yon tan dag la khyad par med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni rdzas dang / yon tan dag la khyad par med par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, there would be no difference between substance and quality.

original: 'di ltar bya ba dang ldan pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa dang / 'du ba'i rgyu can ni rdzas yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ba dang ldan pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa dang / 'du ba'i rgyu can ni rdzas yin no //
translated: For, substance is that which possesses action, possesses qualities, and is the cause of aggregation.

original: gal te yang yon tan la sogs pa la yang grangs la sogs pa la yod na /
analyzed: gal te yang yon tan la sogs pa la yang grangs la sogs pa la yod na /
translated: If number, etc., exist in quality, etc.,

original: de lta na ni yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir rdzas nyid dang gcig tu 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na ni yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir rdzas nyid dang gcig tu 'gyur gyi /
translated: then because of possessing qualities, substance would be identical with quality, etc.

original: yon tan la sogs tha dad pa ni yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan la sogs tha dad pa ni yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not identical.

original: gal te gzhan gyi gzhung la dkar po la sogs pa la grangs la sogs pa'i sgra mi rigs pa de lta na yang khyed kyi lugs kyis don tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi gzhung la dkar po la sogs pa la grangs la sogs pa'i sgra mi rigs pa de lta na yang khyed kyi lugs kyis don tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is not correct to apply the words ‚Äúnumber, etc.,‚Äù to white, etc., in the system of the opponent, then how could they be different in your system?

original: mi gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mi gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: They would not be different, would they?

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩldog pa tha dad phyir tha dad //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / ldog pa tha dad phyir tha dad //
translated: Here we say:

original: gyur te don gzhan min don can //
analyzed: gyur te don gzhan min don can //
translated: They are different because of the difference in their negations.üîΩThey are not different objects,

original: yin yang las rdzas min sgra bzhin //
analyzed: yin yang las rdzas min sgra bzhin //
translated: but like the word ‚Äúsubstance,‚Äù they are not substantial actions.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: sangs rgyas pa'i lugs kyis grangs la sogs pa'i sgra tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i lugs kyis grangs la sogs pa'i sgra tha dad pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhist system holds that the words are different in number.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: ldog pas byas pa'i tha dad pas kun du btags pa'i tha dad pa can gyi brjod par bya ba tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ldog pas byas pa'i tha dad pas kun du btags pa'i tha dad pa can gyi brjod par bya ba tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the difference in the objects of expression, which are distinguished by the difference in their exclusions.

original: dper na rdzas ni las ma yin la /
analyzed: dper na rdzas ni las ma yin la /
translated: For example, substance is not action,

original: las ni rdzas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: las ni rdzas ma yin gyi /
translated: and action is not substance.

original: 'di na don gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di na don gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But there is no other object here.

original: de ltar na yang las ma yin pa dang rdzas ma yin pa'i sgra la sogs pa rnams /
analyzed: de ltar na yang las ma yin pa dang rdzas ma yin pa'i sgra la sogs pa rnams /
translated: Thus, the words ‚Äúnot action‚Äù and ‚Äúnot substance‚Äù and so on

original: rnam grangs pa ma yin pa de bas na ldog pa tha dad pa nyid sgra dang shes pa'i rgyu yin gyi rigs la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs pa ma yin pa de bas na ldog pa tha dad pa nyid sgra dang shes pa'i rgyu yin gyi rigs la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: are not synonyms. Therefore, the difference in their exclusions is the cause of the difference in the words and their meanings, not the universal and so on.

original: gal te rigs la sogs pa med na /
analyzed: gal te rigs la sogs pa med na /
translated: If there are no universals and so on,

original: 'o na ni ba lang dkar po dang ba lang gi dkar po nyid ces bya ba'i gzhi mthun pa dang / tha dad pa'i rten can du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni ba lang dkar po dang ba lang gi dkar po nyid ces bya ba'i gzhi mthun pa dang / tha dad pa'i rten can du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then how can there be a common locus for the statements ‚Äúa white cow‚Äù and ‚Äúthe whiteness of a cow,‚Äù which are based on difference and nondifference?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: dngos po brjod pa'i sgra rnams kyis //
analyzed: dngos po brjod pa'i sgra rnams kyis //
translated: By the words that express the entity,

original: de dang ldan las tha dad bzhin //
analyzed: de dang ldan las tha dad bzhin //
translated: it is as if it were different from that which possesses it.

original: grangs sogs brjod pa gang de yang //
analyzed: grangs sogs brjod pa gang de yang //
translated: And that which is expressed by number, etc.

original: chos gzhan gcod par byed pa yin //
analyzed: chos gzhan gcod par byed pa yin //
translated: is also a distinguisher of other properties.

original: de tsam shes par 'dod pa la //
analyzed: de tsam shes par 'dod pa la //
translated: For one who wishes to know just that much,

original: ma lus gzhan ni spong can sgra //
analyzed: ma lus gzhan ni spong can sgra //
translated: the word is one that excludes all else.

original: tha dad chos bzhin @341a * //
analyzed: tha dad chos bzhin @341a * //
translated: Like a distinguisher of properties,

original: rjod byed de //
analyzed: rjod byed de //
translated: it is an expresser.

original: la lar sor mo gshibs pa bzhin //üîΩdon gcig brjod kyang thams cad ni //
analyzed: la lar sor mo gshibs pa bzhin // don gcig brjod kyang thams cad ni //
translated: In some cases, like the fingers,üîΩeven though one thing is expressed,

original: spong min phyir chos can brjod can //üîΩgrags te sor mo gshibs pa bzhin //
analyzed: spong min phyir chos can brjod can // grags te sor mo gshibs pa bzhin //
translated: all are not excluded, so the word expresses the property possessor.üîΩIt is well known, like the fingers.

original: de lta'i brdar ni gnas pa can //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta'i brdar ni gnas pa can // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is established as a sign in that way.

original: gang yang zhes bya ba ni grangs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba ni grangs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to number, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ldan pa la sogs par bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ldan pa la sogs par bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes possession, etc.

original: grangs la sogs pa gang la yod pa de dang ldan pa'i chos can de las tha dad pa bzhin du brjod do //
analyzed: grangs la sogs pa gang la yod pa de dang ldan pa'i chos can de las tha dad pa bzhin du brjod do //
translated: That which has number, etc. is expressed as if it were different from the property possessor that possesses it.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: sgra rnams kyis te /
analyzed: sgra rnams kyis te /
translated: By the words.

original: dngos po brjod pa ni chos brjod pa rnams kyis grangs la sogs pa de chos gzhan gcod par byed pa ste tha dad pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po brjod pa ni chos brjod pa rnams kyis grangs la sogs pa de chos gzhan gcod par byed pa ste tha dad pas gnas pa'o //
translated: The expression of the thing is the expression of the property which excludes other properties by means of number, etc. , and it is the basis of difference.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos gzhan spong ba'i chos de tsam zhig shes par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos gzhan spong ba'i chos de tsam zhig shes par 'dod pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the property which excludes other properties is just that much which is desired to be known.

original: bstan par bya ba la sgras tha dad pa'i chos bzhin ston pa'o //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba la sgras tha dad pa'i chos bzhin ston pa'o //
translated: It is taught in the expression of the thing, just as the property is taught in the expression of the property.

original: sgra ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩma lus gzhan spong ba can te /
analyzed: sgra ji lta bu zhe na / ma lus gzhan spong ba can te /
translated: What is the expression like?üîΩIt is the expression which excludes all others.

original: gzhan dag ma lus pa'i chos de'i bdag nyid kyis spong bar byed pa gang yin pa'i sgra de'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ma lus pa'i chos de'i bdag nyid kyis spong bar byed pa gang yin pa'i sgra de'o //
translated: It is the expression which excludes all other properties by means of the identity of that property.

original: 'dir yang dper brjod ba ni la la zhig tu sor mo gshibs pa bzhin zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang dper brjod ba ni la la zhig tu sor mo gshibs pa bzhin zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: Here, the example is like the expression of the fingers.

original: chos brjod pa can du grags pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: chos brjod pa can du grags pa'i sgra'o //
translated: It is the expression which is known as the expression of the property.

original: sor mo gshibs pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni chos can ston pa'i sgra ste /
analyzed: sor mo gshibs pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni chos can ston pa'i sgra ste /
translated: The expression of the fingers is the expression which teaches the property possessor.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: chos rnams thams cad spangs bas de'i bdag nyid du ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad spangs bas de'i bdag nyid du ston pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it teaches the identity of the property possessor by excluding all other properties.

original: don dam par na sor mo ma gshibs pa rnam par bshad nas don gcig tu brjod cing ston gyi /
analyzed: don dam par na sor mo ma gshibs pa rnam par bshad nas don gcig tu brjod cing ston gyi /
translated: In the ultimate sense, the fingers are not separated, but are explained as one thing and are taught as one.

original: 'dir ni rnam par dbye bar rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam par dbye bar rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But here, it is not understood as a division.

original: 'o na don gzhan spong ba dang / mi spong ba nyid du spyi med par ji ltar shes she na de'i phyir /üîΩde yi brdar ni gnas pa can //
analyzed: 'o na don gzhan spong ba dang / mi spong ba nyid du spyi med par ji ltar shes she na de'i phyir / de yi brdar ni gnas pa can //
translated: Well, how is it known that there is no universal which excludes or does not exclude another universal?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩIt is a sign of that.

original: de ltar chos gzhan spong ba dang / mi spong ba dag gis byas pa'i brdar gnas ba gang yin pa'i sgra de de ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar chos gzhan spong ba dang / mi spong ba dag gis byas pa'i brdar gnas ba gang yin pa'i sgra de de ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: The word is a sign of that which is made by the exclusion or non-exclusion of other things.

original: 'dir 'di dag gis bsdus pa'i don ni ji ltar shes pa'i brjod bya tha dad pas rnam grangs par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir 'di dag gis bsdus pa'i don ni ji ltar shes pa'i brjod bya tha dad pas rnam grangs par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du brjod do //
translated: Here, the meaning of the collection is expressed in such a way that the object of expression is not a synonym because of a difference in knowledge.

original: brjod par bya ba don dam par tha mi dad kyang ldog pa'i chas brtags pa tha dad par mthong ba ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba don dam par tha mi dad kyang ldog pa'i chas brtags pa tha dad par mthong ba ste /
translated: The object of expression is not ultimately different, but is seen as different because of the imagined aspect of exclusion.

original: dper na gtun bu'i lus dang / skra can gyi mgo bo lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gtun bu'i lus dang / skra can gyi mgo bo lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the body of a pestle and the head of a man with scabies.

original: de bzhin du ba lang gi dkar po nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir ba lang gi rnam par gcig tu rtogs pa skye ba ni ba lang thams cad la yin par brjod la /
analyzed: de bzhin du ba lang gi dkar po nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir ba lang gi rnam par gcig tu rtogs pa skye ba ni ba lang thams cad la yin par brjod la /
translated: Similarly, because of the whiteness of a cow, the cognition of the oneness of the cow arises in regard to all cows.

original: dkar po zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi phyogs gcig yin yang /
analyzed: dkar po zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi phyogs gcig yin yang /
translated: And although whiteness is a part of the cow,

original: dkar po rtogs pa skyed pa ni @341b don gzhan yang ston pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dkar po rtogs pa skyed pa ni @341b don gzhan yang ston pa ni ma yin no //
translated: the cognition of whiteness does not arise in regard to another object.

original: de bas na ba lang nyid dang dkar po nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis tha dad par brtags pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na ba lang nyid dang dkar po nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis tha dad par brtags pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since cowness and whiteness are imagined to be different through concomitance and nonconcomitance,

original: ba lang gi dkar po yon tan yin no zhes tha dad pa'i rnam par dbye bar byed pa brjod de /
analyzed: ba lang gi dkar po yon tan yin no zhes tha dad pa'i rnam par dbye bar byed pa brjod de /
translated: it is said that the statement ‚ÄúThe whiteness of the cow is a quality‚Äù makes a different distinction.

original: gang gi tshe ba lang gi rnam pa la zhen pa med par 'brel pa can gyi khyad par can dang bral ba dkar po 'ba' zhig nges par byed pa de'i tshe dkar po 'di su'i yin zhes dris na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ba lang gi rnam pa la zhen pa med par 'brel pa can gyi khyad par can dang bral ba dkar po 'ba' zhig nges par byed pa de'i tshe dkar po 'di su'i yin zhes dris na /
translated: When one ascertains the mere white, free from the connection with the qualitiy of belonging to a cow, without being attached to the aspect of the cow, then when asked, ‚ÄúWhose is this white?‚Äù

original: ba lang gi rdzas nges pa can gyis ston par byed pas kyang ba lang gi dkar po zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: ba lang gi rdzas nges pa can gyis ston par byed pas kyang ba lang gi dkar po zhes ston par byed do //
translated: one points out the cow, which is the possessor of the substance, and one says, ‚ÄúThe cow‚Äôs.‚Äù

original: der yang de'i bdag nyid kho nar 'dod pa ldog pa ston pa ni dang po dkar po 'ba' zhig nges shing ba lang gi gong bu ma nges pa'i phyir ldog pa bstan to //
analyzed: der yang de'i bdag nyid kho nar 'dod pa ldog pa ston pa ni dang po dkar po 'ba' zhig nges shing ba lang gi gong bu ma nges pa'i phyir ldog pa bstan to //
translated: In that case, the mere white is ascertained first, and the cow is not ascertained, so the exclusion is shown.

original: gang gi tshe yang dkar po nyid 'ba' zhig 'dod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ba lang dkar po'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang dkar po nyid 'ba' zhig 'dod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ba lang dkar po'am /
translated: When one does not want the mere white, one thinks, ‚ÄúThe white belongs to the cow,‚Äù or ‚ÄúThe white belongs to another.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi dkar po yin snyam du 'brel pa can gyi khyad par shes par bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dkar po yin snyam du 'brel pa can gyi khyad par shes par bya ba la /
translated: In order to understand the connection with the quality,

original: blo dman pa nyid can gyi nyan pa pos dkar po 'di ba lang yin nam /
analyzed: blo dman pa nyid can gyi nyan pa pos dkar po 'di ba lang yin nam /
translated: the listener, who is of low intelligence, thinks, ‚ÄúIs this white a cow?‚Äù

original: gzhan ci zhig yin zhes 'dri bar byed cing smra pa pos kyang ba lang yin zhes gzhi mthun pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan ci zhig yin zhes 'dri bar byed cing smra pa pos kyang ba lang yin zhes gzhi mthun pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: and the questioner replies, ‚ÄúIt is a cow,‚Äù and the two agree on the basis of a common appearance.

original: chos khongs su chud pa nyid kyis 'dri ba'i phyir dris pa dang mthun par lan yang gdab par rigs so //
analyzed: chos khongs su chud pa nyid kyis 'dri ba'i phyir dris pa dang mthun par lan yang gdab par rigs so //
translated: Since the question is asked by means of the inclusion of the property, it is proper to answer the question in accordance with the question.

original: de'i phyir ba lang dang / dkar po nyid dag rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa las tha dad par nges pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ba lang dang / dkar po nyid dag rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa las tha dad par nges pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment of the cow and whiteness is different from the ascertainment of the concomitance and the reverse pervasion.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa de dag kyang thog ma med par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa de dag kyang thog ma med par gnas pa'o //
translated: And those concomitance and reverse pervasion have existed from beginningless time.

original: de dag gis ni rigs dang yon tan gyi rjod byed dag tha dad par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni rigs dang yon tan gyi rjod byed dag tha dad par bstan pa yin no //
translated: They demonstrate that the terms for the class and the quality are different.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i yan lag can med na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i yan lag can med na /
translated: If the whole does not exist separately from form and so on,

original: de'i tshe bum pa dang gzugs la 'di don gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe bum pa dang gzugs la 'di don gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: then aren‚Äôt the terms pot and form synonymous?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: gzugs sogs nus pa'i khyad par rnams //
analyzed: gzugs sogs nus pa'i khyad par rnams //
translated: The particular capacity of form and so on

original: spong bas de 'bras mtshungs pa yi //
analyzed: spong bas de 'bras mtshungs pa yi //
translated: And by abandoning it, one attains the result similar to it.üîΩ

original: rgyu yin pa ni rnam gcod na //
analyzed: rgyu yin pa ni rnam gcod na //
translated: The word ‚Äúvase‚Äù is used to exclude what is not a cause of the effect of the capacity of form, etc.

original: bum pa'i sgra ni 'jug par 'gyur //üîΩde'i phyir bum pa gzugs zhes pa //
analyzed: bum pa'i sgra ni 'jug par 'gyur // de'i phyir bum pa gzugs zhes pa //
translated: that is located in the vase.

original: gzhi mthun pa can sgra ma yin //
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa can sgra ma yin //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúvase‚Äù is not a term that applies to a common locusüîΩof ‚Äúform‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-exclusion of what is not a cause of the effect of the capacity of form, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: that is located in the vase.‚ÄùüîΩThe capacity of form, etc.

original: gang gi phyir bum pa la gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i nus pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bum pa la gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i nus pa ni gnyis te /
translated: that is located in a vase is twofold:

original: chu len par byed pa dang so sor nges pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chu len par byed pa dang so sor nges pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: it is the capacity to pick up water and the capacity to generate the visual consciousness, etc. that is specific to each sense faculty.üîΩThe word ‚Äúvase‚Äù is used to exclude the specific capacity of form, etc.

original: de la gang gzugs la sogs pa la so sor nges pa'i nus pa'i khyad @342a * //üîΩpar de rnams spong ba ste /
analyzed: de la gang gzugs la sogs pa la so sor nges pa'i nus pa'i khyad @342a * // par de rnams spong ba ste /
translated: that is specific to each sense faculty.

original: de ma bstan par bum pa'i sgras 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma bstan par bum pa'i sgras 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúvase‚Äù is used to exclude that capacity and to indicate the capacity to pick up water.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where is it used?

original: bum pa la sogs pa de rnams kyis chu len pa la sogs pa 'bras bu gcig pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu ma yin pa shing la sogs pa gang yin pa de la rnam par gcod pa na 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa de rnams kyis chu len pa la sogs pa 'bras bu gcig pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu ma yin pa shing la sogs pa gang yin pa de la rnam par gcod pa na 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: It is used to exclude what is not a cause of the effect of picking up water, etc. that is common to all of those vases, etc.

original: rdzas du ma yod na yang /
analyzed: rdzas du ma yod na yang /
translated: Even though there are many substances,

original: chu len pa'i nus pa bstan pa'i phyir brdar byas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzugs la sogs pa de rnams la yang bum pa zhes bya ba nus pa gcig la tshig gcig rigs pa yin gyi //
analyzed: chu len pa'i nus pa bstan pa'i phyir brdar byas pa'i phyir ro // gzugs la sogs pa de rnams la yang bum pa zhes bya ba nus pa gcig la tshig gcig rigs pa yin gyi //
translated: the word ‚Äúvase‚Äù is used to indicate the capacity to hold water.üîΩAnd it is reasonable that the word ‚Äúvase‚Äù should refer to a single capacity with regard to those things such as form, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar tha dad pa de'i phyir bum pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba don gcig pa can gyi sgra ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar tha dad pa de'i phyir bum pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba don gcig pa can gyi sgra ma yin zhing /
translated: But because they are different, the words ‚Äúform of the vase‚Äù do not have the same meaning,

original: gzhi mthun pa can yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa can yang ma yin te /
translated: and they do not have a common locus.

original: gzhi mthun pa ni rigs brjod pa dang / khyad par brjod pa yod na yin te /
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa ni rigs brjod pa dang / khyad par brjod pa yod na yin te /
translated: A common locus exists when there is a statement of a universal and a statement of a particular,

original: gzhi mthun pas khyad par 'phen pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhi mthun pas khyad par 'phen pa yin no //
translated: because a common locus is implied by a particular.

original: nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /üîΩrigs dang tshogs kyi rjod byed kyi //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir / rigs dang tshogs kyi rjod byed kyi //
translated: In order to summarize this, he says:üîΩThis is also accepted as a distinction

original: khyad par 'di yang 'dod pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: khyad par 'di yang 'dod pa yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: in the expression of a class and a collection.

original: de'i phyir tshogs ba rjod par byed pa bum pa zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs ba rjod par byed pa bum pa zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúvase,‚Äù which expresses a collection, depends on a collection of form, etc.

original: rigs rjod par byed pa ni gzugs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rigs rjod par byed pa ni gzugs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúform‚Äù is the name-base.

original: de dag gis khyad par ni spong ba dang mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis khyad par ni spong ba dang mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid 'di nyid yin no //
translated: The difference between them is that the former is not abandoned, but the latter is.

original: tshogs pa gzhan la ltos na bum pa'i sgra yang rigs brjod pa nyid de /
analyzed: tshogs pa gzhan la ltos na bum pa'i sgra yang rigs brjod pa nyid de /
translated: The word ‚Äúpot‚Äù is also a name-base, since it depends on another collection.

original: tshogs pa'i sgra kha cig tshogs pa'i rjod byed yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i sgra kha cig tshogs pa'i rjod byed yin te /
translated: Some words for collections are names for collections,

original: dper na 'bigs byed kyi sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'bigs byed kyi sgra bzhin no //
translated: like the word ‚ÄúVindhya.‚Äù

original: kha cig gnyi ga'i rjod byed yin te /
analyzed: kha cig gnyi ga'i rjod byed yin te /
translated: Some are names for both,

original: dper na bum pa'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa'i sgra bzhin no //
translated: like the word ‚Äúpot.‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar gzugs la sogs pa 'ba' zhig bum pa'i sgra'i brjod bya yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te de ltar gzugs la sogs pa 'ba' zhig bum pa'i sgra'i brjod bya yin gyi /
translated: If only form, etc., are the referents of the word ‚Äúpot,‚Äù

original: rdzas ma yin na ni de'i tshe bum pa'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ji ltar tha dad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas ma yin na ni de'i tshe bum pa'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ji ltar tha dad pa yin zhe na /
translated: and not substance, then how can one say ‚Äúthe form, etc., of a pot‚Äù as if they are different?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: bum pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams zhes //
analyzed: bum pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams zhes //
translated: The words ‚Äúthe form, etc., of a pot‚Äù

original: spyi de dmigs kyi dgar ba can //
analyzed: spyi de dmigs kyi dgar ba can //
translated: refer to the universal, but the word ‚Äúof‚Äù

original: de yi nus pa'i khyad par ston //
analyzed: de yi nus pa'i khyad par ston //
translated: indicates a particular capacity.

original: phyogs 'dis gzhan la 'ang brjod pa yin //
analyzed: phyogs 'dis gzhan la 'ang brjod pa yin //
translated: This method should be applied to the others.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: bum pa'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes brdar btags pa 'dis ni bum pa'i spyi de khyad par du dmigs kyis 'ger ba gang yin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa de rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges pa'i bye brag mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed par
analyzed: bum pa'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes brdar btags pa 'dis ni bum pa'i spyi de khyad par du dmigs kyis 'ger ba gang yin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa de rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges pa'i bye brag mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed par
translated: by the expression ‚Äúthe form, etc. of the pot,‚Äù he shows that the power of those forms, etc. which are specified by the universal ‚Äúpot‚Äù is the particular that generates the eye consciousness.

original: ston te // gzugs la sogs pa chu len @342b pa la sogs pa'i dgos pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ston te // gzugs la sogs pa chu len @342b pa la sogs pa'i dgos pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they are the forms, etc. which have the purpose of taking up water, etc.

original: phyogs 'dis ni tshogs pa'i sgra gzhan la yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs 'dis ni tshogs pa'i sgra gzhan la yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: By this method, the expression ‚Äúcollection‚Äù should be applied to other cases as well.

original: dper na me tog gi dri zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na me tog gi dri zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚Äúthe fragrance of a flower.‚Äù

original: de la yang me tog las dri zhes bya ba gzhan pa'i rdzas med do //
analyzed: de la yang me tog las dri zhes bya ba gzhan pa'i rdzas med do //
translated: In that case, there is no substance called ‚Äúfragrance‚Äù that is other than the flower.

original: 'o na ci zhe na dri gzhan du ma rnam par gcad pa'i phyir me tog gi ngo bo nyid kyi drir brjod do //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na dri gzhan du ma rnam par gcad pa'i phyir me tog gi ngo bo nyid kyi drir brjod do //
translated: What is it, then? It is the fragrance that is the intrinsic reality of the flower, because it is a fragrance that is distinguished from other fragrances.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsum gyis ni tshogs pa'i sgra rnams la gzhi mthun pa med pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra tha dad par bstan pa'i yin no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsum gyis ni tshogs pa'i sgra rnams la gzhi mthun pa med pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra tha dad par bstan pa'i yin no //
translated: These three verses show that the words for collections have no common basis, and that the words for form, etc., are different.

original: de'i phyir yan lag kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir yan lag kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, only the parts exist,

original: yan lag ma yin pa ni med do //
analyzed: yan lag ma yin pa ni med do //
translated: not the non-part.

original: gal te yan lag can med na yang de'i tshe yan lag rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin mod ce na /
analyzed: gal te yan lag can med na yang de'i tshe yan lag rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin mod ce na /
translated: If the whole does not exist, then the parts are the cause of consciousness.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: ma lus rgyu nyid yin na yang //
analyzed: ma lus rgyu nyid yin na yang //
translated: Even if they are the cause of the whole,

original: yan lag gcig dang bral na'ang min //
analyzed: yan lag gcig dang bral na'ang min //
translated: they are not without one part.

original: re re'ang nus pa nyid yin na //
analyzed: re re'ang nus pa nyid yin na //
translated: If each has the ability,

original: cig car mang po 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: cig car mang po 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: many would arise simultaneously.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here it is said:

original: re zhig lus las tha mi dad pa'i sems yod pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: re zhig lus las tha mi dad pa'i sems yod pa ma yin te ;
translated: First, the mind is not different from the body,

original: rdul phra rab thams cad rigs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rdul phra rab thams cad rigs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: because it would follow that all atoms would have it.

original: 'on te lus kyi yan lag las tha dad par gyur pa'i shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: 'on te lus kyi yan lag las tha dad par gyur pa'i shes pa skye ste /
translated: But if consciousness arises as different from the parts of the body,üîΩthen it would not be the cause of the body.

original: des na rdul phra rab rnams rgyu nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: des na rdul phra rab rnams rgyu nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, subtle particles are the cause of the body,

original: rigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but not the reason.

original: dper na mig la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na mig la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, it is like the eyes and so on.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: lus kyi yan lag rnams tshogs pa'i mig la sogs pa nyid du myu gu'i yin pa bzhin yin nam /
analyzed: lus kyi yan lag rnams tshogs pa'i mig la sogs pa nyid du myu gu'i yin pa bzhin yin nam /
translated: Are the eyes and so on, which are the collection of the body's limbs, the cause of the sprout?

original: dper na mi 'bar ba la rtsva rnams bzhin yan lag so so ba shes pa'i rgyu yin grang na /
analyzed: dper na mi 'bar ba la rtsva rnams bzhin yan lag so so ba shes pa'i rgyu yin grang na /
translated: Or are the individual limbs the cause of the cognition of the body, like the grass that is the cause of a fire?

original: de la yang lag rnams ma lus pa nyid shes pa'i rgyu yin na ni lag pa la sogs pa'i yan lag gcig ma tshang na yang yid kyi shes ba med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la yang lag rnams ma lus pa nyid shes pa'i rgyu yin na ni lag pa la sogs pa'i yan lag gcig ma tshang na yang yid kyi shes ba med par 'gyur te /
translated: If the body's limbs are the cause of the cognition of the body, then if one limb, such as the hand, is missing, mental cognition would not exist.

original: gang du phan tshun grogs byed pas de dag gi bya ba 'bras bu gcig byed pa ni der gcig med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du phan tshun grogs byed pas de dag gi bya ba 'bras bu gcig byed pa ni der gcig med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because where they mutually assist each other, if one is missing, the function of producing a single effect will not occur.

original: de med par 'bras bu skye na ni 'di rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med par 'bras bu skye na ni 'di rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the effect arises without that, then it would be causeless.

original: 'on te yan lag phan tshun ltos pa med pa nyid du 'bras bu skyed pas de'i phyir lag pa la sogs pa bcad kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yan lag phan tshun ltos pa med pa nyid du 'bras bu skyed pas de'i phyir lag pa la sogs pa bcad kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the limbs are not mutually dependent, then the mental consciousness would arise even if the hands and so on were cut off, because the effect is generated by the limbs.

original: de lta na ni re re bas nus par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na ni re re bas nus par 'gyur la /
translated: If that were so, then each limb would be able to generate it,

original: re ra bas nus pa de la ni shes pa mang po skye bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: re ra bas nus pa de la ni shes pa mang po skye bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: and it follows that many consciousnesses would arise from each limb,

original: dper na re re ba'i sa bon nus pa can mang po yod na myu gu 'byung ba bzhin no //üîΩ'on te 'byung ba dang rngub pa @343a * //
analyzed: dper na re re ba'i sa bon nus pa can mang po yod na myu gu 'byung ba bzhin no // 'on te 'byung ba dang rngub pa @343a * //
translated: just as many sprouts arise from many seeds that have the ability to generate sprouts.

original: dag skyed par byed pa yin gyi yan lag rnams ni grogs byed pa nyid de 'byung ba dang rngub pa gcig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dag skyed par byed pa yin gyi yan lag rnams ni grogs byed pa nyid de 'byung ba dang rngub pa gcig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if inhalation and exhalation generate it, the limbs assist it, because inhalation and exhalation are one.

original: yan lag du ma yin yang shes pa gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: yan lag du ma yin yang shes pa gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Even though there are many limbs, there is only one consciousness.

original: phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu tha dad pas 'bras bu tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu tha dad pas 'bras bu tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The effect is not different because the assisting causes are different.

original: dper na thag sha gzhan dang gzhan yod kyang snam bu la sogs pa tha dad pa ma yin pa lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: dper na thag sha gzhan dang gzhan yod kyang snam bu la sogs pa tha dad pa ma yin pa lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: For example, although there are many different threads, the cloth, etc. are not different.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: du ma nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: du ma nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir //
translated: Since the number is the same,

original: 'byung rngub dag ni des byed min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byung rngub dag ni des byed min // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the in-breath and out-breath are not its cause.

original: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag kyang du ma yin pa'i phyir nges par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag kyang du ma yin pa'i phyir nges par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the in-breath and out-breath are also many, they are not the cause of consciousness.

original: 'on te yan lag thams cad rgyu nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'on te yan lag thams cad rgyu nyid yin na /
translated: But if all the parts are the cause,

original: de'i tshe yan lag gcig med na shes pa mi 'byung zhing /
analyzed: de'i tshe yan lag gcig med na shes pa mi 'byung zhing /
translated: then if one part is missing, consciousness will not arise.

original: re res nus pa ni cig car mang po 'byung ste /
analyzed: re res nus pa ni cig car mang po 'byung ste /
translated: And since each is capable, many would arise simultaneously.

original: 'di ltar 'byung rngub kyang du ma yin pa'i phyir lus bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'byung rngub kyang du ma yin pa'i phyir lus bzhin no //
translated: In this way, since the in-breath and out-breath are also many, they are like the body.

original: 'on te 'byung rngub dag gcig pa yin pa de bas na nye bar len pa gcig las shes pa gcig kho na skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'byung rngub dag gcig pa yin pa de bas na nye bar len pa gcig las shes pa gcig kho na skye'o zhe na /
translated: But if the in-breath and out-breath are one, then from one appropriated aggregate, only one consciousness arises.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: gcig nyid yin na'ang rtag gsal 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig nyid yin na'ang rtag gsal 'gyur //
translated: Even if it is one, it would be permanent and clear,

original: de rgyu rtag tu nye phyir ro //
analyzed: de rgyu rtag tu nye phyir ro //
translated: because its cause is always present.

original: du ma rgyu min zhe na ni //üîΩrim pas kyang min khyad med phyir //
analyzed: du ma rgyu min zhe na ni // rim pas kyang min khyad med phyir //
translated: If you say many are not the cause,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: then it is not gradual, because there is no difference.

original: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag gcig pa nyid yin na yang shes pa rtag tu gsal ba ste skye bar 'gyur ba de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa rtag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag gcig pa nyid yin na yang shes pa rtag tu gsal ba ste skye bar 'gyur ba de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa rtag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, if exhalation and inhalation are the same, consciousness would always be clear, that is, arise. Therefore, attachment and so on would always arise,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa de'i 'byung rngub de rtag tu kho nar nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa de'i 'byung rngub de rtag tu kho nar nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because attachment and so on would always be near.

original: gal te rgyu yod kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa mi 'byung na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu yod kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa mi 'byung na /
translated: If attachment and so on do not arise even when there is a cause,

original: de rgyu dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rgyu dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then they would not have a cause.

original: 'byung rngub shes pa du ma'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba nyid yin na ni /üîΩrgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa ni nges pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung rngub shes pa du ma'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba nyid yin na ni / rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa ni nges pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If the consciousness of exhalation and inhalation is not the cause of many,üîΩthen it is not tenable to dispute the ascertainment of the nature of cause and effect,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por nges pa la brtsad par mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por nges pa la brtsad par mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: because cause and effect are ascertained.

original: dper na me las du ba gcig tu 'byung ba bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na me las du ba gcig tu 'byung ba bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, like smoke arising from fire.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: de ltar na shes pa du ma'i rgyu 'byung rngub ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na shes pa du ma'i rgyu 'byung rngub ma yin zhing /
translated: Thus inhalation and exhalation are not the cause of many consciousnesses.

original: rim pas kyang shes pa du ma'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: rim pas kyang shes pa du ma'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Nor are they the cause of many consciousnesses in sequence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'byung rngub dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'byung rngub dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because there is no difference in inhalation and exhalation.

original: / mes ni sngon gyi ngo bo kho na las du ba gzhan dang gzhan skyed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: / mes ni sngon gyi ngo bo kho na las du ba gzhan dang gzhan skyed pa ma yin la /
translated: Fire does not produce one effect from its prior nature and another effect from a different nature.

original: 'byung rngub las ni sngar gyi ngo bo nyid kho na las 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung rngub las ni sngar gyi ngo bo nyid kho na las 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: But inhalation and exhalation produce their effect from their prior nature alone.

original: rkyen gzhan dang ldan yang khro ba la sogs pa'i sems mi 'byung ngo //üîΩde lta na 'o na ni 'byung rngub gcig pa yin yang phyi rol gyis sad par byed @343b pa nges pa las /
analyzed: rkyen gzhan dang ldan yang khro ba la sogs pa'i sems mi 'byung ngo // de lta na 'o na ni 'byung rngub gcig pa yin yang phyi rol gyis sad par byed @343b pa nges pa las /
translated: Even when other conditions are present, a mind of anger, etc., does not arise.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nges par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nges par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then even though inhalation and exhalation are the same, the mind of anger, etc., is certain to arise from the certainty of external stimulation.

original: sad bar byed pa'i rkyen yang nges par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sad bar byed pa'i rkyen yang nges par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: External stimulation is not certain to produce a mind of anger, etc.,

original: sngar goms pa'i stobs rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar goms pa'i stobs rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the power of prior habituation is the cause.

original: de bas na gal te 'byung rngub de nyid sems de'i cig car ba'i rgyu ma yin na ni 'byung rngub las dus phyis kyang shes pa 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gal te 'byung rngub de nyid sems de'i cig car ba'i rgyu ma yin na ni 'byung rngub las dus phyis kyang shes pa 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, if the in-breath and out-breath are not the simultaneous cause of that mind, then consciousness would not arise after the in-breath and out-breath.

original: sngar gyi lus shes pa'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs 'byung rngub nges par mi 'gyur ba'i skyon brjod nas de ni nges pa nyid med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar gyi lus shes pa'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs 'byung rngub nges par mi 'gyur ba'i skyon brjod nas de ni nges pa nyid med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having stated the error that the in-breath and out-breath would not definitely be the cause of the body consciousness that existed previously, in order to teach that they are not definite, it is said:

original: 'byung ba gcig la don du ma //
analyzed: 'byung ba gcig la don du ma //
translated: In one element, there are many objects.

original: 'dzin byed de las des pa min //
analyzed: 'dzin byed de las des pa min //
translated: The apprehender is not later than that.

original: blo gcig gis du ma shes pa //
analyzed: blo gcig gis du ma shes pa //
translated: If one mind knows many,

original: nyid na'ang de nyid cig car 'gyur //
analyzed: nyid na'ang de nyid cig car 'gyur //
translated: then it would be simultaneous with them.

original: 'gal ba med phyir rim gyis kyang //
analyzed: 'gal ba med phyir rim gyis kyang //
translated: Because there is no contradiction, it is not gradual.

original: mi 'gyur de khyad med pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi 'gyur de khyad med pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because there is no difference between them.

original: dbugs dal bar rgyu ba la sogs par 'byung ba gcig gi dus su yang don du ma 'dzin par byed pa las blo du ma skye pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbugs dal bar rgyu ba la sogs par 'byung ba gcig gi dus su yang don du ma 'dzin par byed pa las blo du ma skye pa'i phyir /
translated: In one moment of an element, such as a slow breath, many objects are apprehended, and many minds arise from that.

original: 'byung rngub de las sems su nges ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung rngub de las sems su nges ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the in-breath and out-breath are not definite as the mind.

original: 'o na ji ltar nges she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar nges she na /
translated: Well then, how is it ascertained?

original: shes pa nyid snga ma snga ma las sems phyi ma phyi ma nges pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa nyid snga ma snga ma las sems phyi ma phyi ma nges pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness itself is the cause of the subsequent mind's ascertainment from the previous consciousness.

original: shes pa gcig kho na rim pa du mar zhen pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: shes pa gcig kho na rim pa du mar zhen pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: It is a single consciousness that is the nature of the apprehension of many stages.

original: des na blo du mar mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: des na blo du mar mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Well then, is it not the case that the mind becomes multiple?

original: de lta na yang blo gcig gis don du ma rim gyis 'dzin par khas blangs na yid kyi blos don du ma dus gcig tu 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang blo gcig gis don du ma rim gyis 'dzin par khas blangs na yid kyi blos don du ma dus gcig tu 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, if one accepts that a single mind gradually apprehends many objects, then the mental consciousness would apprehend many objects simultaneously.

original: 'on te blo gcig gis kyang dus gcig tu don du ma 'dzin pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te blo gcig gis kyang dus gcig tu don du ma 'dzin pa ma yin na /
translated: But if a single mind does not apprehend many objects simultaneously,

original: de'i tshe rim gyis kyang don du ma 'dzin par mi gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rim gyis kyang don du ma 'dzin par mi gyur te /
translated: then it would not apprehend many objects gradually either,

original: yid kyi blo de la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi blo de la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no difference in the mental consciousness.

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa las ma gtogs pa'i yid gzhan med de /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa las ma gtogs pa'i yid gzhan med de /
translated: The intention here is that apart from the aspects of form and so on, there is no other mental consciousness.

original: me long dri ma med pa ltar yid gcig nyid yin no //
analyzed: me long dri ma med pa ltar yid gcig nyid yin no //
translated: Like a stainless mirror, the mental consciousness is a single consciousness.

original: de yang don gyi gzugs brnyan dang sbyor ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: de yang don gyi gzugs brnyan dang sbyor ba'o zhe na /
translated: And it is applied to the reflection of the object.

original: gal te de lta na ni de la ma gtogs pa shes pa nyid snang ba thob nas don gyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ste /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni de la ma gtogs pa shes pa nyid snang ba thob nas don gyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ste /
translated: If that is so, then, apart from that, it is consciousness itself that appears, having obtained the reflection of the object.

original: don rnams la nye ba dang shin tu skal ba med pa'i phyir thams cad cig car rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don rnams la nye ba dang shin tu skal ba med pa'i phyir thams cad cig car rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is not possible for objects to be near or far, everything would be cognized simultaneously.

original: 'on te goms pa'i khyad par shin tu lhag pa las yid rim gyis don rig pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te goms pa'i khyad par shin tu lhag pa las yid rim gyis don rig pa'o zhe na /
translated: But if the mind cognizes objects in sequence due to the special, extremely powerful habit,

original: de lta na ni goms pa nyid don gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa'i rgyur 'gyur gyi srog la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni goms pa nyid don gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa'i rgyur 'gyur gyi srog la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then the habit itself is the cause of apprehending the aspect of the object, not the life-force, etc.

original: shes pa me long bzhin gnas pa la 'gal ba med pas cig car don du ma 'dzin @344a * //üîΩpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa me long bzhin gnas pa la 'gal ba med pas cig car don du ma 'dzin @344a * // par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there is no contradiction in consciousness abiding like a mirror, it would apprehend many objects simultaneously.

original: 'on te de la cig car don 'dzin pa'i nus pa med na ni de lta na rim gyis kyang don du ma 'dzin par mi 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te de la cig car don 'dzin pa'i nus pa med na ni de lta na rim gyis kyang don du ma 'dzin par mi 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if it does not have the ability to apprehend objects simultaneously, then it would not apprehend many objects sequentially either, because there would be no difference.

original: gal te srog ni mang skad cig //
analyzed: gal te srog ni mang skad cig //
translated: If the life-force is many, it is momentary.

original: rang rigs min pa'i dus can dag / sems ni de 'dra ba dag gi //
analyzed: rang rigs min pa'i dus can dag / sems ni de 'dra ba dag gi //
translated: The mind of those who are not of the same class,

original: rgyu nyid yin par rtogs pa na //
analyzed: rgyu nyid yin par rtogs pa na //
translated: is understood to be the cause of those who are of the same class.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of the verse is this:

original: 'on te yang srog ni gcig ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te yang srog ni gcig ma yin te /
translated: But life is not one,

original: 'on kyang mang po dang rim gyis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang mang po dang rim gyis 'byung ba'o //
translated: but many, and it occurs in sequence.

original: rang gi rigs kyi dus gcig la yod pa ma yin pa de de ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi dus gcig la yod pa ma yin pa de de ltar 'gyur te /
translated: That which is not of the same class as the previous life, is not the cause of the subsequent life.

original: rim ba can yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩsrog de dag de 'dra ba 'jig pa can te /
analyzed: rim ba can yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // srog de dag de 'dra ba 'jig pa can te /
translated: The meaning is that it occurs in sequence.

original: rim pa dang ldan pa rnams sems kyi rgyur rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: rim pa dang ldan pa rnams sems kyi rgyur rtogs pa ste /
translated: Those lives are of the same kind, and are understood to be the cause of the mind.

original: des ni rim pa dang ldan pa'i don du 'dzin to zhe na /
analyzed: des ni rim pa dang ldan pa'i don du 'dzin to zhe na /
translated: By this, the meaning of sequence is grasped.

original: lan smras pa /
analyzed: lan smras pa /
translated: The reply is:

original: go rims ldan pa'i rgyu med na /
analyzed: go rims ldan pa'i rgyu med na /
translated: If there is no cause for sequence,

original: de dag rim ldan ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag rim ldan ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how can they be sequential?

original: rang rigs snga ma rgyu nyid na //
analyzed: rang rigs snga ma rgyu nyid na //
translated: If the previous life of the same class is the cause,

original: dang po srog 'byung mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: dang po srog 'byung mi 'gyur te //
translated: the first life would not occur,

original: de rgyu de 'dra yod ma yin //
analyzed: de rgyu de 'dra yod ma yin //
translated: because there would be no such cause.

original: yod na'ang du ma nyid du nges //
analyzed: yod na'ang du ma nyid du nges //
translated: Even if it did, it would certainly be many.

original: srog ni tha dad yul can phyir //
analyzed: srog ni tha dad yul can phyir //
translated: Because life has a different object.

original: de phyir blo ni cig car skye //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de phyir blo ni cig car skye // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, the mind arises all at once.

original: srog ni mang po dang 'jig pa can du nges pa yin na /
analyzed: srog ni mang po dang 'jig pa can du nges pa yin na /
translated: Here, if life is definitely many and perishable,

original: de dag khyod kyi gzhung la grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag khyod kyi gzhung la grub pa ma yin no //
translated: they are not established in your system.

original: tshad mas khong du chud pa'i phyir kho bo la ni de dag grub pa ste /
analyzed: tshad mas khong du chud pa'i phyir kho bo la ni de dag grub pa ste /
translated: But they are established for me because they are understood by valid cognition,

original: rtag pa'i don gcig la rim pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i don gcig la rim pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not logical for a single permanent object to have a sequence.

original: de bas na rgyu la rim pa yod pas 'bras bu la yang rim pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na rgyu la rim pa yod pas 'bras bu la yang rim pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the cause has a sequence, the effect also has a sequence.

original: sems rim pa can nyid yin na ni de lta na yang rim pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu med pas de nyid ji ltar rim gyi 'byung ba yin /
analyzed: sems rim pa can nyid yin na ni de lta na yang rim pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu med pas de nyid ji ltar rim gyi 'byung ba yin /
translated: If the mind has a sequence, then even so, because there is no cause with a sequence, how could it arise in sequence?

original: 'on te sngar gyi srog la sogs pa'i rgyu'i rim pas srog la sogs pa'i rim pa dang ldan par 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te sngar gyi srog la sogs pa'i rgyu'i rim pas srog la sogs pa'i rim pa dang ldan par 'dod na /
translated: But if you assert that the sequence of life and so on is due to the sequence of the cause of life and so on,

original: de lta na yang rang gi rigs snga ma'i rgyu can yin na /
analyzed: de lta na yang rang gi rigs snga ma'i rgyu can yin na /
translated: even so, if it has the cause of a previous type,

original: dang po'i srog la sogs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dang po'i srog la sogs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: the initial life and so on would not arise.

original: de'i rigs can gyi srog sngar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rigs can gyi srog sngar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the life force of that type did not exist previously.

original: skye ba gzhan khas blangs na ni mngal du 'byung ba'i rgyu 'jig rten gzhan gyi srog yin no //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan khas blangs na ni mngal du 'byung ba'i rgyu 'jig rten gzhan gyi srog yin no //
translated: If you accept another birth, then the cause of the birth in the womb is the life force of another world.

original: ma la sogs pa'i 'byung rngub rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma la sogs pa'i 'byung rngub rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the mother‚Äôs inhalation and exhalation are the cause,

original: 'di ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mi rung ste /
translated: that is not correct.

original: pha ma'i 'byung rngub kyi rang bzhin las bu'i 'byung rngub skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha ma'i 'byung rngub kyi rang bzhin las bu'i 'byung rngub skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that the child‚Äôs inhalation and exhalation would arise from the nature of the parents‚Äô inhalation and exhalation.

original: gzhan yang blo yang pha ma'i rjes su byed par 'gyur ba de bas na /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo yang pha ma'i rjes su byed par 'gyur ba de bas na /
translated: Moreover, the mind would also follow the parents.

original: skye ba dang po'i srog gi rgyu de lta bu'i srog med par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: skye ba dang po'i srog gi rgyu de lta bu'i srog med par 'gyur ro /
translated: Therefore, the cause of the life force of the first birth would be a life force that does not exist.

original: khas blangs nas kyang brjod pa gang gi rgyu yod na yang srog chags kyi @344b 'byung rngub rnams du ma nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: khas blangs nas kyang brjod pa gang gi rgyu yod na yang srog chags kyi @344b 'byung rngub rnams du ma nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Even if you accept that, it is said that if the cause exists, the inhalations and exhalations of the life force would be multiple.

original: yul can tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul can tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the subjects are different.

original: yul tha dad pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: yul tha dad pa dang ldan pas /
translated: Because they possess different objects,

original: 'gal ba'i chos rten pa ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos rten pa ste /
translated: contradictory qualities are supported.

original: de yang tha dad pa'i sgrub byed do //
analyzed: de yang tha dad pa'i sgrub byed do //
translated: And that is the proof of their difference.

original: de'i phyir te srog rnams du ma yin pa'i phyir yid kyi blo cig car skye bar 'gyur ba las sems ni rim gyis skye bar mthong ba de bas ni shes pa kho na rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir te srog rnams du ma yin pa'i phyir yid kyi blo cig car skye bar 'gyur ba las sems ni rim gyis skye bar mthong ba de bas ni shes pa kho na rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the life force is multiple, the mental cognition would arise simultaneously. But since the mind is seen to arise in sequence, consciousness alone is the cause.

original: 'on te srog du mas sems gcig skyed pa tshogs pas skyed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te srog du mas sems gcig skyed pa tshogs pas skyed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that many life forces produce one mind, then the collection of causes produces it.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te du ma'ang gcig dus can //
analyzed: gal te du ma'ang gcig dus can //
translated: If many have one time,

original: yin la sems gcig rgyu yin na /
analyzed: yin la sems gcig rgyu yin na /
translated: and one mind is the cause,

original: dal bar rgyu ba la sogs na /
analyzed: dal bar rgyu ba la sogs na /
translated: then when moving slowly and so on,

original: gcig ma tshang na'ang skye ba min //
analyzed: gcig ma tshang na'ang skye ba min //
translated: it would not arise even if one were missing.

original: 'on te ji lta'i dngos rgyu na //
analyzed: 'on te ji lta'i dngos rgyu na //
translated: But if the cause is just as it is,

original: shes pa'ang khyad par nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: shes pa'ang khyad par nyid du 'gyur //
translated: then consciousness would also be the specific cause.

original: gang dang gang gi khyad par las //
analyzed: gang dang gang gi khyad par las //
translated: From whatever specific cause

original: khyad par med de de 'bras min //
analyzed: khyad par med de de 'bras min //
translated: there is no specific result.

original: zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la //
translated: Here we say:

original: srog du ma yin yang sems gcig gi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: srog du ma yin yang sems gcig gi rgyu yin te /
translated: Even though many life forces are the cause of one mind,

original: dus gcig pa can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dus gcig pa can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: they have the same time.

original: dper na sa la sogs pa myu gru gcig skyed pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na sa la sogs pa myu gru gcig skyed pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, like earth and so on producing one sprout.

original: gal te de ltar srog du ma yin yang /
analyzed: gal te de ltar srog du ma yin yang /
translated: If, although life force is not one,

original: tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'bras bu gcig kho na skyed na ni de'i tsho ngal bar rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba la sogs pa na srog gcig ma tshang bas shes pa mi skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'bras bu gcig kho na skyed na ni de'i tsho ngal bar rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba la sogs pa na srog gcig ma tshang bas shes pa mi skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: it generates a single effect by the nature of the assembly, then at that time consciousness would not arise due to the incompleteness of a single life force when it moves or does not move, and so on.

original: tshogs pa dang bral pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa dang bral pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be separated from the assembly.

original: tshogs pas bskyed pa'i 'bras bu'i chos ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pas bskyed pa'i 'bras bu'i chos ni 'di yin te /
translated: The phenomenon that is the effect generated by the assembly is this:

original: gang tshogs pa'i rgyu ma tshang na med pa'o //
analyzed: gang tshogs pa'i rgyu ma tshang na med pa'o //
translated: When the cause of the assembly is incomplete, it does not exist.

original: de med kyang yod na de'i 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro //üîΩsrog la sogs pa'i rgyu nye bar gyur pa ji lta ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de med kyang yod na de'i 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro // srog la sogs pa'i rgyu nye bar gyur pa ji lta ba yin gyi /
translated: If it exists even when that is absent, it would not be the effect of that.

original: tshogs pa kho na ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: tshogs pa kho na ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the cause of life force and so on is simply the proximity of the assembly?

original: des na ji lta ba'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: des na ji lta ba'i dngos po ste /
translated: Then how could it be a thing as it is?

original: ji ltar nye bar gyur ba'i srog ni sems kyi rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar gyur ba'i srog ni sems kyi rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: The life force that is proximate is the cause of consciousness.

original: de lta na 'o na ni srog rnams tshogs pa dang ma tshogs pa'i dus su shes pa yang khyad par can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni srog rnams tshogs pa dang ma tshogs pa'i dus su shes pa yang khyad par can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then consciousness would also be distinctive when the assembly of life forces is complete or incomplete.

original: gang gi phyir de'i 'bras bu shes pa la sogs pa srog la sogs pa'i shes pa gang zhig srog la sogs pa gang gi khyad par tha dad pa'i khyad par can du mi 'gyur ba de bas ni srog tshogs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa skye zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i 'bras bu shes pa la sogs pa srog la sogs pa'i shes pa gang zhig srog la sogs pa gang gi khyad par tha dad pa'i khyad par can du mi 'gyur ba de bas ni srog tshogs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa skye zhing /
translated: Because the result of that, such as consciousness, would not be a consciousness that is a different attribute of any life force and so on, therefore consciousness arises as the result of the assembly of life force and so on.

original: ma tshogs pa'i las ni ma tshogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ma tshogs pa'i las ni ma tshogs par 'gyur la /
translated: The action of the nonassembly would be the nonassembly.

original: med pa las na med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa las na med par 'gyur te /
translated: And the result of the nonexistent would be the nonexistent.

original: de lta ma yin na srog la sogs pa'i 'bras bu grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na srog la sogs pa'i 'bras bu grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, the result of life force and so on would not be established.

original: khyad par can du srog la sogs pa shes pa'i rgyu nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par can du srog la sogs pa shes pa'i rgyu nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: Life force and so on are not the cause of consciousness that has attributes.

original: 'on kyang de yod na yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de yod na yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But if they exist, it exists.

original: de lta na 'o na ni @345a * //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni @345a * //
translated: If that is so,

original: sems kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khyad par gang yin pa de rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro /
analyzed: sems kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khyad par gang yin pa de rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro /
translated: then whatever attributes of consciousness have the character of attachment and so on would be causeless.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba rgyu med pa can du 'gyur can du 'gyur na shes pa gzhan gang zhig rgyu dang bcas par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba rgyu med pa can du 'gyur can du 'gyur na shes pa gzhan gang zhig rgyu dang bcas par 'gyur /
translated: If desire and so on were to arise causelessly, then what other consciousness would have a cause?

original: 'on te srog la sogs pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa 'gyur ba nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te srog la sogs pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa 'gyur ba nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that desire and so on arise from life force and so on,

original: 'o na ni snga ma nyid du 'dod chags la sogs pa khyad par can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni snga ma nyid du 'dod chags la sogs pa khyad par can du 'gyur te /
translated: then desire and so on would be prior to life force.

original: rgyu srog yod na 'bras bu mi skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu srog yod na 'bras bu mi skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because if the cause life force exists, it is impossible that the effect will not arise.

original: de bas na ji ltar na khyad par rgyu med pa can yin pa de bzhin du shes pa yang yin pa'i phyir shes pa srog gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'brang ba can du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar na khyad par rgyu med pa can yin pa de bzhin du shes pa yang yin pa'i phyir shes pa srog gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'brang ba can du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, just as the difference is causeless, so too consciousness would be. How could consciousness follow the increase and decrease of life force?

original: gang yang rim gyis 'gyur ba la ltos pa'i lus las shes pa rim gyis skye bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: gang yang rim gyis 'gyur ba la ltos pa'i lus las shes pa rim gyis skye bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de gsal ba yin te /
translated: Also, the assertion that consciousness arises gradually from the body that depends on gradual change is clear.

original: 'di ltar gyur pa'i rim pa yang lus tsam las 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gyur pa'i rim pa yang lus tsam las 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: This is because the sequence of change does not arise from the body alone.

original: lus las khyad par med na gyur pa'i khyad par du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: lus las khyad par med na gyur pa'i khyad par du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If there is no difference in the body, how could there be a difference in the transformation?

original: dper na lus dang srog la sogs pa la khyad par med na shes pa la khyad par med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na lus dang srog la sogs pa la khyad par med na shes pa la khyad par med pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, if there is no difference in the body, life, and so on, there is no difference in consciousness.

original: lus la khyad par med na gyur pa la yang khyad par med do //
analyzed: lus la khyad par med na gyur pa la yang khyad par med do //
translated: If there is no difference in the body, there is no difference in the transformation.

original: 'o ma la sogs pa la khyad par med na yang /
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa la khyad par med na yang /
