translated: Even though there is no difference in milk and so on,

original: 'o ma gyur pa'i zho dus kyi dbang kho nas khyad par can du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o ma gyur pa'i zho dus kyi dbang kho nas khyad par can du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: is not curd, which is the transformation of milk, different due to the power of time?

original: de bzhin du lus kyang yun lon nas rnam par shes par khyad par can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus kyang yun lon nas rnam par shes par khyad par can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: In the same way, the body also becomes different in consciousness after a long time.

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: mnyam pa'i 'o ma la sogs pa nye bar gyur pa dang / drod la sogs pa mtshungs par yod na /
analyzed: mnyam pa'i 'o ma la sogs pa nye bar gyur pa dang / drod la sogs pa mtshungs par yod na /
translated: If milk and so on are similar and heat and so on are the same,

original: mtshungs pa nyid du zho la sogs par 'gyur ba yin gyi mtshungs pa'i gnas skabs dang / mi mtshungs pa'i gnas skabs na sngon mngon par 'dus byas pa rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rgyu yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: mtshungs pa nyid du zho la sogs par 'gyur ba yin gyi mtshungs pa'i gnas skabs dang / mi mtshungs pa'i gnas skabs na sngon mngon par 'dus byas pa rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rgyu yin pa de bas na /
translated: It is not that the prior cognition that is concordant with the subsequent cognition is the cause of the difference or nondifference of the subsequent cognition.

original: gyur pa'i rim pas shes pa rim par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gyur pa'i rim pas shes pa rim par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore consciousness does not arise in sequence.

original: 'o na ni sems kho na las sems skye bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i shes pa cig car skye bar ji ste mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni sems kho na las sems skye bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i shes pa cig car skye bar ji ste mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if you assert that mind arises from mind alone, why don‚Äôt all minds arise simultaneously?

original: rim pas kyang sems de la shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: rim pas kyang sems de la shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: Because the mind that arises in sequence is the cause of the arising of the subsequent mind.

original: skad cig ma thad pas 'bras bu tha dad pa'i shes pa du ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig ma thad pas 'bras bu tha dad pa'i shes pa du ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But if the mind is not different from the result, is it not the case that many consciousnesses arise simultaneously?

original: 'dir smra pa /
analyzed: 'dir smra pa /
translated: Here the response is:

original: rnam shes nus pa nges pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam shes nus pa nges pa'i phyir //
translated: Because consciousness is restricted to its potential,

original: gcig ni gcig gi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gcig ni gcig gi rgyu yin no //
translated: one is the cause of the other.

original: don gzhan chags @345b bral shes pa ni //
analyzed: don gzhan chags @345b bral shes pa ni //
translated: The cognition of dispassion

original: don gzhan 'dzin pa med phyir ro /üîΩzhes bya ba la //
analyzed: don gzhan 'dzin pa med phyir ro / zhes bya ba la //
translated: because it does not grasp another object.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i skyen gyi ngo bo nyid gcig ni sems gcig kho na'i rgyu yin te /üîΩsngar goms pas sbyangs bas mthun pa'i 'du byed dam /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i skyen gyi ngo bo nyid gcig ni sems gcig kho na'i rgyu yin te / sngar goms pas sbyangs bas mthun pa'i 'du byed dam /
translated: The nature of the equivalent immediately antecedent condition is that it is the cause of only one mind.

original: yul kha cig la chags pa'i khyad par gyi nus pa nges pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bas na sngar goms pa'i bag chags kyi rjes su mthun par shes pa skye ba'am /
analyzed: yul kha cig la chags pa'i khyad par gyi nus pa nges pa'i phyir ro // de bas na sngar goms pa'i bag chags kyi rjes su mthun par shes pa skye ba'am /
translated: Because of the power of previous practice, the power of the special attachment to some object is ascertained.

original: chags pa'i bye brag las kha cig kho nar shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: chags pa'i bye brag las kha cig kho nar shes pa skye ste /
translated: Therefore, a consciousness arises in conformity with the latent impressions of previous practice, or a consciousness arises in only some place because of the special attachment.

original: de la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis shes pa sems phyi ma'i rgyu yin zhing /
analyzed: de la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis shes pa sems phyi ma'i rgyu yin zhing /
translated: In that case, the equivalent immediately antecedent condition is the cause of the subsequent mind, the consciousness.

original: goms pa'i shes pa ni sems kyi bag chags bzhag pa la g-yer bag can la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: goms pa'i shes pa ni sems kyi bag chags bzhag pa la g-yer bag can la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The consciousness of practice is the cause of the latent impressions of the mind, such as the power of the latent impressions.

original: de dag ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that?

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don gzhan la chags pa de dang bral ba'i sems ni yul gzhan nye bar gyur kyang 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don gzhan la chags pa de dang bral ba'i sems ni yul gzhan nye bar gyur kyang 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind that is free from attachment to other desired objects does not grasp the object even when another object is present.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'brangs bas kyang rgyu nyid du nges pa yin no //üîΩ'dir ni sngar goms pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa g-yer bag can du snang ba dang / yul gzhan la chags pa dang bral bar byed pa'i sems ni yul gzhan la shes pa skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'brangs bas kyang rgyu nyid du nges pa yin no // 'dir ni sngar goms pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa g-yer bag can du snang ba dang / yul gzhan la chags pa dang bral bar byed pa'i sems ni yul gzhan la shes pa skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is also ascertained as the cause by following the forward and reverse order.üîΩHere, the mind that is free from attachment to other objects is the mental consciousness that appears as distracted and is in accordance with previous habituation.

original: sems thams cad ni sems kho na sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: sems thams cad ni sems kho na sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Because the arising of consciousness of another object does not occur, all minds are preceded by mind only.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi dang po'i lus nyid las shes pa skye zhing /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi dang po'i lus nyid las shes pa skye zhing /
translated: Although this is so, consciousness arises from the body itself in the beginning.

original: dus phyis ni shes pa nyid las shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: dus phyis ni shes pa nyid las shes pa skye ste /
translated: Later, consciousness arises from consciousness itself.

original: dper na dang po me las du ba 'byung la /
analyzed: dper na dang po me las du ba 'byung la /
translated: For example, smoke arises from fire in the beginning.

original: de nas du ba nyid du ba'i rgyu na 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de nas du ba nyid du ba'i rgyu na 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Later, smoke arises from smoke itself as the cause of smoke.

original: ji ltar dus gzhan du du ba'i rgyun 'gags pa de bzhin du dus gzhan gyis tshe sems kyi rgyun 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar dus gzhan du du ba'i rgyun 'gags pa de bzhin du dus gzhan gyis tshe sems kyi rgyun 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the continuum of smoke is stopped at another time, so the continuum of the mind is stopped at another time.

original: ji ltar yang dang po shes pa yul du ma las skye ba yang chags pa las kha cig tu shes pa gcig skye ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dang po shes pa yul du ma las skye ba yang chags pa las kha cig tu shes pa gcig skye ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as consciousness arises from many objects at first, but later, due to attachment, consciousness arises from one object,

original: dang po skyes pa'i tshe lus las shes pa du ma skye na yang dus gzhan du shes pa kho na las shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: dang po skyes pa'i tshe lus las shes pa du ma skye na yang dus gzhan du shes pa kho na las shes pa skye ste /
translated: so, although many consciousnesses arise from the body at first, later consciousness arises from consciousness alone.

original: des na lus dang srog la sogs pa rgyu nyid yin yang shes pa du ma skye ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na lus dang srog la sogs pa rgyu nyid yin yang shes pa du ma skye ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, although the body and life faculty and so on are causes, many consciousnesses do not arise.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te lus las lan cig blo //
analyzed: gal te lus las lan cig blo //
translated: If consciousness arises from the body

original: skye zhing phyis ni rang rig las //
analyzed: skye zhing phyis ni rang rig las //
translated: and later definitely arises from self-awareness,

original: nges na lus kyi nus pa ni //üîΩci yi phyir na ldog pa yin //
analyzed: nges na lus kyi nus pa ni // ci yi phyir na ldog pa yin //
translated: why does the potency of the body

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: cease?

original: gal te lus las skyes pa'i shes pa dus phyis rang gi rigs kho na'i sems las nges pa @346a * //
analyzed: gal te lus las skyes pa'i shes pa dus phyis rang gi rigs kho na'i sems las nges pa @346a * //
translated: If consciousness arises from the body and later definitely arises from mind of the same type,

original: yin pa de lta na lus kyi nus pas rnam par shes pa skyed pa ci'i phyir ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: yin pa de lta na lus kyi nus pas rnam par shes pa skyed pa ci'i phyir ldog pa yin te /
translated: If that is so, then why is the body‚Äôs ability to generate consciousness stopped?

original: 'di ltar gal te lus las shes pa gcig gi rgyu yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te lus las shes pa gcig gi rgyu yin na /
translated: In that case, if the body is the cause of a single consciousness,

original: lus kyang nus pa nyid du gnas pa de bas na sems gzhan dang gzhan skyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir cig car mang po 'byung ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyang nus pa nyid du gnas pa de bas na sems gzhan dang gzhan skyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir cig car mang po 'byung ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: then the body remains as a potential cause, and therefore many consciousnesses would arise simultaneously.

original: 'on te lus las skyes pa'i shes pas lus las shes pa du ma skye ba'i gags byed pa de'i phyir lus las shes pa gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te lus las skyes pa'i shes pas lus las shes pa du ma skye ba'i gags byed pa de'i phyir lus las shes pa gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the consciousness that arises from the body prevents the arising of many consciousnesses from the body, then other consciousnesses do not arise from the body.

original: de ni mi bden te /üîΩgang gi phyir de las byung ba'i 'bras bus de nyid kyi rgyun gyi nus pa las gegs byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te / gang gi phyir de las byung ba'i 'bras bus de nyid kyi rgyun gyi nus pa las gegs byed pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct.üîΩBecause the result that arises from it does not prevent the potential of its continuum.

original: mes bskyed pa'i du ba skyed par nus pa'i me la gegs mi byed pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mes bskyed pa'i du ba skyed par nus pa'i me la gegs mi byed pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the fire that has the potential to produce smoke does not prevent the production of smoke.

original: de bas na gal te shes pa lus las skye ba de'i tshe shes pa skyes pas kyang shes pa skyed pa la gegs mi byed pa'i phyir cig car mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na gal te shes pa lus las skye ba de'i tshe shes pa skyes pas kyang shes pa skyed pa la gegs mi byed pa'i phyir cig car mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if consciousness arises from the body, then when consciousness arises, it would not prevent the production of consciousness, and therefore many would arise simultaneously.

original: dbang po'i shes pa du ma 'byung yang chags pa'i yul las shes pa gcig skye bar smras pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa du ma 'byung yang chags pa'i yul las shes pa gcig skye bar smras pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But it is said that even though many sense consciousnesses arise, only one consciousness arises from an object of attachment.

original: smras pa de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: smras pa de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir goms pa med pa'i sems kyis shes pa gzhan skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir goms pa med pa'i sems kyis shes pa gzhan skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Because a mind that is not habituated does not produce consciousness.

original: sngar goms pa med na yul gzhan la chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar goms pa med na yul gzhan la chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is no prior habituation, there is no attachment to other objects.

original: ji ltar sngar sems la goms pa skye ba de nyid la slar yang chags par 'gyur ba de'i phyir sems gzhan skye ba ni sngar goms pa kho na las yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sngar sems la goms pa skye ba de nyid la slar yang chags par 'gyur ba de'i phyir sems gzhan skye ba ni sngar goms pa kho na las yin gyi /
translated: Since consciousness arises from the mind that is habituated, it is again attached to that. Therefore, the arising of another mind is only due to prior habituation.

original: 'jig rten pha rol med par smra ba de la ni skye ba gzhan du goms pa med pa'i phyir las skye ba'i shes pa rnams la slar yang 'khor lo bzhin du skyon snga ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med par smra ba de la ni skye ba gzhan du goms pa med pa'i phyir las skye ba'i shes pa rnams la slar yang 'khor lo bzhin du skyon snga ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: For the one who advocates that there is no afterlife, the knowledge of karma would be like a wheel, with the same fault as before, because there is no habituation to other lives.

original: 'on te shes pa'i rgyu lus kyi skad cig ma dang po yin gyi dus phyi ma'i lus kyi skad cig ni rgyu ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa'i rgyu lus kyi skad cig ma dang po yin gyi dus phyi ma'i lus kyi skad cig ni rgyu ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the first moment of the body is the cause of consciousness, the later moments of the body are not its cause.

original: gal te de ltar lus dang po kho na shes pa skyed na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar lus dang po kho na shes pa skyed na /
translated: If it is like that, if the first body alone produces consciousness,

original: 'o na ni lus phyi ma sems kyi rten med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni lus phyi ma sems kyi rten med par 'gyur te /
translated: then the later body would be without a basis for mind.

original: sems yan gar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems yan gar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind would be alone.

original: 'on te lus phyi ma'i grogs can gyi shes pas shes pa gzhan bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te lus phyi ma'i grogs can gyi shes pas shes pa gzhan bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: But if consciousness produces another consciousness because it is assisted by the later body,

original: sems yan gar bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sems yan gar bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: the mind would not be alone.

original: de lta na ni sems kho nas sems bskyed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na ni sems kho nas sems bskyed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If that is so, then mind alone would produce mind.

original: lus ni grogs yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas pa'i lugs nyid bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus ni grogs yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas pa'i lugs nyid bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The body would be a helper, and the Buddhist system would be established.

original: dang po'i lus kho na nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin nam /
analyzed: dang po'i lus kho na nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin nam /
translated: Is not the body alone the cause of appropriation?

original: dper na lci ba las s'a lu skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lci ba las s'a lu skye ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, rice grows from rice.

original: s'a lu phyi @346b ma ni s'a lu nyid las skyes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: s'a lu phyi @346b ma ni s'a lu nyid las skyes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But the rice of the next year is produced from rice itself.

original: de lta na ni ba lang gi lci ba med par dus phyis s'a lu nyid las s'a lu skye ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: de lta na ni ba lang gi lci ba med par dus phyis s'a lu nyid las s'a lu skye ba de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way, later on, rice will grow from rice itself, without the dung of cows.

original: sems nyid las sems skye ba'i phyir sems yan gar pa sems kyi gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems nyid las sems skye ba'i phyir sems yan gar pa sems kyi gnas su 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the mind itself is the basis of the mind, since the mind is produced from the mind alone.

original: lus kyang sems kyi rgyu ma yin nam /
analyzed: lus kyang sems kyi rgyu ma yin nam /
translated: But is not the body also the cause of the mind?

original: de bas na lus dang sems dag lhan cig gnas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na lus dang sems dag lhan cig gnas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus the body and the mind are coexistent.

original: bden te / lus ni sems la phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: bden te / lus ni sems la phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: This is true, but the body is the cause of the benefit of the mind,

original: nye bar len pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not of its appropriation.

original: 'dir lus dang po ni nye bar len pa yin la /üîΩphyi ma grogs byed pa zhes ma smras sam zhe na /üîΩsnga ma ni nye bar len pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir lus dang po ni nye bar len pa yin la / phyi ma grogs byed pa zhes ma smras sam zhe na / snga ma ni nye bar len pa yin la /
translated: In this case, the first body is the cause of appropriation,üîΩbut the later body is the helper.üîΩWe have not said that the first body is the cause of appropriation,

original: phyi ma grogs byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma grogs byed pa ma yin no //
translated: but that it is the helper.

original: 'on te sngar lus sam nye bar len pa can gyi sems yin la /
analyzed: 'on te sngar lus sam nye bar len pa can gyi sems yin la /
translated: But if you say that the mind that possesses a body or appropriation is earlier,

original: phyis ni sems sngon du 'gro ba'i sems su snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: phyis ni sems sngon du 'gro ba'i sems su snang ngo zhe na /
translated: and that later the mind appears to be preceded by the mind,

original: de ni mi bden te g-yer bag can la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i shes pa /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te g-yer bag can la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i shes pa /
translated: that is not correct, because just as a consciousness that possesses haughtiness, etc.

original: shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba de kho na ltar sems dang po la g-yer bag can du myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rtag tu shes pa kho na las shes pa skye'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba de kho na ltar sems dang po la g-yer bag can du myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rtag tu shes pa kho na las shes pa skye'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: is seen to be preceded by consciousness, so the first mind would experience haughtiness, etc. Therefore it is established that consciousness always arises from consciousness alone.

original: 'di dag gis ni du ba'i rgyun 'gags pa bzhin rnams par shes pa 'gag go zhes zer ba de bsal ba yin te /üîΩde la me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nye na du ba'i rgyun 'phel ba can du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni du ba'i rgyun 'gags pa bzhin rnams par shes pa 'gag go zhes zer ba de bsal ba yin te / de la me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nye na du ba'i rgyun 'phel ba can du 'gyur gyi /
translated: These arguments refute the statement that consciousness ceases like the cessation of the stream of smoke.üîΩWhen a collection of things such as fire is near, the stream of smoke increases.

original: du bas skyed pa'i du ba'i rgyun ni 'dzad pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du bas skyed pa'i du ba'i rgyun ni 'dzad pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the stream of smoke generated by smoke diminishes.

original: 'dir ni goms pa sngon du 'gro ba'i yid g-yer bag can gyi shes pa snang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir ni goms pa sngon du 'gro ba'i yid g-yer bag can gyi shes pa snang ngo //
translated: Here, however, the consciousness is distracted and unsteady, because it is preceded by habit.

original: gal te yang dang po'i lus nyid las skye na goms pa phul du byung ba las de bogs 'byung bar snang bar mi 'gyur te du ba las skyes pa'i du ba 'phel bar mi snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gal te yang dang po'i lus nyid las skye na goms pa phul du byung ba las de bogs 'byung bar snang bar mi 'gyur te du ba las skyes pa'i du ba 'phel bar mi snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: If it were produced from the body itself, then the development of the body would not be evident, because the development of smoke is not evident when it is produced from smoke.

original: gal te sangs rgyas pa'i yang shes pa lus la mi brten na lus 'gags kyang shes pa gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas pa'i yang shes pa lus la mi brten na lus 'gags kyang shes pa gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: If the consciousness of a Buddha does not depend on the body, then the consciousness would remain even when the body is destroyed.

original: rgyu mtshan med par lhan cig pa'i dngos por nges pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med par lhan cig pa'i dngos por nges pa ste /
translated: There is no reason for the certainty of the simultaneous existence of the two.

original: gal te rten min pa yi lus //
analyzed: gal te rten min pa yi lus //
translated: If the body is not the support of the mind,

original: log par gyur kyang sems 'ba' zhig / gnas 'gyur zhe na de yi ni //
analyzed: log par gyur kyang sems 'ba' zhig / gnas 'gyur zhe na de yi ni //
translated: then the mind alone would remain when the body is destroyed.

original: rgyu 'jug thob phyir sems rgyud gnas //
analyzed: rgyu 'jug thob phyir sems rgyud gnas //
translated: The mind-stream remains because the cause of the mind‚Äôs entry and attainment continues.

original: rgyu ni yan lag min gyur na //
analyzed: rgyu ni yan lag min gyur na //
translated: If the body is not the cause of the mind,

original: tshe 'di nyid kyi skye mched lnga //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid kyi skye mched lnga //
translated: then the five sense-spheres of this life

original: lus gzhan skye ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: lus gzhan skye ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: would be the cause of the arising of another body.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what he says.

original: lus log par gyur na yang sems 'ba' zhig gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus log par gyur na yang sems 'ba' zhig gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if the body is transformed, the mind alone would remain,

original: lus dang sems la rten dang brten pa'i dngos po nges pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩlas zhes bya ba dang / @347a * //
analyzed: lus dang sems la rten dang brten pa'i dngos po nges pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na / las zhes bya ba dang / @347a * //
translated: because there is no certainty that the body and mind are the support and the supported.

original: sred pa dang ma rig pa ni sems gnas pa'i rgyu yin te skye ba gzhan du gyur pa'i lus de'i rgyu lus gzhan pa yin la /
analyzed: sred pa dang ma rig pa ni sems gnas pa'i rgyu yin te skye ba gzhan du gyur pa'i lus de'i rgyu lus gzhan pa yin la /
translated: Karma, craving, and ignorance are the causes of the mind‚Äôs abiding, because the body that is the cause of rebirth in another life is another body.

original: de las lus gzhan skyed pa'i 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las lus gzhan skyed pa'i 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is engaged in producing another body.

original: gal te yan lag ste rgyu nyid du ma gyur na ni de'i tshe sems yan gar ba gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gal te yan lag ste rgyu nyid du ma gyur na ni de'i tshe sems yan gar ba gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: If the body were not the cause, the mind would remain alone.

original: dper na gzugs med par skyes pa'i srog chags kyi shes pa yan gar ba nyid du gnas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gzugs med par skyes pa'i srog chags kyi shes pa yan gar ba nyid du gnas pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the mind of a sentient being born in the formless realm remains alone.

original: gang gi tshe yang 'jig rten pha rol gyi lus gzhan skye ba'i rgyu tshe 'di nyid kyi skye mched lnga yin pa de'i tshe ci'i phyir sems yan gar ba gnas pa yin //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang 'jig rten pha rol gyi lus gzhan skye ba'i rgyu tshe 'di nyid kyi skye mched lnga yin pa de'i tshe ci'i phyir sems yan gar ba gnas pa yin //
translated: But when the five sense-spheres of this life are the cause of the arising of another body in another world, then why is the mind alone not the cause?

original: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos pa'i lus can rnams kyi lus skye ba yang de nyid kyi lus skye mched sngas 'dus byas pa'i bag chags rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos pa'i lus can rnams kyi lus skye ba yang de nyid kyi lus skye mched sngas 'dus byas pa'i bag chags rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: The arising of the body of those who die in the formless realm is caused by the latent impressions of the body and sense-spheres.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true,

original: sems lus gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur bar mi dmigs te /
analyzed: sems lus gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur bar mi dmigs te /
translated: but the mind is not observed to be the cause of another body.

original: shi ba'i 'og tu lus gzhan skye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shi ba'i 'og tu lus gzhan skye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a different body arises after death.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams la ni shin tu yang ma mthong ba'i phyir med do zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams la ni shin tu yang ma mthong ba'i phyir med do zhe na /
translated: But in the formless realm, it is not seen at all.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: de yi yan lag rgyu nyid ni //
analyzed: de yi yan lag rgyu nyid ni //
translated: The cause of its parts

original: 'gegs pa yis ni mi dmigs pa //
analyzed: 'gegs pa yis ni mi dmigs pa //
translated: is not observed because it is blocked.

original: des byed min par rab tu bshad //
analyzed: des byed min par rab tu bshad //
translated: It is clearly explained that it does not produce them.

original: dbang sogs kyang ni lhag ldan yin //
analyzed: dbang sogs kyang ni lhag ldan yin //
translated: The sense faculties and so on also have something else as their remainder.

original: zhes bya ba la gal te 'chi ba'i sems kyis lus gzhan skyed pa'i yan lag gi dngos po rgyu nyid de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gal te 'chi ba'i sems kyis lus gzhan skyed pa'i yan lag gi dngos po rgyu nyid de /
translated: If the mind of death is the cause of the body of the next life,

original: grogs byed pa'i rgyu mi dmigs pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: grogs byed pa'i rgyu mi dmigs pa de lta na yang /
translated: then even though the nonobservation of a cooperating cause is not a reason,

original: sems la lus gzhan skyed pa'i nus pa med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems la lus gzhan skyed pa'i nus pa med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: the mind does not have the power to produce another body,

original: gnod pa byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not harmed.

original: 'on te mi dmigs pa nyid gnod pa byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mi dmigs pa nyid gnod pa byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that nonobservation itself is a harm,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: gang gi phyir lus gzhan gyi lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu sems yin pa 'gegs pa ni mi dmigs pa nges par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lus gzhan gyi lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu sems yin pa 'gegs pa ni mi dmigs pa nges par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: Because it has already been explained that nonobservation does not ascertain the negation of the mind as the cause of another body.

original: 'dir ma mthong ba tsam gyis smra ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir ma mthong ba tsam gyis smra ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, we do not speak merely of nonseeing,

original: 'on kyang 'brel pa sngon du song ba'i rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'brel pa sngon du song ba'i rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: but is there not harm by inference based on a previously established relation?

original: dbang po gang yin pa de lus gzhan gyi dbang po dang mtshams sbyor ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po gang yin pa de lus gzhan gyi dbang po dang mtshams sbyor ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The sense faculties do not connect with the sense faculties of another body.

original: dper na lha sbyin gyi mig la sogs pa mchod sbyin gyi mig la sogs pas bskyed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin gyi mig la sogs pa mchod sbyin gyi mig la sogs pas bskyed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, Devadatta‚Äôs eyes and so on are not produced by Yajnadatta‚Äôs eyes and so on.

original: dbang po yang skye ba 'di'i lus la gnas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po yang skye ba 'di'i lus la gnas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In the same way, the sense faculties exist in the body of this life.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: dbang po la sogs pa sgrub byed du bkod pa gang yin pa de yang /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa sgrub byed du bkod pa gang yin pa de yang /
translated: That which is posited as the producer of the sense faculties and so on

original: lhag ma dang ldan pa @347b ste nges par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma dang ldan pa @347b ste nges par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: is not definite because it is incomplete.

original: 'di ltar dbang po yang yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po yang yin la /
translated: In this way, the sense faculties

original: 'jig rten gzhan gyi dbang po dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan gyi dbang po dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: and the sense faculties of another world and the linking consciousness are not contradictory.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par nges par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par nges par ni ma yin no //
translated: One cannot ascertain that they are stopped by the mere nonobservation of the opposing factor.

original: 'on te tshe 'di'i lus la yod pa'i dbang po dang mtshams sbyor ba'i mig la sogs pa ni rgyu gzhan la yod pa'i mig la sogs pa skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te tshe 'di'i lus la yod pa'i dbang po dang mtshams sbyor ba'i mig la sogs pa ni rgyu gzhan la yod pa'i mig la sogs pa skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the sense faculties that exist in the body of this life and the linking eyes and so on are not produced by the eyes and so on that exist in another life,

original: 'di ni grub pa la sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni grub pa la sgrub pa ste /
translated: this is a proof of what is already established.

original: de'i tshe lus gzhan yang rgyud de nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe lus gzhan yang rgyud de nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the body of the other world is of the same continuum as the present body.

original: 'on khrag dang khu ba la sogs pa las byung ba'i 'jig rten gzhan gyi lus de ji ltar rgyud de nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on khrag dang khu ba la sogs pa las byung ba'i 'jig rten gzhan gyi lus de ji ltar rgyud de nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can the body of another world, which arises from blood, semen, etc., be of the same continuum as the present body?

original: khrag dang khu ba gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyis rgyud khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: khrag dang khu ba gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyis rgyud khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The continuum is not distinguished by the transformation of blood and semen.

original: dper na me'i khyad par can gyi du ba dang bum pa'i khyad par can gyi byas pa'i sgra dang du ba yin par ci yang byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na me'i khyad par can gyi du ba dang bum pa'i khyad par can gyi byas pa'i sgra dang du ba yin par ci yang byed pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, smoke is distinguished by fire, and the sound of a produced pot is distinguished by the pot, but the smoke is not produced by fire, nor is the sound of the produced pot produced by the pot.

original: 'on te me med na mi 'byung ba'i du ba spyir nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te me med na mi 'byung ba'i du ba spyir nges pa yin gyi /
translated: But smoke is ascertained in general as not occurring without fire.

original: mig la sogs pa la ni de ma thag pa mthong ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la ni de ma thag pa mthong ste /
translated: But the eye, etc., are seen to be immediately antecedent conditions.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because they are suprasensible.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩdbang po snga ma'i rang rigs la //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / dbang po snga ma'i rang rigs la //
translated: Here it is said:üîΩThe capacity of the previous sense faculty

original: nus pa dag ni mthong ba ste //üîΩ'gyur ba mthong phyir gzhan gzhan gyi //
analyzed: nus pa dag ni mthong ba ste // 'gyur ba mthong phyir gzhan gzhan gyi //
translated: is seen in its own kind.üîΩBecause transformation is seen, the arising of another

original: skye ba dag kyang grub pa yin //
analyzed: skye ba dag kyang grub pa yin //
translated: from another is also established.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: sngar byung ba'i mig la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi rigs dbang po la sogs pa la nus pa mthong ste /
analyzed: sngar byung ba'i mig la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi rigs dbang po la sogs pa la nus pa mthong ste /
translated: The power of the eye, etc., that have already arisen is seen in their own class, the sense faculties, etc.

original: 'di ltar sngar gyi dbang po la brten par dbang po gzhan dang mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngar gyi dbang po la brten par dbang po gzhan dang mthong ba yin no //
translated: Thus, another sense faculty is seen to be based on the previous sense faculty.

original: ma shi ba'i bar du dbang po tshul gcig pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na de ni ma yin te /üîΩshes pa'am / mig la sogs pa rab rib la sogs pa'i dri ma dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: ma shi ba'i bar du dbang po tshul gcig pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na de ni ma yin te / shes pa'am / mig la sogs pa rab rib la sogs pa'i dri ma dang bcas pa'am /
translated: But aren‚Äôt the sense faculties the same until death? No, they are not.üîΩBecause the consciousness or the eye, etc., is seen to change, either with the fault of cataracts, etc.,

original: dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir dbang po rnams gzhan dang gzhan du skye ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir dbang po rnams gzhan dang gzhan du skye ba grub pa yin no //
translated: or without fault, it is established that the sense faculties arise as one and cease as another.

original: 'dis ni gsal ba'i khyad par la ma ltos pa nyid du 'brel pa bzung bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gsal ba'i khyad par la ma ltos pa nyid du 'brel pa bzung bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the connection is grasped without regard to the difference in the clarity of the sense faculties.

original: gzhan du na sus kyang gang du yang tha snyad 'dogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na sus kyang gang du yang tha snyad 'dogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, no one would ever make a convention.

original: tha snyad 'dogs pa ni don byed par rung ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir dang / rung bar nges pa ni spyi las yin pa'i phyir dang / mig la sogs pa mig la sogs pas bskyed par rung bar nges pa ste /
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs pa ni don byed par rung ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir dang / rung bar nges pa ni spyi las yin pa'i phyir dang / mig la sogs pa mig la sogs pas bskyed par rung bar nges pa ste /
translated: because the designation of a convention is preceded by the suitability of an object‚Äôs function, because the ascertainment of suitability is from a universal, and because the ascertainment of the suitability of the generation of eyes, etc.

original: sgrin pa nyid la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: sgrin pa nyid la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir zhes bstan zin to //
translated: is from the seeing of their specific characteristics, such as clarity.

original: mig la sogs pa dang po skye ba ni lus las skye la /üîΩdus phyis ni mig la @348a * //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dang po skye ba ni lus las skye la / dus phyis ni mig la @348a * //
translated: The first generation of eyes, etc. is from the body,

original: sogs pa nyid las mig la sogs pa skye ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sogs pa nyid las mig la sogs pa skye ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: but later, are eyes, etc. not generated from eyes, etc.?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: gal te lus las de skye na //
analyzed: gal te lus las de skye na //
translated: If they are generated from the body,

original: snga ma bzhin du thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du thal bar 'gyur //
translated: the consequence is just as before.

original: sems las yin na de nyid las //
analyzed: sems las yin na de nyid las //
translated: If they are from the mind,

original: lus gzhan dag kyang skye bar 'gyur /üîΩzhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: lus gzhan dag kyang skye bar 'gyur / zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: other bodies would be generated from that.

original: gal te dang po'i mig la sogs pa lus las skye na /üîΩde'i tshe dbang po dang bcas pa las yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dang po'i mig la sogs pa lus las skye na / de'i tshe dbang po dang bcas pa las yin nam /
translated: If the first generation of eyes, etc. is from the body,

original: dbang po med pa las yin grang na /
analyzed: dbang po med pa las yin grang na /
translated: then are they from a body with faculties or from a body without faculties?

original: de la dbang po dang bcas pa las skye na ni /üîΩskye ba snga mar yang mig la sogs pa dbang po dang bcas pa nyid las skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dbang po dang bcas pa las skye na ni / skye ba snga mar yang mig la sogs pa dbang po dang bcas pa nyid las skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: If it arises from a body that possesses faculties,

original: 'jig rten pha rol grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the world beyond would be established, because the body would have arisen from a body that possesses faculties in a previous life.

original: dbang po med pa las skye na ni /
analyzed: dbang po med pa las skye na ni /
translated: If it arises from a body that lacks faculties,üîΩthen nails and so on would arise from a corpse‚Äôs body, and the consequence would be as before.

original: ro'i lus las kyang sen mo la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir snga ma bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba'am yang na lus kyi nus pa ldog par ji ltar 'gyur zhes pa'i thal ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ro'i lus las kyang sen mo la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir snga ma bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba'am yang na lus kyi nus pa ldog par ji ltar 'gyur zhes pa'i thal ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: Or else, how could the potency of the body be stopped?

original: 'on te ro'i lus la sems med pas sen mo la sogs pa mi skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ro'i lus la sems med pas sen mo la sogs pa mi skye'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that nails and so on do not arise from a corpse‚Äôs body because it lacks mind,

original: 'o na ni sems las skye bar 'gyur bde bas na sems de nyid las 'jig rten pha rol du gyur pa'i sems dang lus gzhan skye bar 'gyur ba de bas na sems de nyid las 'jig rten pha rol du gyur ba'i sems dang lus gzhan skye bar 'gyur
analyzed: 'o na ni sems las skye bar 'gyur bde bas na sems de nyid las 'jig rten pha rol du gyur pa'i sems dang lus gzhan skye bar 'gyur ba de bas na sems de nyid las 'jig rten pha rol du gyur ba'i sems dang lus gzhan skye bar 'gyur
translated: then since it arises from mind, the world beyond would be established, because another mind and body arise from that very mind.

original: ro // nye bar bsdu ba smras pa //
analyzed: ro // nye bar bsdu ba smras pa //
translated: The summary is stated:

original: de phyir rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de phyir rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is devoid of a cause,üîΩthe final mind is not the

original: tha ma'i sems nyid thams cad kyi //
analyzed: tha ma'i sems nyid thams cad kyi //
translated: continuum of all.

original: mtshams sbyor min min de 'dra yi //üîΩsgrub byed lha ldan yin par 'dod //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor min min de 'dra yi // sgrub byed lha ldan yin par 'dod //
translated: It is not the link of birth in another life.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: That is accepted as the proof.

original: sred pa dang / ma rig pa dang ldan pa'i las kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa'i sems 'di ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi rgyu yin te de dang bral na 'chi ka'i sems thams cad skye ba gzhan dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshams sbyor med pa ste /
analyzed: sred pa dang / ma rig pa dang ldan pa'i las kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa'i sems 'di ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi rgyu yin te de dang bral na 'chi ka'i sems thams cad skye ba gzhan dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshams sbyor med pa ste /
translated: This mind that is created by karma that is associated with craving and ignorance is the cause of the next world. If it were devoid of that, then all minds at death would not be the link of birth in another life.

original: rgyud nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the continuum itself would not be established.

original: de bas na 'chi ka ma'i sems yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di rtags dam pa'o zer ba de 'dra ba ni lhag ma dang ldan pa yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: de bas na 'chi ka ma'i sems yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di rtags dam pa'o zer ba de 'dra ba ni lhag ma dang ldan pa yin par 'dod de /
translated: Therefore, because it is the mind at death, this is the best reason. That is accepted as having a remainder.

original: mi dmigs pa tsam gyis ldog pa nges pa med pa'i phyir zhes bstan zin to /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tsam gyis ldog pa nges pa med pa'i phyir zhes bstan zin to /
translated: It has been explained that mere nonobservation does not ascertain a negation because there is no ascertainment.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las /
translated: From the commentary on the Pramanavarttika:üîΩ

original: bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: bam po bdun pa /
translated: The Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: gal te yang 'jig rten 'di'i sems ni 'jig rten gzhan gyi sems skyed pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang 'jig rten 'di'i sems ni 'jig rten gzhan gyi sems skyed pa yin te /
translated: If you say that the mind of this world produces the mind of another world,

original: lus tha dad pa la brten pa can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus tha dad pa la brten pa can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is based on a different body,

original: lha sbyin gyi sems bzhin no zhes zer ba de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: lha sbyin gyi sems bzhin no zhes zer ba de yang mi bden te /
translated: like Devadatta‚Äôs mind, that is not correct.

original: 'di ltar shes pa ni lus la brten pa ma @348b yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa ni lus la brten pa ma @348b yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: It has been shown that consciousness is not based on the body.

original: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa ni lus gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa ni lus gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, consciousness is not based on the body,

original: gang du yang 'jug pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du yang 'jug pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: because it does not engage anywhere.

original: des na lus ni phyi 'am nang yang rung ste /
analyzed: des na lus ni phyi 'am nang yang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, the body, whether external or internal,

original: shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: is not the object of consciousness.

original: de 'di'i lus med kyang sems gzhan la 'pho ba dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de 'di'i lus med kyang sems gzhan la 'pho ba dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, even though it has no body, it possesses the transference of mind to another.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig gi tshe /
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig gi tshe /
translated: For example, at some point,

original: gzugs la dmigs pa'i sems ni de med kyang rang gi lus sam /
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs pa'i sems ni de med kyang rang gi lus sam /
translated: the mind that observes form, even though it does not exist, is the mind of one‚Äôs body or

original: gzhan gyi lus la dmigs pa'i phyir phan tshun du dmigs pa bzhin du sems ni lus gzhan la 'pho ba dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus la dmigs pa'i phyir phan tshun du dmigs pa bzhin du sems ni lus gzhan la 'pho ba dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The mind is not transferred to another body, because it is not possible for the mind to be the object of another‚Äôs body.

original: yang na ji ltar byis pa'i lus la goms pa'i sems ni /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar byis pa'i lus la goms pa'i sems ni /
translated: Or, if the mind is habituated to the body of a child,

original: rgan po'i lus las sems g-yer bag can du 'gyur /
analyzed: rgan po'i lus las sems g-yer bag can du 'gyur /
translated: it is not possible for it to be transferred to the body of an old man, because the mind of an old man is habituated to the body of an old man.

original: de la nye bar len pa gcig yod la skye ba gzhan gyi lus la ni khu ba dang khrag gzhan nye bar len pa yin no zhe na ma yin te byis pa dang rgan po'i lus dag tha dad pa tsam du sgrub pa'i phyir lus tha dad paüîΩla 'jug pa'i 'du byed de tsam zhig dper na byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa gcig yod la skye ba gzhan gyi lus la ni khu ba dang khrag gzhan nye bar len pa yin no zhe na ma yin te byis pa dang rgan po'i lus dag tha dad pa tsam du sgrub pa'i phyir lus tha dad paüîΩla 'jug pa'i 'du byed de tsam zhig dper na byed pa yin no //
translated: If you say that the mind is transferred to another body because it is transferred to another birth, that is not so, because the body of the child and the body of the old man are established as different.üîΩThe mind is transferred to another body, because the formative forces enter another body, just as the mind of a child is transferred to the body of an old man.

original: yang na ji ltar sad pa'i dus kyi 'du byed ni rmi lam gyi lus rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / rmi lam gyi khyad par mthong ba'i lus skrag pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed ni sad pa'i tshe sems sdang ba la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du /üîΩtshe 'di la dge ba la sogs pa'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i sems kyang 'jig rten pha rol gyi lus la gnas pa'i sems de dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir skye ba snga ma goms pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten 'di'i
analyzed: yang na ji ltar sad pa'i dus kyi 'du byed ni rmi lam gyi lus rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / rmi lam gyi khyad par mthong ba'i lus skrag pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed ni sad pa'i tshe sems sdang ba la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du / tshe 'di la dge ba la sogs pa'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i sems kyang 'jig rten pha rol gyi lus la gnas pa'i sems de dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir skye ba snga ma goms pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten 'di'i
translated: of the body that sees the particular dream are the cause of the mind of aversion, etc., in the waking state,üîΩso also the mind that is endowed with the formative factors of virtue, etc., in this life is the cause of attachment, etc., that is compatible with the mind that is situated in the body of the next world.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, attachment, etc., in this world arise by the power of habituation in previous lives.

original: de bas na thog ma med pa'i sems kyi rgyun la skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa grub pa'i phyir goms pa grub pas shes rab dang yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan thams cad goms pa las yin no //
analyzed: de bas na thog ma med pa'i sems kyi rgyun la skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa grub pa'i phyir goms pa grub pas shes rab dang yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan thams cad goms pa las yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the continuum of mind is beginningless, birth, death, etc. are established as passing from one to another. Since habituation is established, all good qualities such as wisdom and intelligence are due to habituation.

original: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa 'byung du rung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa 'byung du rung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, omniscience is possible.

original: 'dir rtsod par byed pas /
analyzed: 'dir rtsod par byed pas /
translated: Here, an opponent argues:

original: gal te goms pas khyad yin yang//
analyzed: gal te goms pas khyad yin yang//
translated: Even if there is a difference due to habituation,

original: mchongs dang chu yi drod bzhin du //
analyzed: mchongs dang chu yi drod bzhin du //
translated: like jumping and the heat of water,

original: rang bzhin las 'das min zhe na //
analyzed: rang bzhin las 'das min zhe na //
translated: it does not transcend nature.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi skye zhing skye bar goms pa yin mod kyi de lta na yang shes rab la sogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa phul du byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi skye zhing skye bar goms pa yin mod kyi de lta na yang shes rab la sogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa phul du byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: This is so, but even though there is habituation from birth to birth, still wisdom, etc. do not reach the highest perfection, the highest excellence.

original: so sor nges pa'i khyad par mthong ba'i phyir @349a * //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i khyad par mthong ba'i phyir @349a * //
translated: This is because the specific distinctions are seen individually.

original: mchongs pa dang chu tshan bzhin no //
analyzed: mchongs pa dang chu tshan bzhin no //
translated: Like jumping and hot water.

original: de bas na goms pas so sor nges pa'i khyad par yod kyang rang bzhin las 'das pa thams cad myong bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na 'dir lan btab pa /
analyzed: de bas na goms pas so sor nges pa'i khyad par yod kyang rang bzhin las 'das pa thams cad myong bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na 'dir lan btab pa /
translated: Therefore, even though there is a specific distinction due to habituation, it is not the case that all that is beyond the nature is not experienced.üîΩHere, the reply is:

original: de byas gyur na yang gal te //
analyzed: de byas gyur na yang gal te //
translated: Even if that were the case,üîΩif it were not dependent on exertion,

original: 'bad rtsol la ni ltos pa dang // brten min rten can du gyur na //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol la ni ltos pa dang // brten min rten can du gyur na //
translated: and if it were not a support, it would be supported.

original: khyad par nyid ni mi 'phel te //
analyzed: khyad par nyid ni mi 'phel te //
translated: The distinction itself would not increase,

original: rang bzhin dag ni de lta min //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag ni de lta min //
translated: but the nature is not like that.

original: gang phyir nus can sgrub byed rnams //
analyzed: gang phyir nus can sgrub byed rnams //
translated: Because the capable are the agents,

original: khyad par phyi ma dag la ni //
analyzed: khyad par phyi ma dag la ni //
translated: in the later distinctions,üîΩthey are incapable,

original: nus pa med pa nyid phyir dang // rtag tu rten gnas med phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nus pa med pa nyid phyir dang // rtag tu rten gnas med phyir ro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and they are never a support.

original: khyad par zhes bya bar rab kyi mthar phyin med par gnas pa'i char gyur ba ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: khyad par zhes bya bar rab kyi mthar phyin med par gnas pa'i char gyur ba ni ma yin te ;
translated: Here, ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù is not a part that abides at the end of the best.

original: 'di ltar de'i khyad par mchongs pa bzhin goms par byas pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i khyad par mchongs pa bzhin goms par byas pa ni /
translated: In that case, the distinction that is like a jump is habituated.

original: gal te slar yang dus phyis rang gnas pa 'bad pa la ltos par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te slar yang dus phyis rang gnas pa 'bad pa la ltos par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is not dependent on exertion again later, it is not its own place.

original: 'di ltar 'bad pas bogs phyung ba'i mchongs pa ni slar 'bad pa la ltos pa dang / gzhan ni brtan pa ma yin pa'i rten can du gyur pa chu tshan bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bad pas bogs phyung ba'i mchongs pa ni slar 'bad pa la ltos pa dang / gzhan ni brtan pa ma yin pa'i rten can du gyur pa chu tshan bzhin no zhe na /
translated: Thus, the leap that is enhanced by such effort is dependent on further effort, and the other is not stable, like a hot spring.

original: de lta na ni shes rab kyi khyad par yang rab kyi mthar phyin par mi 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: de lta na ni shes rab kyi khyad par yang rab kyi mthar phyin par mi 'gyur ba ni /
translated: If that is so, then even the special wisdom would not reach its culmination.

original: 'di ltar rab kyi mthar ma phyin par gnas pa'i cha nyid slar 'bad pa la ltos pa dang / mi brten pa la brten pas khyab kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar rab kyi mthar ma phyin par gnas pa'i cha nyid slar 'bad pa la ltos pa dang / mi brten pa la brten pas khyab kyi /
translated: Thus, the very part that does not reach its culmination is dependent on further effort, and it is not stable.

original: thugs rje la sogs pa yid kyi yon tan rnams brtan pa la brten pa nyid dang / slar 'bad pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir mthar phyin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thugs rje la sogs pa yid kyi yon tan rnams brtan pa la brten pa nyid dang / slar 'bad pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir mthar phyin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But compassion and so on, the mental qualities, are dependent on stability, and they are not dependent on further effort, so they reach their culmination.

original: slar yang 'bad pa la ltos pa can gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur pa de bas na gtan tshigs 'di ni khyad par dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: slar yang 'bad pa la ltos pa can gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur pa de bas na gtan tshigs 'di ni khyad par dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Whatever is dependent on further effort does not become intrinsic, so this reason is qualified.

original: gang brtan pa la brten pa dang / ngo bo nyid yin pa de ni mthar phyin pa can te /
analyzed: gang brtan pa la brten pa dang / ngo bo nyid yin pa de ni mthar phyin pa can te /
translated: That which is based on stability and is by nature perfected is perfected.

original: dper na gtsang sbra can dang / thod pa can la mi gtsang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gtsang sbra can dang / thod pa can la mi gtsang ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, for one who is scrupulous, the skull is impure.

original: slar 'bad pa yod kyang mchongs pa ci'i phyir mthar phyin par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: slar 'bad pa yod kyang mchongs pa ci'i phyir mthar phyin par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why does the jump not reach perfection even though there is effort?

original: mchongs pa la sogs pa sngar bogs phyung pa de nyid la phan 'dogs par nus pa gang yin pa de dag sgrub par byed pa rnams te /
analyzed: mchongs pa la sogs pa sngar bogs phyung pa de nyid la phan 'dogs par nus pa gang yin pa de dag sgrub par byed pa rnams te /
translated: Those who are able to help the jump, etc., which have already been enhanced, are the ones who accomplish it.

original: khyad par phyi ma dag la ni mchongs pa rab kyi mthar phyin par mi 'gyur te nus pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par phyi ma dag la ni mchongs pa rab kyi mthar phyin par mi 'gyur te nus pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: But in the case of the subsequent distinctions, the jump does not reach perfection because it is not possible.

original: chu'i rten yang rtag tu mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu'i rten yang rtag tu mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the support of the water does not last.

original: 'bad pa las kyang chu'i tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / mchongs pa so sor nges pa 'phel bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: 'bad pa las kyang chu'i tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / mchongs pa so sor nges pa 'phel bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: And does not the nature of the heat of the water and the jump increase through effort?üîΩTherefore:

original: de'i phyir / khyad par 'phel ba @349b yin na yang //
analyzed: de'i phyir / khyad par 'phel ba @349b yin na yang //
translated: Even though there is enhancement of the distinctions,

original: rang bzhin min phyir gang gi tshe //üîΩbogs phyung slar 'bad la mi ltos //
analyzed: rang bzhin min phyir gang gi tshe // bogs phyung slar 'bad la mi ltos //
translated: Because it is not the nature,üîΩwhen it does not depend on further exertion,

original: rtsol gzhan khyad par byed par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsol gzhan khyad par byed par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the difference is made by another cause.

original: slar 'bad pa la ltos pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de /
analyzed: slar 'bad pa la ltos pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de /
translated: The difference that depends on further exertion,

original: gal te 'phel bar 'gyur ba de lta na yang mchongs pa la sogs pa de'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'phel bar 'gyur ba de lta na yang mchongs pa la sogs pa de'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: if it increases in that way, still it is not the nature of jumping, etc.,

original: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the nature that depends on another cause.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa la tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa la tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature itself is designated as operating by its own power.

original: de bas na mchongs pa la sogs pa'i khyad par ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'phel bar 'gyur yang phul du byung ba'i 'phel ba ma yin no zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de bas na mchongs pa la sogs pa'i khyad par ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'phel bar 'gyur yang phul du byung ba'i 'phel ba ma yin no zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: Therefore, because the difference of jumping, etc., is not the nature, even if it increases, it is not an increase of excellence. The remainder is understood.

original: gang gi tshe yang lan cig bogs phyung ba'i yid kyi yon tan ni brtse ba la sogs pa'i 'bad pa la mi ltos par rang nyid gnas pa de'i tshe rtsol ba gzhan thugs rje la sogs pa la gnas pa'i khyad par gyi byed pa por mi 'gyur roüîΩ// de ltar 'gyur mod kyi snying rje la sogs pa ni slar yang 'bad pa la ltos pas yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang lan cig bogs phyung ba'i yid kyi yon tan ni brtse ba la sogs pa'i 'bad pa la mi ltos par rang nyid gnas pa de'i tshe rtsol ba gzhan thugs rje la sogs pa la gnas pa'i khyad par gyi byed pa por mi 'gyur ro // de ltar 'gyur mod kyi snying rje la sogs pa ni slar yang 'bad pa la ltos pas yin gyi /
translated: When the mental qualities of compassion and so on are once enhanced, they remain by themselves without depending on the effort of exertion. At that time, exertion does not become the special cause of remaining in compassion and so on.

original: ngang gis 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ngang gis 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though that is so, compassion and so on depend on further effort and do not engage naturally.

original: dper na mchongs pa slar 'bad pa la ltos pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na mchongs pa slar 'bad pa la ltos pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, it is like jumping and depending on further effort.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: sems la brtse sogs goms skyes pa //
analyzed: sems la brtse sogs goms skyes pa //
translated: Compassion and so on that arise fromüîΩfamiliarization with the mind

original: rang gi ngang gis 'jug 'gyur te //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'jug 'gyur te //
translated: engage naturally,

original: me la sogs la shing dag dang // dngul chu gser la sogs pa bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: me la sogs la shing dag dang // dngul chu gser la sogs pa bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: like fire and so on with firewood and mercury with gold and so on.

original: dper na me yis byas pa'i shing gi bye brag tshig pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni slar yang rtsol ba la mi ltos par rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa dang / dngul chu sbyangs pa dang / gzung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: dper na me yis byas pa'i shing gi bye brag tshig pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni slar yang rtsol ba la mi ltos par rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa dang / dngul chu sbyangs pa dang / gzung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: And the characteristics of purified mercury and of refined gold, etc.,

original: gser sreg pa la sogs par byas pa ni /
analyzed: gser sreg pa la sogs par byas pa ni /
translated: occur without depending on any further effort.

original: slar rtsol ba la ltos pa de bzhin du sems snga ma snga mar goms pa las skyes pa'i snying rje la sogs pa yang rang gi ngang kho nas 'jug gi ldog pa'i cha can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: slar rtsol ba la ltos pa de bzhin du sems snga ma snga mar goms pa las skyes pa'i snying rje la sogs pa yang rang gi ngang kho nas 'jug gi ldog pa'i cha can ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, compassion, etc., which arise from the repeated practice of former states of compassion, etc., occur by themselves alone and are not subject to reversal.

original: de dag gis ni brtse ba rang gi ngang gis 'jug par brjod do //
analyzed: de dag gis ni brtse ba rang gi ngang gis 'jug par brjod do //
translated: By these [verses] it is said that compassion occurs by itself.

original: 'on te brtse ba la sogs pa chu tshan bzhin rang gi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rab kyi mthar 'byung ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te brtse ba la sogs pa chu tshan bzhin rang gi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rab kyi mthar 'byung ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if compassion, etc., are not naturally occurring, like hot water, then they do not occur at the highest level.

original: smras pa / de'i phyir de rnams kyis yon tan //
analyzed: smras pa / de'i phyir de rnams kyis yon tan //
translated: We reply: Therefore, those [compassion, etc.] are qualities

original: de ni ngo bo nyid skyer 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid skyer 'gyur //
translated: that occur naturally.

original: de las 'bad rtsol phyi ma rnams //
analyzed: de las 'bad rtsol phyi ma rnams //
translated: The latter efforts

original: khyad par bogs 'byin byed pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩde'i phyir te rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir brtse ba la sogs pa de rnams skyes pa'i yon tan g-yer @350a * //
analyzed: khyad par bogs 'byin byed pa yin // zhes bya ba la / de'i phyir te rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir brtse ba la sogs pa de rnams skyes pa'i yon tan g-yer @350a * //
translated: are the special enhancement.

original: bag can la sogs pa ni ngo bo nyid kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bag can la sogs pa ni ngo bo nyid kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, because of being engaged by their own nature, those such as love, which are qualities arisen from the virtues of the former efforts, are just by nature.

original: sngar gyi rtsol bas brtse ba bskyed pa de las 'bad rtsol phyi ma'i phyi ma goms pa khyad par du bogs 'byin pa'i byed pa por 'gyur pa de bas na /
analyzed: sngar gyi rtsol bas brtse ba bskyed pa de las 'bad rtsol phyi ma'i phyi ma goms pa khyad par du bogs 'byin pa'i byed pa por 'gyur pa de bas na /
translated: The latter efforts are the special enhancement.

original: brtse ba la sogs pa ni mthar phyin pa med pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no //üîΩbrtse ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pa ni mthar phyin pa med pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no // brtse ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, those such as love are not of the nature of being without culmination.

original: lan du phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: lan du phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are those such as love not dependent on reciprocated benefit?

original: goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can tsam ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can tsam ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not just that they are preceded by familiarity.

original: gnod pa byed pa'i zhe sdang la sogs pa bzlog pa'i ched yin te /
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa'i zhe sdang la sogs pa bzlog pa'i ched yin te /
translated: It is for the purpose of stopping the anger, etc. that cause harm.

original: sngar goms par byas pa'i snying rje 'bad rtsol gzhan gyis bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sngar goms par byas pa'i snying rje 'bad rtsol gzhan gyis bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because compassion that was previously cultivated is taught by other efforts.

original: gang phyir brtse ba la sogs blo //
analyzed: gang phyir brtse ba la sogs blo //
translated: Because the mind of love, etc.

original: rigs mtshungs sa bon snga ma las //üîΩ'phel ba can gyur de dag gi //üîΩgoms pa yod na ci phyir gnas //
analyzed: rigs mtshungs sa bon snga ma las // 'phel ba can gyur de dag gi // goms pa yod na ci phyir gnas //
translated: Arises from the former seed of a similar type,üîΩand is developed, why would it not endure

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: if there is cultivation of that?üîΩHere, because the mind of love, etc.

original: gang gi phyir rigs mtshungs pa la sogs pa bogs phyung ba'i sa bon snga ma brtse ba la sogs pa goms pa de las /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rigs mtshungs pa la sogs pa bogs phyung ba'i sa bon snga ma brtse ba la sogs pa goms pa de las /
translated: arises from the former seed of a similar type, i.e., from the cultivation of love, etc.,

original: 'phel ba ste rab kyi mthar phyin pa gang la yod pa de ni brtse ba la sogs pa'i blo yin pa de'i phyir de dag gi goms pa yod na ci'i phyir gnas te mi gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'phel ba ste rab kyi mthar phyin pa gang la yod pa de ni brtse ba la sogs pa'i blo yin pa de'i phyir de dag gi goms pa yod na ci'i phyir gnas te mi gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and is developed, i.e., perfected, why would it not endure if there is cultivation of that? The meaning is that it would endure.

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention here is this:

original: brtse ba la sogs pa nyid ni brtse ba la sogs pa goms pa las skyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pa nyid ni brtse ba la sogs pa goms pa las skyes pa yin gyi /
translated: Love, etc. are born from the cultivation of love, etc.

original: lan du phan 'dogs pa la sogs pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lan du phan 'dogs pa la sogs pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not depend on reciprocated benefit, etc.

original: de lta na yang dan pa dang thos pas kyang brtse ba la sogs pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang dan pa dang thos pas kyang brtse ba la sogs pa 'jug ste /
translated: Even so, one who is compassionate and learned engages in love, etc.

original: brtse ba la sogs pas zhing du byas pa'i rgyud rnams mi gsar du gnod pa byed pa'i srog chags la brtse ba chung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pas zhing du byas pa'i rgyud rnams mi gsar du gnod pa byed pa'i srog chags la brtse ba chung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the continuum that is made into a field by love, etc. does not become less compassionate toward a living being who is newly engaged in harming.

original: de'i phyir goms pa dang ldan pa sems la ci'i phyir brtse ba la sogs pa dman par ci ste 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir goms pa dang ldan pa sems la ci'i phyir brtse ba la sogs pa dman par ci ste 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, why should love, etc. be less in the mind of one who is endowed with practice?

original: mchongs pa'i yang goms par rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i rgyu yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mchongs pa'i yang goms par rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i rgyu yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: And is there not a cause for the perfection of the highest degree of practice in jumping?

original: des na de yang rab kyi mthar phyin par shes rab la sogs pa bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na de yang rab kyi mthar phyin par shes rab la sogs pa bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, that also would be like wisdom, etc.

original: smas pa / de ltar mchongs nyid las mchongs min //üîΩde rgyu stobs dang 'bad rtsol gyi //
analyzed: smas pa / de ltar mchongs nyid las mchongs min // de rgyu stobs dang 'bad rtsol gyi //
translated: Reply: Jumping is not jumping from that.üîΩBecause the power and effort

original: nus pa nges pa nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: nus pa nges pa nyid kyi phyir //
translated: of that cause are definite,

original: mchongs pa nges pa'i bdag nyid yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mchongs pa nges pa'i bdag nyid yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: jumping is of the nature of certainty.

original: snying rje la sogs pa rigs pa mtshungs pa las brtse ba la sogs pa skye ba bzhin //
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa rigs pa mtshungs pa las brtse ba la sogs pa skye ba bzhin //
translated: Compassion, etc., are similar to the reason, and arise from the reason.

original: mchongs pa nyid las mchongs pa 'byung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mchongs pa nyid las mchongs pa 'byung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Jumping does not arise from jumping itself.

original: 'on kyang stobs dang rtsol ba dag las mchongs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang stobs dang rtsol ba dag las mchongs pa 'byung ste /
translated: But jumping arises from strength and effort.

original: @350b 'di ltar mchongs pa legs par byad yang stobs dang rtsol ba med par mchongs nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @350b 'di ltar mchongs pa legs par byad yang stobs dang rtsol ba med par mchongs nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, even though jumping is good, without strength and effort, one cannot jump.

original: des mchongs pa'i rgyu stobs dang / rtsol ba dag ni nus pa nges pa'i phyir mchongs pa yang gnas pa nges pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: des mchongs pa'i rgyu stobs dang / rtsol ba dag ni nus pa nges pa'i phyir mchongs pa yang gnas pa nges pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: Since the cause of jumping, strength and effort, are definite in their capacity, jumping also has a nature that is definite in its duration.

original: mchongs pa'i yul can gyi goms pa nyid las mchongs ba 'byung ba ma yin nam gzhan du na stobs dang rtsol ba ni sngar yod pa'i phyir dang po nyid du mchongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchongs pa'i yul can gyi goms pa nyid las mchongs ba 'byung ba ma yin nam gzhan du na stobs dang rtsol ba ni sngar yod pa'i phyir dang po nyid du mchongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Is jumping not produced from the mere repetition of jumping? Otherwise, since strength and effort would exist from the beginning, one would jump from the beginning.

original: 'on te stobs nyid sngar med la /
analyzed: 'on te stobs nyid sngar med la /
translated: But strength does not exist from the beginning.

original: goms pa nyid las stobs 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: goms pa nyid las stobs 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Strength is established from the mere repetition.

original: sngar mchongs pa ma yin na ni de lta na /
analyzed: sngar mchongs pa ma yin na ni de lta na /
translated: If he did not jump before, then

original: rang gi rigs kyi mchongs pa bskyed kyang mchongs pa rab kyi mthar phyin par mi 'gyur ba bzhin du /
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi mchongs pa bskyed kyang mchongs pa rab kyi mthar phyin par mi 'gyur ba bzhin du /
translated: just as he would not have completed the jump even though he has generated the jump of his type,

original: snying rje la sogs pa yang mthar phyin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa yang mthar phyin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: so too compassion and so on would not be completed.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: phyi nas bzhin du de dang por //
analyzed: phyi nas bzhin du de dang por //
translated: Like a face, he does not jump at first,

original: mchongs min lus ni nus med phyir //üîΩrtsol bas rim gyis mi nus pa //
analyzed: mchongs min lus ni nus med phyir // rtsol bas rim gyis mi nus pa //
translated: because his body is powerless.üîΩIf he gradually removes his powerlessness

original: bsal na rang stobs nges pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsal na rang stobs nges pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: through effort, his power is certain.

original: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: goms pa las stobs skye ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: goms pa las stobs skye ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Power does not arise from cultivation.

original: 'on kyang stobs yod par gyur kyang bdag kan la sogs pas bcom nas mchongs pa mi nus pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang stobs yod par gyur kyang bdag kan la sogs pas bcom nas mchongs pa mi nus pa yin no zhe na /
translated: However, even though he has power, he is unable to jump because he is overcome by his own nature and so on.

original: de bas na skyes bu de bad kan la sogs pas lus nus pa med par bskyed pa'i phyir mchongs par mi 'gyur la phyis goms pa ji lta ba bzhin du mchongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na skyes bu de bad kan la sogs pas lus nus pa med par bskyed pa'i phyir mchongs par mi 'gyur la phyis goms pa ji lta ba bzhin du mchongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore that man does not jump because his body is rendered powerless by phlegm and so on, but later he jumps in accordance with his cultivation.

original: 'on te bcud kyis len dang nye bar sbyor bas stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ba de lta na yang 'on te bcud kyis len dang nye bar sbyor bas stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ba de lta na yang 'on te bcud kyis len mi nus pa nges pa las
analyzed: 'on te bcud kyis len dang nye bar sbyor bas stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ba de lta na yang 'on te bcud kyis len dang nye bar sbyor bas stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ba de lta na yang 'on te bcud kyis len mi nus pa nges pa las
translated: But if they become powerful through the power of the elixir and the power of yoga, then they will be able to jump higher.

original: stobs nges par gdon mi za bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: stobs nges par gdon mi za bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if they are unable to jump higher through the power of the elixir and the power of yoga, then they will definitely not be able to jump higher through the power of the elixir and the power of yoga.

original: 'di ltar mi dang spre'u dag mtshungs par mchongs pa yang mchongs pa mtshungs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi dang spre'u dag mtshungs par mchongs pa yang mchongs pa mtshungs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because even though humans and monkeys are similar, their jumps are not similar.

original: de'i phyir goms pa yod kyang mad la dang rigs kyi stobs la ltos pa kho na las mchongs pa 'byung gi / goms pa tsam la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir goms pa yod kyang mad la dang rigs kyi stobs la ltos pa kho na las mchongs pa 'byung gi / goms pa tsam la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though there is familiarity, the jump occurs only in dependence on the power of the elixir and the power of the species, but not in dependence on familiarity alone.

original: snying rje la sogs pa rnams ni rang gi rigs goms pa kho na la ltos pa nyid do /
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa rnams ni rang gi rigs goms pa kho na la ltos pa nyid do /
translated: Compassion and so on occur in dependence on the power of the species and familiarity alone.

original: gal te de ltar sngar rang gi rigs kyi bag chags tsam la ltos nas brtse ba la sogs pa 'byung ba de lta na ni 'khor ba yang thag ma med pa'i phyir ba rtse ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin phul du byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar sngar rang gi rigs kyi bag chags tsam la ltos nas brtse ba la sogs pa 'byung ba de lta na ni 'khor ba yang thag ma med pa'i phyir ba rtse ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin phul du byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: If, in that way, love and so on arise in dependence on the mere habitual tendencies of one‚Äôs own type, then samsara would be without beginning, and the nature of love and so on would be excellent.

original: thams cad snying rje dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir /üîΩsnying rje rang gi rigs kyis bon las byung @351a * //
analyzed: thams cad snying rje dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir / snying rje rang gi rigs kyis bon las byung @351a * //
translated: But since not all are endowed with compassion,

original: ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: compassion does not arise from the seed of one‚Äôs own type.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: brtse ba rang sa bon las byung //
analyzed: brtse ba rang sa bon las byung //
translated: Love arises from its own seed.

original: gal te rang sa bon 'byung can //
analyzed: gal te rang sa bon 'byung can //
