translated: If it arises from its own seed,

original: mi mthun phyogs kyis gnod med na /üîΩsems la de dag nyid thob 'gyur //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs kyis gnod med na / sems la de dag nyid thob 'gyur //
translated: and is not harmed by its opposing factors,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: then it would be obtained in the mind.

original: gal te brtse ba rang gi sa bon snying rje goms pa bogs byung ba las byung ba gang la yod pa'i brtse ba de dus thog ma med pa yin pa de lta na brtse ba'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te brtse ba rang gi sa bon snying rje goms pa bogs byung ba las byung ba gang la yod pa'i brtse ba de dus thog ma med pa yin pa de lta na brtse ba'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If love arises from the seed of its own enhancement of the cultivation of compassion, then love would not be the nature of the beginningless.

original: rang gi rgyud la skyes pa'i sdang ba la sogs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la skyes pa'i sdang ba la sogs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because anger and so on that arise in one‚Äôs continuum are harmful.

original: gal te yang rang gi sa bon las byung ba'i mi mthun phyogs sdang ba la sogs pas gnod pa med cing rgyun mi 'chad par snying rje goms pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te yang rang gi sa bon las byung ba'i mi mthun phyogs sdang ba la sogs pas gnod pa med cing rgyun mi 'chad par snying rje goms pa de'i tshe /
translated: If, however, there is no harm from anger and so on, the opposing factors that arise from one‚Äôs own seeds, and if compassion is cultivated without interruption,

original: bstan par 'gyur ba'i sems la rgyun mi 'chad par goms pas zhe sdang la sogs pa bkag par gyur na /
analyzed: bstan par 'gyur ba'i sems la rgyun mi 'chad par goms pas zhe sdang la sogs pa bkag par gyur na /
translated: then at that time, by cultivating without interruption the mind that is taught, if anger and so on are stopped,üîΩthen the nature of that mind will become excellent.

original: de'i bdag nyid phul du byung bar 'gyur ro zhes khas blangs pa 'di dag rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid phul du byung bar 'gyur ro zhes khas blangs pa 'di dag rigs pa yin te /
translated: These assertions are reasonable, because:

original: 'di ltar goms pa snga ma rnams //
analyzed: 'di ltar goms pa snga ma rnams //
translated: The former cultivations

original: brtse ba dang chags bral la sogs //üîΩsems kyi chos nyid gzhan dag ni //
analyzed: brtse ba dang chags bral la sogs // sems kyi chos nyid gzhan dag ni //
translated: of love and freedom from attachmentüîΩare the root of the other

original: g-yer bag can gyi rtsa ba yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: g-yer bag can gyi rtsa ba yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: mental qualities of the haughty.

original: brtse ba la goms pa snga ma snga ma ni brtse ba la sogs pa phyi ma phyi ma'i sems kyi chos gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu'i rtsa ba yin gyi /
analyzed: brtse ba la goms pa snga ma snga ma ni brtse ba la sogs pa phyi ma phyi ma'i sems kyi chos gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu'i rtsa ba yin gyi /
translated: The former cultivations of love are the root cause of the clarity of the later mental qualities of love and so on.

original: skyed par byed pa'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a productive cause.

original: brtse ba la sogs pa grub pa la ni g-yer bag can kho nar goms pas byed pa yin gyi //
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pa grub pa la ni g-yer bag can kho nar goms pas byed pa yin gyi //
translated: For one who is already established in love, etc., it is only through repeated practice that he becomes more and more loving.

original: skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not a productive cause.

original: snga nas yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bas na rang gi don 'dod pa med cing /
analyzed: snga nas yod pa'i phyir ro // de bas na rang gi don 'dod pa med cing /
translated: Because it already exists.

original: gzhan gyi don khas blangs pa'i brtse ba'i bdag nyid goms pa kho na las yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don khas blangs pa'i brtse ba'i bdag nyid goms pa kho na las yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that it is only through repeated practice of the nature of love, without any desire for one's own benefit, and with a commitment to the benefit of others, that love is generated, he says:

original: goms nas brtse ba'i bdag nyid can //üîΩmi gtsang chags dang chags bral bzhin //
analyzed: goms nas brtse ba'i bdag nyid can // mi gtsang chags dang chags bral bzhin //
translated: Through repeated practice, one becomes loving by nature,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: just like one who is attached to the impure becomes free from attachment.üîΩOne who is attached to the impure becomes free from attachment through repeated practice.

original: rtag pa brtse ba la goms par 'dod pas goms pa phul du byung ba las brtse ba'i bdag nyid can skye sta /
analyzed: rtag pa brtse ba la goms par 'dod pas goms pa phul du byung ba las brtse ba'i bdag nyid can skye sta /
translated: In the same way, one who is committed to the benefit of others becomes loving by nature through repeated practice of love.

original: dper na skyes bu la la skye ba'i las goms pa las mi gtsang ba bskyed pa bzhin dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis gnod par ma gyur pa'i mi gtsang ba de'i bdag nyid du gyur te /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu la la skye ba'i las goms pa las mi gtsang ba bskyed pa bzhin dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis gnod par ma gyur pa'i mi gtsang ba de'i bdag nyid du gyur te /
translated: For example, a certain man, through repeated practice of the act of begetting, becomes the very embodiment of impurity, and is no longer harmed by adverse factors.

original: 'di ltar mi gtsang ba med pa nyid yod par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi gtsang ba med pa nyid yod par gyur na /
translated: Thus, if the absence of impurity existed,

original: nye bar blang bar bya ba ma yin pa cung zad kyang mi snang ba bzhin dang / de bzhin du chags pa dang bral ba dang / chags pa nyid kyang goms pa nyid las de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nye bar blang bar bya ba ma yin pa cung zad kyang mi snang ba bzhin dang / de bzhin du chags pa dang bral ba dang / chags pa nyid kyang goms pa nyid las de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: then nothing at all would appear that is not to be appropriated, just as one who is free from attachment and who is accustomed to the nature of impurity would come to have a body that is by nature impure.

original: brtse ba @351b dang ldan pa gzhan gyi sdug bsngal dbral bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: brtse ba @351b dang ldan pa gzhan gyi sdug bsngal dbral bar 'dod pas /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one who possesses love, who desires to remove the suffering of others,üîΩwill strive to eliminate his or her own suffering,

original: rang gi sdug bsngal spang bar bya ba'i don du brtson par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi sdug bsngal spang bar bya ba'i don du brtson par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he says:

original: brtse ldan sdug bsngal gzhom pa'i phyir //
analyzed: brtse ldan sdug bsngal gzhom pa'i phyir //
translated: One who possesses love, in order to destroy suffering,

original: thabs rnams la ni mngon sbyor mdzad //üîΩces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thabs rnams la ni mngon sbyor mdzad // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: is dedicated to the means.

original: brtse ba dang ldan pas bdag dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal dbral bar bya ba'i phyir 'bad par bya bar 'os te /
analyzed: brtse ba dang ldan pas bdag dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal dbral bar bya ba'i phyir 'bad par bya bar 'os te /
translated: One who possesses love is worthy of striving to remove the suffering of self and other.

original: brtse ba dang ldan pa rang gi sdug bsngal bral ba med par gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bzlog par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtse ba dang ldan pa rang gi sdug bsngal bral ba med par gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bzlog par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For one who is compassionate cannot remove the suffering of others without removing his own suffering.

original: de'i phyir rang gi sdug bsngal bral bar mngon du byed pa dang / shes bya thams cad mngon du byed pas brtse ba dang ldan pas thabs la mngon par sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi sdug bsngal bral bar mngon du byed pa dang / shes bya thams cad mngon du byed pas brtse ba dang ldan pas thabs la mngon par sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, the compassionate one applies himself to the means of removing his own suffering and of realizing all objects of knowledge.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to destroy the suffering of self and others.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩthabs byung lkog gyur de'i rgyu can //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / thabs byung lkog gyur de'i rgyu can //
translated: ForüîΩthe means of attaining the goal is hidden, and it is difficult

original: de bshad par ni dka' ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de bshad par ni dka' ba'i phyir //
translated: to explain that.

original: zhes bya ba la lkog tu gyur pa'i thabs las byung ba ni mtho ris dang thar pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la lkog tu gyur pa'i thabs las byung ba ni mtho ris dang thar pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The means of attaining the goal is hidden, i.e., heaven and liberation.

original: de dag rgyu ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dang bdag med par mthong ba gang yin pa'i skyes bu de'i mtho ris dang thar pa gzhan la bstan par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: de dag rgyu ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dang bdag med par mthong ba gang yin pa'i skyes bu de'i mtho ris dang thar pa gzhan la bstan par dka' ba ste /
translated: It is difficult to show to others the heaven and liberation of that person who has the cause of those, i.e., who has the cause of heaven and liberation, namely, generosity, etc., and the insight into selflessness.

original: de la de'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la de'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not have the capacity to do so.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi tshad mas 'thad pa nyid las 'jug par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi tshad mas 'thad pa nyid las 'jug par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that one enters into the four noble truths through the validity of valid cognition?

original: mngon sum du byed pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is the point of making them manifest?

original: gal te 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rjes su dpag pas nges pa de lta na yang dmyal ba la sogs pa skyed pa'i las kyi 'bras bu 'jig rten kyi khams gzhan ston par mi nus pa nyid de /
analyzed: gal te 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rjes su dpag pas nges pa de lta na yang dmyal ba la sogs pa skyed pa'i las kyi 'bras bu 'jig rten kyi khams gzhan ston par mi nus pa nyid de /
translated: Even if one ascertains the four noble truths through inference, one is still unable to teach the world systems that produce the results of karma, such as the hells.

original: de'i phyir thams cad rig pa mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad rig pa mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one must make everything known through direct perception.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bral bar byed pa des sdug bsngal gyi rgyu brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bral bar byed pa des sdug bsngal gyi rgyu brtag par bya ste /
translated: One who is free from the suffering of self and other should investigate the cause of suffering.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that, it is said:

original: lung dang rigs pas rnam dpyod pa //
analyzed: lung dang rigs pas rnam dpyod pa //
translated: Through scripture and reasoning,üîΩone should investigate the nature of suffering

original: sdug bsngal nyid kyi khyad par gyis //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid kyi khyad par gyis //
translated: through the characteristics of suffering,

original: mi rtag la sogs sdug bsngal rgyu'i //üîΩngo bo de yang brtag pa mdzad //üîΩces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi rtag la sogs sdug bsngal rgyu'i // ngo bo de yang brtag pa mdzad // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: such as impermanence, and so on.

original: rigs pas ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pas ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: Reasoning is inference.

original: lung ni rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: lung ni rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa ste /
translated: Scripture is not the domain of inference.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i don can gyi shes pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i don can gyi shes pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the cause of the cognition of a meaning that transcends the senses.

original: yang na lung ni shes pa dang po'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: yang na lung ni shes pa dang po'i rgyu ste /
translated: Or, scripture is the cause of the first cognition.

original: de nas don nges par bya ba'i don du rigs pa 'jug pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de nas don nges par bya ba'i don du rigs pa 'jug pa yin gyi /
translated: Then, in order to ascertain the meaning, reasoning is applied.

original: lung tsam las nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lung tsam las nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But certainty does not come from scripture alone.
Therefore,

original: na dang por lung gis don mthong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: na dang por lung gis don mthong bar 'gyur la /
translated: first one sees the meaning through scripture.

original: de nas rigs pas don de bstan par byed cing /
analyzed: de nas rigs pas don de bstan par byed cing /
translated: Then, through reasoning, one demonstrates that meaning.

original: bstan par byas pa'i don la bsgoms pas mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: bstan par byas pa'i don la bsgoms pas mngon sum du byed do //
translated: And, through meditation on the meaning that is demonstrated, one realizes it.

original: de la lung dang rigs pa dag gis dpyod pa ni rgyu dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal bral par bya ba'i don du dang po re zhig sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de la lung dang rigs pa dag gis dpyod pa ni rgyu dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal bral par bya ba'i don du dang po re zhig sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid rtog par byed do //
translated: In this regard, one investigates with scripture and reasoning in order to be free from suffering that has a cause. First, one investigates the cause of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dpyad nas yang zlog par nus pa nyid dpyad pa'i don du /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dpyad nas yang zlog par nus pa nyid dpyad pa'i don du /
translated: Having investigated the cause of suffering, one investigates whether it can be eliminated.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu de nyid mi rtag pa la sogs par dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu de nyid mi rtag pa la sogs par dpyad par bya'o //
translated: One should analyze the cause of suffering in terms of impermanence, etc.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis rgyu ma dpyad na sdug bsngal spang ba'i phyir 'bad pa nyid du mi 'gyur te rgyu med pa'am /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis rgyu ma dpyad na sdug bsngal spang ba'i phyir 'bad pa nyid du mi 'gyur te rgyu med pa'am /
translated: If one does not analyze the cause of suffering in terms of its nature as impermanent, etc., then one would not strive to eliminate suffering, because the cause would be either causeless or have a permanent cause.

original: rgyu rtag pa can du gyur pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu zlog pa'i don du 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu rtag pa can du gyur pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu zlog pa'i don du 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
translated: If the cause of suffering were either causeless or have a permanent cause, then striving to eliminate the cause of suffering would be pointless.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dag rgyu med la zad par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dag rgyu med la zad par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, suffering and the cause of suffering would not cease without a cause.

original: rtag na yang ji ltar zad par 'gyur /
analyzed: rtag na yang ji ltar zad par 'gyur /
translated: And how could they cease if they were permanent?

original: rgyu ma zad par sdug bsngal zad par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu ma zad par sdug bsngal zad par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: One cannot eliminate suffering without eliminating its cause.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas brtag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should analyze the cause of suffering in terms of impermanence, etc.

original: ji ste sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi rtag pa'o zhes ji ltar nges par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ste sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi rtag pa'o zhes ji ltar nges par byed ce na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow does one ascertain that the cause of suffering is impermanent?‚Äù

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, we say:

original: sdug bsngal nyid kyi khyad par gyis te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid kyi khyad par gyis te /
translated: By the distinction of suffering itself.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi rtag par bya ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi rtag par bya ste /
translated: Impermanence and so on make suffering the cause of impermanence.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal mi rtag pa yin pa de ltar phyis bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal mi rtag pa yin pa de ltar phyis bshad par bya'o //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúSuffering is impermanent.‚Äù

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi gal te sdug bsngal mi rtag pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi gal te sdug bsngal mi rtag pa yin na /
translated: If suffering is impermanent,

original: mi rtag pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyur ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyur ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: how could impermanence be the cause of suffering?

original: 'di ltar rtag pa'i rgyu can nyid kyi sdug bsngal mi rtag par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa'i rgyu can nyid kyi sdug bsngal mi rtag par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Suffering would be impermanent because it would have a permanent cause.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gang phyir de ltar rgyu gnas pa //
analyzed: gang phyir de ltar rgyu gnas pa //
translated: Because the cause is seen to remain

original: 'bras ldog mthong ba med pa ste //üîΩde rgyu gzhom phyir de yi ni //üîΩmi mthun phyogs la brtag par byed //
analyzed: 'bras ldog mthong ba med pa ste // de rgyu gzhom phyir de yi ni // mi mthun phyogs la brtag par byed //
translated: and the effect is seen to cease,üîΩthe opposing factors of that

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: are to be investigated in order to destroy that cause.

original: gal te dbang phyug la sogs pa rtag pa nyid sdug bsngal gyis skyed par byed par 'gyur ba de lta na ni /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug la sogs pa rtag pa nyid sdug bsngal gyis skyed par byed par 'gyur ba de lta na ni /
translated: If a permanent entity such as ƒ™≈õvara were to generate suffering,

original: rgyu dbang phyug la sogs pa de ltar gnas pa ste sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa nyid du gnas pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu dbang phyug la sogs pa de ltar gnas pa ste sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa nyid du gnas pa ni /
translated: The cause, God, etc., which exists in that way, i.e., which exists as the producer of suffering,

original: 'bras bu sdug bsngal 'jig par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mi 'jig pa'i nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu sdug bsngal 'jig par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mi 'jig pa'i nges pa yin no //
translated: is not destroyed, because the effect, suffering, is not destroyed.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, suffering is impermanent.

original: rgyu yang mi rtag pa nyid du nges so //
analyzed: rgyu yang mi rtag pa nyid du nges so //
translated: The cause is also definitely impermanent.

original: de ltar 'dod na gal te rgyu zad pa nyid kyis @352b sdug bsngal 'dzad na /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod na gal te rgyu zad pa nyid kyis @352b sdug bsngal 'dzad na /
translated: If you accept that, then if suffering is destroyed by the destruction of the cause,

original: 'o na ni rgyu ji ltar zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni rgyu ji ltar zad par 'gyur te /
translated: how is the cause destroyed?

original: rang gi rgyu zad pas rgyu 'dzad par 'gyur na ni de lta na rang gi rgyu zad pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal 'dzad pa'i phyir sdug bsngal 'dzad pa'i thabs la 'jug par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu zad pas rgyu 'dzad par 'gyur na ni de lta na rang gi rgyu zad pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal 'dzad pa'i phyir sdug bsngal 'dzad pa'i thabs la 'jug par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If the cause is destroyed by the destruction of its own cause, then in that case, suffering is destroyed by the destruction of its own cause, so it is not necessary to apply a method to destroy suffering.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gzhom pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi rgyu de'i gnyen po gang yin pa de brtag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gzhom pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi rgyu de'i gnyen po gang yin pa de brtag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to destroy the cause of suffering, one should investigate the antidote to that cause of suffering.

original: rgyu mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye ba med par ldog pa ma yin pas de brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye ba med par ldog pa ma yin pas de brtag par bya'o //
translated: Since the cause is not stopped by the absence of an opposing condition, it should be examined.

original: rgyu med pa nyid kyis ldog par 'gyur ro zhe na rgyu gang zhig yin /
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid kyis ldog par 'gyur ro zhe na rgyu gang zhig yin /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIs it stopped by the absence of a cause?‚Äù what is the cause?

original: las yin no zhe na ma rig pa las gzhan dang gzhan pa'i las 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: las yin no zhe na ma rig pa las gzhan dang gzhan pa'i las 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúIt is karma,‚Äù then because karma arises from ignorance and is different from ignorance,

original: las zad pa las grol bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: las zad pa las grol bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: is it not the case that one is not liberated from the exhaustion of karma?

original: ma rig pa ni las dang / sdug bsngal ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni las dang / sdug bsngal ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: It should be explained that ignorance is not the cause of karma and suffering.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa'i gnyen po bdag med pa la 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa'i gnyen po bdag med pa la 'bad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should strive to eliminate ignorance by means of its antidote, the understanding of selflessness.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is the way it is.

original: sdug bsngal la so sor nges pa'i rgyu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la so sor nges pa'i rgyu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Suffering does not have a specific cause,

original: sdug pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du ma rgyur 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du ma rgyur 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has many causes, such as the nature of being separated from what is pleasant.

original: de bas na rgyu bzlog par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na rgyu bzlog par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to stop the cause.

original: 'dir lan smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir lan smras pa /
translated: Here, the reply is stated:

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin byas pa'i //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin byas pa'i //
translated: The apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù

original: 'dus byas spyod yul can chags pa //
analyzed: 'dus byas spyod yul can chags pa //
translated: The object of the compounded is attachment.

original: rgyu de gnod pa can nyid ni /üîΩbdag med mthong na 'gal ba yin /
analyzed: rgyu de gnod pa can nyid ni / bdag med mthong na 'gal ba yin /
translated: That cause is harmful,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: because it is incompatible with seeing selflessness.

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa ni /
translated: The grasping of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù

original: nga dang nga yir mngon par zhen pas byas pa'i chags pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: nga dang nga yir mngon par zhen pas byas pa'i chags pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ste /
translated: is attachment that is produced by the manifest clinging to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: chags pa log na /
analyzed: chags pa log na /
translated: When attachment is reversed,

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba yang spang bar 'gyur bas sdug bsngal med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba yang spang bar 'gyur bas sdug bsngal med par 'gyur ro //
translated: the ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù are abandoned, and suffering is eliminated.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi ;
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi ;
translated: This is how it is.

original: gal te bdag dang bdag gi bcom nas chags pa med par gyur pa na /
analyzed: gal te bdag dang bdag gi bcom nas chags pa med par gyur pa na /
translated: But if the ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù are destroyed and attachment is eliminated,

original: yid la sdug bsngal mi 'byung yang lus kyi sdug bsngal bdag nyid la yod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: yid la sdug bsngal mi 'byung yang lus kyi sdug bsngal bdag nyid la yod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: mental suffering will not arise, but physical suffering will still exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gzhan la phan par brtson pa dang ldan pa ni bdag nyid sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan la phan par brtson pa dang ldan pa ni bdag nyid sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Those who are dedicated to helping others will not suffer.

original: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they do not grasp ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: bu la chags pa dang / lhag par rang la zhen pa las lus la ral gri la sogs pas bsnun pa'i sdug bsngal dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bu la chags pa dang / lhag par rang la zhen pa las lus la ral gri la sogs pas bsnun pa'i sdug bsngal dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The suffering of being pierced by swords and so on is observed to arise from attachment to one's son and from attachment to one's own body.

original: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin pa de bas na /
translated: Moreover, the view of the transitory aggregates is the attachment to the self and to that which belongs to the self.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyud ni @353a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyud ni @353a * //
translated: Thus, the continuum of suffering

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin no //
translated: is the view of the transitory aggregates.üîΩThe aggregates are the basis of the view of the transitory aggregates.

original: 'dus byas ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: The aggregates are contaminated entities.

original: de'i spyod yul can 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //üîΩsdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba la gnod pa can bdag med pa mthong ba ni /
analyzed: de'i spyod yul can 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o // sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba la gnod pa can bdag med pa mthong ba ni /
translated: The view of the transitory aggregates is the view that has the aggregates as its object.üîΩThe view of the transitory aggregates is the cause of suffering.

original: de dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: The view of no-self, which is incompatible with the view of the transitory aggregates, is the antidote to the latter.

original: bdag med pa'i rnam pa ni chags pa'i rnam pa dang 'gal ba can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i rnam pa ni chags pa'i rnam pa dang 'gal ba can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The aspect of no-self is incompatible with the aspect of attachment.

original: de'i gnod pa can yin te /
analyzed: de'i gnod pa can yin te /
translated: It is the antidote to the view of the transitory aggregates.

original: dper na / snum la sogs pa ni rlung dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na / snum la sogs pa ni rlung dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: For example, oil and so on are incompatible with wind.

original: de bas na bdag med pa mngon du byas pa las mi rtag pa'i rgyu 'jig tshogs la lta ba ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na bdag med pa mngon du byas pa las mi rtag pa'i rgyu 'jig tshogs la lta ba ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, from the realization of selflessness, the cause of impermanence, the view of the perishing aggregates, is eliminated.

original: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa log na sdug bsngal thams cad ldog par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa log na sdug bsngal thams cad ldog par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When attachment to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù is eliminated, all suffering is eliminated.

original: ci ste lus bcad pa dang / bsregs pa la sogs pas nyen na /
analyzed: ci ste lus bcad pa dang / bsregs pa la sogs pas nyen na /
translated: But if the body is injured by cutting, burning, etc.,

original: ji ltar 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal med par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal med par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can there be no suffering of death, etc.?

original: de ni bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bden pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because what is called ‚Äúdeath‚Äù

original: lus gcig dang bral ba yin zhing /
analyzed: lus gcig dang bral ba yin zhing /
translated: is the separation of one body,

original: lus gzhan du 'byung pa ni skye ba yin te /
analyzed: lus gzhan du 'byung pa ni skye ba yin te /
translated: and the arising of another body is birth,

original: snga phyi'i gnas skabs dag goms pas bskyed pa'i blo g-yer bag can dran pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga phyi'i gnas skabs dag goms pas bskyed pa'i blo g-yer bag can dran pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind, which is developed by the habit of the prior and subsequent states, is not confused and is mindful.

original: de'i tshe byis pa dang lang tsho'i dus spong ba dang / len pa bzhin dang / gos 'dor ba dang spyod pa bzhin de'i lus kyi skye ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe byis pa dang lang tsho'i dus spong ba dang / len pa bzhin dang / gos 'dor ba dang spyod pa bzhin de'i lus kyi skye ba yang yin no //
translated: At that time, just as a child is abandoned and youth is taken up, and just as old clothes are removed and new clothes are put on, so also the body is born.

original: ji ltar goms pa de bzhin du 'dod pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / btang snyoms pa la goms na yang sdug bsngal dang / bde ba goms par mi 'gyur ba bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar goms pa de bzhin du 'dod pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / btang snyoms pa la goms na yang sdug bsngal dang / bde ba goms par mi 'gyur ba bzhin te /
translated: Just as one becomes accustomed to desire, and then desire arises from that cause, and just as one becomes accustomed to equanimity, and then neither pain nor pleasure arises from that cause.

original: de bas na bdag med pa goms na 'khrul pa'i rgyu thams cad kyis 'khrug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bdag med pa goms na 'khrul pa'i rgyu thams cad kyis 'khrug pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when one becomes accustomed to selflessness, one is not disturbed by any of the causes of error.

original: rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa las log pa dang / shes rab rgyas par gyur na rnam pa du ma dang ldan pa'i thabs mang po mthong ba las skyon dang yon tan rnams gsal bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa las log pa dang / shes rab rgyas par gyur na rnam pa du ma dang ldan pa'i thabs mang po mthong ba las skyon dang yon tan rnams gsal bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: When one turns away from the causes of desire and so on, and when wisdom expands, one sees the many methods that have many aspects, and thereby the faults and virtues become clear.

original: thams cad rig pa srid pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad rig pa srid pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all is possible for one who knows everything.

original: gal te bdag med pa mthong ba las sdug bsngal zhi bar 'gyur ba de lta na yang thams cad mkhyen pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te bdag med pa mthong ba las sdug bsngal zhi bar 'gyur ba de lta na yang thams cad mkhyen pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if suffering were to be pacified by seeing selflessness, still an omniscient being would not exist.

original: gal te bdag med pa mthong ba las thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bdag med pa mthong ba las thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur na /
translated: If one were to become omniscient by seeing selflessness,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rang sangs rgyas kyang thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rang sangs rgyas kyang thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are not those who are free from attachment and the pratyekabuddhas omniscient?

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩdus ring por yang rnam mang pos //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / dus ring por yang rnam mang pos //
translated: Here we say:üîΩEven over a long time,üîΩthrough many methods,

original: rnam pa du mar thabs @353b goms pa //
analyzed: rnam pa du mar thabs @353b goms pa //
translated: in many ways,

original: de lta skyon dang yon tan rnams //
analyzed: de lta skyon dang yon tan rnams //
translated: the faults and virtues

original: rab tu gsal ba nyid 'gyur te //
analyzed: rab tu gsal ba nyid 'gyur te //
translated: become very clear.

original: thugs kyang gsal ba de yi phyir //üîΩrgyu yi bag chags spangs pa ni //
analyzed: thugs kyang gsal ba de yi phyir // rgyu yi bag chags spangs pa ni //
translated: Because of that clarity of mind,üîΩthe great sages,

original: thub chen gzhan don 'jug can gyi //üîΩbse ru sogs las khyad 'di yin //
analyzed: thub chen gzhan don 'jug can gyi // bse ru sogs las khyad 'di yin //
translated: who have abandoned the imprints of the causes,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: are different from the rhinoceros-like and so on.

original: gang 'di blo gsal ba'i skyes bu yang dang yang du thabs mang po la dus yun ring por goms par byas na /
analyzed: gang 'di blo gsal ba'i skyes bu yang dang yang du thabs mang po la dus yun ring por goms par byas na /
translated: Here, if a person who has a clear mind repeatedly cultivates many methods over a long time,

original: de ni lam de dang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs skyon dang yon tan bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni lam de dang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs skyon dang yon tan bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the faults and virtues that are discordant with that path and those virtues that are concordant with that path will become clear.

original: de ltar goms par byed pa'i skyes bu goms pa las /
analyzed: de ltar goms par byed pa'i skyes bu goms pa las /
translated: From the cultivation of that kind of cultivation,

original: blo gsal ba las rgyu ste /
analyzed: blo gsal ba las rgyu ste /
translated: the mind becomes clear.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i bag chags nyon mongs pas byas pa'i lus dang ngag dang blo'i nus pa nyams pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi spangs pa ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i bag chags nyon mongs pas byas pa'i lus dang ngag dang blo'i nus pa nyams pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi spangs pa ni /
translated: The abandonment which is the elimination of the latent impressions of the cause of suffering, and which is the characteristic of the decline of the power of body, speech, and mind produced by the afflictions,

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan gyi don du 'jug pa can bse ru la sogs pa las khyad par 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan gyi don du 'jug pa can bse ru la sogs pa las khyad par 'di nyid yin te /
translated: is the very distinction of the Lord from the rhinoceros-like, who engage for the sake of others.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The characteristic of the abandonment of the obscurations of the afflictions and the knowable

original: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags yod pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags yod pa yin no //
translated: is the fact that the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on have the latent imprints of the afflictions.

original: thabs ni spros na rnam pa mang po yod la /
analyzed: thabs ni spros na rnam pa mang po yod la /
translated: If one elaborates, there are many aspects of method.

original: de la dus yun ring por goms pa las 'khor ba'i skyon dang yon tan ma lus pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de la dus yun ring por goms pa las 'khor ba'i skyon dang yon tan ma lus pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: Through long-term familiarity with that, all the faults and good qualities of cyclic existence are eliminated.

original: phyogs snga ma skye ba gzhan dran pa ma mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyogs snga ma skye ba gzhan dran pa ma mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it seen that ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on remember other lives?

original: de med par las dang 'bras bur 'brel par ji ltar shes pa yin /
analyzed: de med par las dang 'bras bur 'brel par ji ltar shes pa yin /
translated: How is it that they know the connection between karma and effects without that?

original: goms pa yang mthong ba dang dran pa'i dngos po la 'jug gi / las dang 'bras bu ni mngon sum pa yin te /
analyzed: goms pa yang mthong ba dang dran pa'i dngos po la 'jug gi / las dang 'bras bu ni mngon sum pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the cultivation of the path is directed to the things that are seen and remembered, but karma and its result are not directly perceived.

original: dus yun ring pos chod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus yun ring pos chod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are separated by a long period of time.

original: mngon sum med na rjes su dpag pas kyang las dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: mngon sum med na rjes su dpag pas kyang las dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: If they are not directly perceived, then even inference cannot ascertain the individual karma and its result.

original: de la goms par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de la goms par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How then can there be cultivation of the path?

original: de med par yang las dang 'bras bu spros pa mngon sum du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de med par yang las dang 'bras bu spros pa mngon sum du byed pa yin no //
translated: Even without that cultivation, the direct perception of the elaboration of karma and its result is possible.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni tshad mas yongs su bcad pa'i phyir bsgoms pas mngon sum du bya bar nus mod kyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni tshad mas yongs su bcad pa'i phyir bsgoms pas mngon sum du bya bar nus mod kyi /
translated: The four noble truths can be directly perceived through cultivation, because they are ascertained by a valid cognition.

original: 'on kyang thams cad rig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad rig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not possible to know everything.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la yang bden pa bzhi rig pa yod kyang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la yang bden pa bzhi rig pa yod kyang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though one who is free from attachment knows the four noble truths, he is not omniscient.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi shes pa la gegs byed pa'i nyon mongs pa de rnams dang bral na gegs byed pa med pa'i phyir shes bya thams cad mngon du byed par grub par 'dod na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi shes pa la gegs byed pa'i nyon mongs pa de rnams dang bral na gegs byed pa med pa'i phyir shes bya thams cad mngon du byed par grub par 'dod na /
translated: Although that is so, if one is free of those afflictions that obstruct consciousness, then since there is no obstruction, it is established that all objects of knowledge are perceived.

original: de ni mi bden te /üîΩgal te so sor @354a * //üîΩnges pa'i dngos po rnams la phyin ci log tu rtog pa'i rgyu 'dod chags la sogs ba rnams dang bral ba las /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te / gal te so sor @354a * // nges pa'i dngos po rnams la phyin ci log tu rtog pa'i rgyu 'dod chags la sogs ba rnams dang bral ba las /
translated: That is not tenable.

original: rus pa'i lu gu rgyud lta bu de la yang dag pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur na shes bya thams cad du ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rus pa'i lu gu rgyud lta bu de la yang dag pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur na shes bya thams cad du ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: If a correct consciousness arose in regard to that skeleton, which is an object of individual knowledge, through freedom from the causes of mistaken conception, such as attachment, then how could all objects of knowledge be seen?

original: 'on kyang so sor nges pa'i dngos po bdag med par mthong ba na bdag med par khyad par med pas thams cad mthong bar 'grub pa yin na ni /üîΩde lta na 'o na ni bdag la sogs pas sngon po mthong ba na dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang so sor nges pa'i dngos po bdag med par mthong ba na bdag med par khyad par med pas thams cad mthong bar 'grub pa yin na ni / de lta na 'o na ni bdag la sogs pas sngon po mthong ba na dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: However, if it is established that all objects of knowledge are seen when one sees the selflessness that is the object of individual knowledge, since there is no difference in selflessness,

original: shes bya thams cad mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: then in that case, when one sees blue through the eye consciousness, since it is an object of knowledge, all objects of knowledge would be directly perceived.

original: de bas na gang du mthong ba'i rkyen 'jug pa de nyid mthong bar nus kyi ;
analyzed: de bas na gang du mthong ba'i rkyen 'jug pa de nyid mthong bar nus kyi ;
translated: Therefore, wherever the condition of seeing engages, one is able to see that.

original: 'dir ni bdag med pa gang du goms pa de yis phung po lnga rnams kyi phyogs 'ga' la bdag med pa mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir ni bdag med pa gang du goms pa de yis phung po lnga rnams kyi phyogs 'ga' la bdag med pa mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: But here, by cultivating selflessness, one will see the selflessness of some aspect of the five aggregates,

original: las dang 'bras bu'i spros pa shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu'i spros pa shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the knowledge of the elaboration of karma and its effects.

original: de ni mtha' yas pas goms pa nyid mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mtha' yas pas goms pa nyid mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is limitless, cultivation itself does not engage.

original: de bas na las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa de la rig byed nyid tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de bas na las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa de la rig byed nyid tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, if you think that in that case, the Vedas would be valid cognition regarding the connection between karma and its effects,

original: de ni bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bden pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not true.

original: gang gi phyir re zhig bar ma do'i 'jig rten grub pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir re zhig bar ma do'i 'jig rten grub pas so //
translated: Because the intermediate existence is established.

original: ji ste bar ma do'i 'jig rten yod kyang skye ba gzhan dran pa med pa'o zhes smras so zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste bar ma do'i 'jig rten yod kyang skye ba gzhan dran pa med pa'o zhes smras so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that even though the intermediate existence exists, the memory of other births does not exist,

original: smras pa de mi 'thad de /
analyzed: smras pa de mi 'thad de /
translated: we say that is untenable.

original: 'di ltar gal te skye ba gzhan yod la sbyin pa la sogs pa sngar nyams su myong ba dran pa goms pa nyi ma re rer 'phel bar gyur pa de'i tshe ji ltar mi dran pa yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te skye ba gzhan yod la sbyin pa la sogs pa sngar nyams su myong ba dran pa goms pa nyi ma re rer 'phel bar gyur pa de'i tshe ji ltar mi dran pa yin /
translated: Thus, if there is another birth and one remembers the practice of generosity and so on, which was experienced in a previous life, and if the practice increases day by day, how can one be without memory?

original: de ma thag tu nyams su myong ba la goms pa med na ni dran pa med par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma thag tu nyams su myong ba la goms pa med na ni dran pa med par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one does not practice the memory of what was experienced immediately before, one sees that there is no memory.

original: gang la dran pa goms pa las blo gsal ba yod pa de la yun ring du 'das pa yang dran pa'i yul du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang la dran pa goms pa las blo gsal ba yod pa de la yun ring du 'das pa yang dran pa'i yul du 'gyur te /
translated: For one who has a clear mind through the practice of memory, even what was long ago is the object of memory.

original: 'di ltar rgas pa'i gnas skabs na bus pa'i tshe myong ba skad cig la dran pa de bzhin du goms pa phul du byung ba las skye ba gzhan du myong ba yang dran pa'i yul du 'gyur ba'i phyir dran pa goms pa la 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgas pa'i gnas skabs na bus pa'i tshe myong ba skad cig la dran pa de bzhin du goms pa phul du byung ba las skye ba gzhan du myong ba yang dran pa'i yul du 'gyur ba'i phyir dran pa goms pa la 'bad par bya'o //
translated: Thus, in the state of old age, one remembers what was experienced in childhood. In the same way, through the excellence of practice, one remembers what was experienced in another birth. Therefore, one should strive in the practice of memory.

original: de la yang dper na yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa rig pa des yul gzhan dang 'brel pas bskyed pa'i khyad par mthong ba na /
analyzed: de la yang dper na yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa rig pa des yul gzhan dang 'brel pas bskyed pa'i khyad par mthong ba na /
translated: Moreover, for example, when one who has come from another country sees a particular thing produced in another country, he knows that it was produced in another country.

original: de nas 'ongs par nges par byed de /
analyzed: de nas 'ongs par nges par byed de /
translated: Then, one ascertains that the person has come from another world.

original: lta sbyin bzhin yul gzhan pa yang rnam par gcod pa can du shes pa yin no //
analyzed: lta sbyin bzhin yul gzhan pa yang rnam par gcod pa can du shes pa yin no //
translated: Just as one knows that the object is different from the subject, so too, one knows that the person has come from another world.

original: de bzhin du dran pa gsal ba yod na 'jig rten gzhan nas 'ongs pa'i skyes bu'i yul @354b can gyi shes pa yod na skya ba gzhan khyad par du gyur pa yang shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa gsal ba yod na 'jig rten gzhan nas 'ongs pa'i skyes bu'i yul @354b can gyi shes pa yod na skya ba gzhan khyad par du gyur pa yang shes pa yin te /
translated: In the same way, if one has clear memory, then if there is a cognition that has as its object a person who has come from another world, one knows that the person is different from the world.

original: 'di ni las 'di dang yul 'di 'brel par sngon nas yod pa de lta bu'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid dang ldan pa las so sor nges pa'i las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba rigs pa skye ste /
analyzed: 'di ni las 'di dang yul 'di 'brel par sngon nas yod pa de lta bu'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid dang ldan pa las so sor nges pa'i las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba rigs pa skye ste /
translated: This is the reasoning that arises from the nature of the object that is the connection between the action and its result, which is endowed with the nature of the aspect that existed previously.

original: dper na du ba'i ngo bo nyid phra ba nges na rgyu rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yang shes par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na du ba'i ngo bo nyid phra ba nges na rgyu rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yang shes par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, if one ascertains the subtle nature of smoke, one will also know the nature of the cause, such as grass and leaves.

original: de bzhin du las dang 'bras du dag gi khyad par can gyi rang bzhin yang nges na rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog go //
analyzed: de bzhin du las dang 'bras du dag gi khyad par can gyi rang bzhin yang nges na rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog go //
translated: In the same way, if one ascertains the nature that is endowed with the distinction between action and result, one will infer everything.

original: rgyu'i ngo bo nyid shes na yang de'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid brgyud nas shas pa'i phyir las dang bras bu'i 'brel pa thams cad shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i ngo bo nyid shes na yang de'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid brgyud nas shas pa'i phyir las dang bras bu'i 'brel pa thams cad shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one knows the nature of the cause, one knows the nature of the effect through the cause.

original: mtho ris dang thar pa'i lam yang dag par shes na ni /
analyzed: mtho ris dang thar pa'i lam yang dag par shes na ni /
translated: If one knows the path to heaven and liberation,

original: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: one becomes omniscient.

original: phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu las 'das par shes bya thams cad skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu las 'das par shes bya thams cad skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all objects of knowledge are not produced, apart from being cause and effect.

original: rnam pa du mar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin shes pa des ni shes bya thams cad rig pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa du mar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin shes pa des ni shes bya thams cad rig pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
translated: By knowing the nature of cause and effect in many ways, one is faultless in knowing all objects of knowledge.

original: 'o na na ni gal te 'bras bu'i rang bzhin shes pas rgyu'i rang bzhin shes pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: 'o na na ni gal te 'bras bu'i rang bzhin shes pas rgyu'i rang bzhin shes pa de lta na ni /
translated: If one knows the nature of the cause by knowing the nature of the effect,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rig pas ji ltar thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rig pas ji ltar thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur te /
translated: how can one become omniscient through inferential knowledge?

original: bcom ldan 'das mngon du mkhyen pa can du khas blangs so zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mngon du mkhyen pa can du khas blangs so zhe na /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is accepted as having direct knowledge.

original: 'dis ni cir yang mi 'gyur ba nyid de rnam pa thams cad dpog pa ni mngon sum las tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni cir yang mi 'gyur ba nyid de rnam pa thams cad dpog pa ni mngon sum las tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: This is because the ascertainment of all aspects of something that does not change into anything else is not different from perception.

original: 'dir ltar don mngon du byed pa can gyi shes pa la mngon sum zhes brjod de /
analyzed: 'dir ltar don mngon du byed pa can gyi shes pa la mngon sum zhes brjod de /
translated: In this way, cognition that manifests an object is called perception.

original: gang gi tshe goms pa phul du byung ba las shes bya ma lus pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad gsal bar snang ba de'i tshe de nyid mngon sum bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe goms pa phul du byung ba las shes bya ma lus pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad gsal bar snang ba de'i tshe de nyid mngon sum bzhin no //
translated: When, through the culmination of familiarization, all objects of knowledge appear clearly in all their aspects, at that time, that is like perception.

original: gang yang thams cad la goms pa mi srid pas de ji ltar thams cad mngon du byed par 'gyur zhes smras pa de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gang yang thams cad la goms pa mi srid pas de ji ltar thams cad mngon du byed par 'gyur zhes smras pa de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Also, what was said, ‚ÄúSince familiarization with everything is impossible, how could everything be manifested?‚Äù is not tenable.

original: gang goms pa tsam de nyid shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang goms pa tsam de nyid shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that mere familiarization is not knowledge.

original: 'di ltar sgra yongs su shes na tshad ma shes pa la tshegs med pa bzhin kha cig thos pa med par shes pa dang / bshad pa'i dus su goms par byas pa nyid rgol ba dang lan gyi tshe 'jug pa yang yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra yongs su shes na tshad ma shes pa la tshegs med pa bzhin kha cig thos pa med par shes pa dang / bshad pa'i dus su goms par byas pa nyid rgol ba dang lan gyi tshe 'jug pa yang yod do //
translated: Some, without having studied, understand; and when it is time to explain, they apply themselves to the discussion and reply.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i rigs kyi bstan bcos la goms par byas na /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i rigs kyi bstan bcos la goms par byas na /
translated: If one applies oneself to the treatises of the same class,

original: de'i rigs nyid kyi gzhung shes pa ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩ'khor ba la rigs mtshungs pa @355a * //
analyzed: de'i rigs nyid kyi gzhung shes pa ma yin nam zhe na / 'khor ba la rigs mtshungs pa @355a * //
translated: does one not understand the texts of that class?üîΩIn the cycle of existence, is there not a similarity of class?

original: nyid kyang yod pa ma yin nam 'di ltar sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba srog chags rnams mtshungs pa dang / las dang 'bras bu'i spros pa dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rnam par gzhag pa la rtag tu rang bzhin gcig pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: nyid kyang yod pa ma yin nam 'di ltar sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba srog chags rnams mtshungs pa dang / las dang 'bras bu'i spros pa dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rnam par gzhag pa la rtag tu rang bzhin gcig pa nyid yin la /
translated: Thus, the elements, earth, etc., are the same for living beings; the elaboration of action and effect and the arrangement of origination and cessation are always of the same nature.

original: khyad par can gyi bye brag ni bstan bcos la sogs pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi bye brag ni bstan bcos la sogs pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: The particular differences are the same in the treatises, etc.

original: de bas na nyi ma re re'i lto ba 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bas na nyi ma re re'i lto ba 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, just as the belly of each day changes,

original: 'khor ba 'gyur ba yang yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor ba 'gyur ba yang yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is also change in cyclic existence.

original: dus yun ring por goms pas thams cad rig pa yang srid do //
analyzed: dus yun ring por goms pas thams cad rig pa yang srid do //
translated: And it is possible that through long-term familiarity with everything, one would know everything.

original: rtsod pa lhag ma ni thams cad mkhyen pa grub par gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rtsod pa lhag ma ni thams cad mkhyen pa grub par gsal ba yin no //
translated: The remaining objections are clarified in the treatise Establishing Omniscience.

original: slob dpon gyis bstan bcos sdug bsngal zhi ba'i rgyur bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis bstan bcos sdug bsngal zhi ba'i rgyur bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: Didn‚Äôt the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna teach the treatise to be the cause for the pacification of suffering?

original: de ltar yang //
analyzed: de ltar yang //
translated: As it is said:

original: 'gro la ston phyir bstan bcos so //
analyzed: 'gro la ston phyir bstan bcos so //
translated: In order to teach beings, I will teach the treatise.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ji ltar thabs la goms pas yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ji ltar thabs la goms pas yin zhe na /
translated: So how is it that the treatise is the cause for becoming familiar with the method?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: de yi don phyir thabs goms pa //
analyzed: de yi don phyir thabs goms pa //
translated: For the sake of that, becoming familiar with the method

original: 'di nyid bstan pa yin par 'dod //
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa yin par 'dod //
translated: is asserted to be the teaching.

original: grub pa'i sngon du yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: grub pa'i sngon du yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it exists prior to accomplishment,

original: gnyis po 'di ni rgyu ru bshad //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis po 'di ni rgyu ru bshad // ces bya ba la /
translated: these two are explained to be the causes.

original: bstan pa dngos su tshigs su bcad pas 'dod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bstan pa dngos su tshigs su bcad pas 'dod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The actual teaching is not asserted to be the verse,

original: 'on kyang thabs la goms pa nyid bstan par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang thabs la goms pa nyid bstan par 'dod do //
translated: but rather it is asserted that becoming familiar with the method is the teaching.

original: ji ltar thabs la goms pa bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar thabs la goms pa bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that becoming familiar with the method is the teaching?

original: de'i don gyi phyir te /
analyzed: de'i don gyi phyir te /
translated: It is for the sake of that.

original: de'i don gyis de'i sgrar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i don gyis de'i sgrar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: because the meaning of the word is the same as the meaning of the word ‚Äúmethod.‚Äù

original: dper na mar ni srog yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mar ni srog yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚Äúghee‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúlife.‚Äù

original: bstan pa'i don thabs goms par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bstan pa'i don thabs goms par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is the meaning of the teaching understood through the method?

original: thabs goms pa dang / blo gsal ba dag gis bstan par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs goms pa dang / blo gsal ba dag gis bstan par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of the teaching is understood through the method and through the clarity of mind.

original: 'di dag kyang ji ltar shes shen /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang ji ltar shes shen /
translated: How is this known?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: gnyis po 'di ni rgyu ru bshad //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di ni rgyu ru bshad //
translated: These two are explained as causes.

original: ces bya ba la goms pa dang bstan pa 'di gnyis ni thams cad rig pa'i rgyur gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la goms pa dang bstan pa 'di gnyis ni thams cad rig pa'i rgyur gsungs so //
translated: These two, the method and the teaching, are said to be the causes of omniscience.

original: ji ste rgyur bshad pas kyang 'di dag ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ste rgyur bshad pas kyang 'di dag ji ltar shes she na /
translated: If it is said that they are causes, how are they known?

original: sngon du yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sngon du yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they exist prior to omniscience.

original: ji ltar bstan bcos nyid dngos su bde bar gshegs pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan bcos nyid dngos su bde bar gshegs pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The treatise itself is not the direct cause of the Sugata,

original: thabs gang zhig goms pa las bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs gang zhig goms pa las bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Blessed One becomes the Sugata through the practice of the method.

original: bde bar gshegs pa nyid ces bya ba yang ji lta bu zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa nyid ces bya ba yang ji lta bu zhe na smras pa /
translated: What is meant by ‚Äúthe state of the Sugata‚Äù? It is said:

original: rgyu spangs yon tan gsum bde gshegs //
analyzed: rgyu spangs yon tan gsum bde gshegs //
translated: The Sugata is praised because he has abandoned the cause, because he has the three virtues,

original: nyid yin sdug bsngal rten min phyir //üîΩbsngags pa'o de ni bdag med pa //
analyzed: nyid yin sdug bsngal rten min phyir // bsngags pa'o de ni bdag med pa //
translated: because he is not a basis for suffering.üîΩThis is because he has seen selflessness

original: mthong ba'am rigs pa nyid phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthong ba'am rigs pa nyid phyir ro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: or because of reasoning.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu bdag dang @355b bdag gir 'dzin pas byas pa'i zhen pa'i rgyu de spangs pa'i yon tan gsum ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu bdag dang @355b bdag gir 'dzin pas byas pa'i zhen pa'i rgyu de spangs pa'i yon tan gsum ste /
translated: The cause of suffering is the cause of clinging, which is the view of self and mine. The Sugata is praised because he has abandoned that cause and has the three virtues:

original: rab tu mdzes pa nyid dang phyir mi ldog pa dang lhag ma med par bcom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu mdzes pa nyid dang phyir mi ldog pa dang lhag ma med par bcom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he is very beautiful, he is irreversible, and he has destroyed without remainder.

original: bcom pa ni med pa ste /
analyzed: bcom pa ni med pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Destroyed‚Äù means ‚Äúnonexistent.‚Äù

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa de mad na ni /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa de mad na ni /
translated: If the view of self and mine does not exist,

original: sdug bsngal gyi rten ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rten ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then he is not a basis for suffering.

original: rab tu bsngags pa nyid do //
analyzed: rab tu bsngags pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, he is very praiseworthy.

original: spangs pa de nyid gang las 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: spangs pa de nyid gang las 'byung zhe na /
translated: From what does that abandonment arise?

original: bdag med pa mthong ba nyid las ste /üîΩmthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni mthong ba nyid las sam /
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong ba nyid las ste / mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni mthong ba nyid las sam /
translated: It arises from seeing selflessness.

original: rigs pa las te /
analyzed: rigs pa las te /
translated: The afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing are abandoned by seeing or by reasoning.

original: rigs pa ni goms pa ste /
analyzed: rigs pa ni goms pa ste /
translated: Reasoning is meditation.

original: bsgom pas spang pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs zlog pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs zlog pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the cause for averting the mass of afflictions that are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: yang na rigs pa ni rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: yang na rigs pa ni rnal 'byor te /
translated: Or, reasoning is yoga.

original: phan tshun ldan pa nyid de /
analyzed: phan tshun ldan pa nyid de /
translated: It is the mutual possession

original: gnyis su med par mthong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis su med par mthong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: of the two, which is to say, the nondual seeing.

original: de la kha cig ni gang zag gi bdag med pas spangs la gzhan ni chos kyi bdag med pas so //
analyzed: de la kha cig ni gang zag gi bdag med pas spangs la gzhan ni chos kyi bdag med pas so //
translated: Some are abandoned by the selflessness of persons, and others are abandoned by the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de lta rab tu bsngags pa nyid kyi yon tan bstan nas /
analyzed: de lta rab tu bsngags pa nyid kyi yon tan bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the qualities of the highest praise,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i yon tan yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i yon tan yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: the qualities of irreversibility should be stated.

original: phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is meant by ‚Äúirreversible‚Äù?üîΩIt is said:üîΩArising, faults, and origination

original: smras pa / skye ba dang skyon kun 'byung dag / slar yang ldog ces bshad pa yin //
analyzed: smras pa / skye ba dang skyon kun 'byung dag / slar yang ldog ces bshad pa yin //
translated: are explained as not turning back.

original: bdag lta'i sa bon spangs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag lta'i sa bon spangs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the seed of the view of self is abandoned,

original: slar mi gshegs pa nyid yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba'i /
analyzed: slar mi gshegs pa nyid yin no // zhes bya ba'i /
translated: there is no returning.

original: skyon rnams dang skye ba kun 'byung ba dag slar mi ldog ste /
analyzed: skyon rnams dang skye ba kun 'byung ba dag slar mi ldog ste /
translated: Arising, faults, and origination do not turn back.

original: skyon med pa'i gnas skabs dang / phyir mi skye ba ni slar mi ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: skyon med pa'i gnas skabs dang / phyir mi skye ba ni slar mi ldog pa yin no //
translated: The stage of non-error and the non-rebirth of the latter is the non-return.

original: de nyid ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bdag tu lta ba nyid sa bon te rgyu'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba nyid sa bon te rgyu'o //
translated: The view of self is the seed, the cause.

original: de ston pas nyon mongs pa rnams mi skye la /
analyzed: de ston pas nyon mongs pa rnams mi skye la /
translated: When that is taught, the defilements do not arise.

original: nyon mongs pa med pas skye ba slar mi len pa'i phyir slar mi ldog pa yin no //üîΩji ste bdag med pa mthong bas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pas skye ba slar mi len pa'i phyir slar mi ldog pa yin no // ji ste bdag med pa mthong bas /
translated: And because of the absence of defilements, one does not take up rebirth again, so there is non-return.üîΩBut if the view of self is the cause of the defilements,

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa zlog par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa zlog par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how can the vision of selflessness stop the view of self?

original: rnam pa tha dad pas 'jug pa'i phyir yin na ni /
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pas 'jug pa'i phyir yin na ni /
translated: If it is by a different aspect,

original: de ltar na 'o na bdag tu lta ba yang bdag med pa las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir bzlog par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na bdag tu lta ba yang bdag med pa las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir bzlog par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the view of self would also stop the view of selflessness, because it is the opposite.

original: de log na ni skyon dang skye ba kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de log na ni skyon dang skye ba kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: And if that is stopped, then the faults and the origin of birth would return,

original: slar ldog bar thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: slar ldog bar thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: so it would follow that one would return.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: de bden tha dad bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: de bden tha dad bdag nyid kyis //
translated: That is true, but by a different nature,

original: lus ngag sems kyi gnas ngan len //
analyzed: lus ngag sems kyi gnas ngan len //
translated: the negative tendencies of body, speech, and mind

original: nyon mongs med nyid nad med pa'am //üîΩlam bshad mi gsal nyid lus pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs med nyid nad med pa'am // lam bshad mi gsal nyid lus pa'o //
translated: The absence of afflictions is the absence of disease.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The remainder is the unclear explanation of the path.

original: bdag med pa mthong ba de ni bden par 'gyur pa nyid dang / tha dad pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyis slar mi ldog pa @356a * //
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong ba de ni bden par 'gyur pa nyid dang / tha dad pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyis slar mi ldog pa @356a * //
translated: The vision of selflessness is true, is distinct, and is not turned back by its intrinsic reality.

original: yin gyi / bdag tu lta ba ni bdag med pa las phyin ci log yin pa de lta na yang bden pa ma yin pa'i phyir ldog par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yin gyi / bdag tu lta ba ni bdag med pa las phyin ci log yin pa de lta na yang bden pa ma yin pa'i phyir ldog par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: But the vision of self, even though it is the opposite of selflessness, is not turned back because it is not true,

original: bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not self.

original: 'o na lus pa zhes bya ba slar ldog pa med pa las gzhan ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na lus pa zhes bya ba slar ldog pa med pa las gzhan ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: Now, what is the remainder that is not turned back?

original: smras pa / lus dang ngag dang sems kyi gnas ngan len ni lus pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / lus dang ngag dang sems kyi gnas ngan len ni lus pa'o //
translated: The remainder is the negative reflex of body, speech, and mind.

original: lus la sogs pa'i gnas ngan len ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i gnas ngan len ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the negative reflex of body, etc.?

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa can te /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa can te /
translated: It is the non-existent afflictions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nad med cing skyon med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nad med cing skyon med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is the absence of disease and the absence of fault,

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the abandonment of the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: de la nyon mongs pa med pa'i lus kyi gnas ngan len ni dgra bcom par gyur kyang goms pa'i dbang gis mchongs shing 'gro ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //üîΩdag gi gnas ngan len ni /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa med pa'i lus kyi gnas ngan len ni dgra bcom par gyur kyang goms pa'i dbang gis mchongs shing 'gro ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no // dag gi gnas ngan len ni /
translated: The negative reflex action of the body is that even an arhat, by the power of habit, may jump up when frightened, even though he has no more afflictions.

original: nga rgyal med kyang brnyas par smra ba la sogs pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal med kyang brnyas par smra ba la sogs pa brjod pa'o //
translated: The negative reflex action of speech is that even without pride, one may say, ‚ÄúI am superior,‚Äù and so on.

original: yid kyi gnas ngan len ni thams cad du mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi gnas ngan len ni thams cad du mi shes pa ste /
translated: The negative reflex action of mind is that even though one has no ignorance, one may still be ignorant.

original: 'di gsum ni lus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gsum ni lus pa'o //
translated: These three are the negative reflex actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: lam bshad pa la mi gsal ba yang lus pa ste /
analyzed: lam bshad pa la mi gsal ba yang lus pa ste /
translated: The negative reflex action of the path is that one does not understand the path.

original: yun ring por goms par ma byas pa'i phyir blo gsal ba med na tshig la mkhas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yun ring por goms par ma byas pa'i phyir blo gsal ba med na tshig la mkhas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not understand the path, one will not become skilled in the words, because one has not cultivated them for a long time.

original: gal te bdag med pa mthong bas ma lus pa spong ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te bdag med pa mthong bas ma lus pa spong ba ma yin na /
translated: If the view of selflessness does not eliminate all the negative reflex actions,

original: 'o na lus pa de ci yis spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na lus pa de ci yis spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: then by what is the remainder eliminated?

original: bdag med pa mthong ba las spong ba'i rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong ba las spong ba'i rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no cause for elimination other than the view of selflessness.

original: yang ji srid brjod pa de srid skyon spangs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang ji srid brjod pa de srid skyon spangs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, as long as one speaks, one has not eliminated the faults.

original: smra ba ni dpyod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir dang / dpyod pa yang 'khrul pa'o snyam du sems na smras pa /
analyzed: smra ba ni dpyod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir dang / dpyod pa yang 'khrul pa'o snyam du sems na smras pa /
translated: If one thinks that speech is preceded by investigation, and that investigation is error, then it is said:

original: goms las ma lus spangs par 'gyur //
analyzed: goms las ma lus spangs par 'gyur //
translated: Through cultivation, all are abandoned.

original: kha cig sgra sogs phyir na skyon //
analyzed: kha cig sgra sogs phyir na skyon //
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúBecause of sound, etc.,

original: zad min zhe na 'di ldog par //
analyzed: zad min zhe na 'di ldog par //
translated: the faults are not exhausted,‚Äù

original: the tshom za ba de phyir 'khrul //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: the tshom za ba de phyir 'khrul // zhes bya ba la /
translated: then one doubts, and therefore errs.

original: blo gsal bar bogs phyung ba la sogs pa goms pa'i phyir bag chags ldog par 'gyur ba'o zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: blo gsal bar bogs phyung ba la sogs pa goms pa'i phyir bag chags ldog par 'gyur ba'o zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: Here, it should be explained that through cultivation, such as the enhancement of clear understanding, the latent propensities are eliminated.

original: de bas na goms pa las ma lus pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na goms pa las ma lus pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, through cultivation, all are abandoned.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is how it is.

original: smra ba la sogs pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa lus kyi skyon rnams zad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: smra ba la sogs pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa lus kyi skyon rnams zad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if one says, ‚ÄúBecause of speech, etc., the faults of the body, such as attachment, are not exhausted,‚Äù

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni lus la sogs pa gzung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni lus la sogs pa gzung ngo zhe na /
translated: and by the word ‚Äúetc.,‚Äù the faults of the body, etc., are included,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa la sogs pa de'i ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa la sogs pa de'i ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because one doubts the cessation of speech, etc.,

original: 'dir smras pa la sogs pa yang yod la skyon yang zad par 'gyur ba 'di la 'gal ba ci yod /üîΩde nyid kyi phyir ldog @356b pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa la sogs pa yang yod la skyon yang zad par 'gyur ba 'di la 'gal ba ci yod / de nyid kyi phyir ldog @356b pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir /
translated: Here, what contradiction is there in saying that there is a remainder of faults and that the faults are completely exhausted?

original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa'o zhes le'u dang por bstan to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa'o zhes le'u dang por bstan to //
translated: For this very reason, in the first chapter it was said that the reason is uncertain, because there is doubt about the reversal.

original: skyon rnams shin tu zad pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: skyon rnams shin tu zad pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are not the faults completely exhausted?

original: de'i phyir ji ltar skyon med pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar skyon med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, how can there be no faults?

original: skyon zad pa med pa'i rgyu ma mthong ba'i phyir skyon zad par byed pa med pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon zad pa med pa'i rgyu ma mthong ba'i phyir skyon zad par byed pa med pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause of the exhaustion of faults is not seen, it is not the case that there is no exhaustion of faults.

original: 'dir smas pa /
analyzed: 'dir smas pa /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: rtag nyid phyir ram thabs med phyir //
analyzed: rtag nyid phyir ram thabs med phyir //
translated: Because of permanence, or because there is no method,

original: thabs mi shes pa'i phyir na yang //
analyzed: thabs mi shes pa'i phyir na yang //
translated: or because of not knowing the method,

original: skyon rnams mi zad pa nyid du //üîΩrtog par byed pa yin na yang //
analyzed: skyon rnams mi zad pa nyid du // rtog par byed pa yin na yang //
translated: faults are not exhausted.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even though one conceives of this,

original: skyon zad pa med par rtag pa'i ni rgyu mtshan med par mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: skyon zad pa med par rtag pa'i ni rgyu mtshan med par mi 'jug ste /
translated: Because the reason for the non-exhaustion of faults does not operate,

original: 'on kyang gal te skyon de dag rtag par gyur na de'i tshe skyon rnams zad par mi srid de /
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te skyon de dag rtag par gyur na de'i tshe skyon rnams zad par mi srid de /
