translated: But if those faults were permanent, then it would be impossible for the faults to be exhausted.

original: rtag pa'i phyir rtag pa la bogs dbyung bar mi nus so //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir rtag pa la bogs dbyung bar mi nus so //
translated: Because of permanence, it is not possible to improve upon permanence.

original: 'on te zad pa'i thabs med pa'am /
analyzed: 'on te zad pa'i thabs med pa'am /
translated: Or, if there is no method for exhausting them,

original: mi shes pa de lta na yang mi zad do //
analyzed: mi shes pa de lta na yang mi zad do //
translated: then, even if one does not know, they would not be exhausted.üîΩIn order to teach that all three are impossible,

original: gsum char mi srid ces bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩrgyu ldan nyid phyir mi mthun phyogs //
analyzed: gsum char mi srid ces bstan pa'i phyir / rgyu ldan nyid phyir mi mthun phyogs //
translated: he says:üîΩBecause of possessing a cause,

original: goms pas rgyu ni zad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: goms pas rgyu ni zad pa'i phyir //
translated: because of the exhaustion of the cause through cultivation,

original: rgyu yi rang bzhin shes pa yis//üîΩde shes pa yang sgrub pa yin //
analyzed: rgyu yi rang bzhin shes pa yis// de shes pa yang sgrub pa yin //
translated: because of knowing the nature of the cause,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: and because of the attainment of the knowledge of that.

original: de la skyon rnams rtag pa nyid ma yin te rgyu dang ldan pa can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la skyon rnams rtag pa nyid ma yin te rgyu dang ldan pa can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therein, the faults are not permanent because they possess a cause.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa ni snga na med pas rtag pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa ni snga na med pas rtag pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: That which possesses a cause is not permanent because it did not exist previously.

original: skyon zad pa'i thabs med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skyon zad pa'i thabs med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there no method for exhausting the faults.

original: skyon gyi rgyu bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po bdag med par mthong ba gang yin pa de goms pas skyon rnams zad par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag med par mthong ba ni zad pa'i thabs nyid do //
analyzed: skyon gyi rgyu bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po bdag med par mthong ba gang yin pa de goms pas skyon rnams zad par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag med par mthong ba ni zad pa'i thabs nyid do //
translated: The antidote to the view of self, the cause of faults, is the vision of selflessness. Since faults are exhausted through cultivating that, the vision of selflessness is the method of exhaustion.

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin bdag dang / bdag gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa yod na de'i gnyen po'i shes pa yang sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin bdag dang / bdag gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa yod na de'i gnyen po'i shes pa yang sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If there were a consciousness that has the aspect of self and entities connected to the self, the cause of that, then the consciousness that is its antidote would also be established.

original: gang gang las phyin ci log tu gyur pa de'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: gang gang las phyin ci log tu gyur pa de'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The antidote to whatever is distorted is

original: dper na rlung la til mar bzhin du bdag tu 'dzin pa las bzlog pa ni bdag med pa mthong ba yin no /üîΩ// / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las /
analyzed: dper na rlung la til mar bzhin du bdag tu 'dzin pa las bzlog pa ni bdag med pa mthong ba yin no / // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las /
translated: just like, for example, the antidote to oil on the wind is seeing selflessness, which is the opposite of the conception of self.

original: bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: bam po brgyad pa /
translated: This is the commentary on the eighth chapter, having twenty-two verses, called ‚Äúthe examination of the self.‚Äù

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs pa nyid yin pa de ltar na yang rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa tsam las gzhan la ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs pa nyid yin pa de ltar na yang rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa tsam las gzhan la ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur te /
translated: If the Bhagavat is a sugata, then how could he be a valid cognition in regard to others, since he is merely perfect in his own aim?

original: 'di ltar bden pa'i dngos po ston pas tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar bden pa'i dngos po ston pas tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, it is a valid cognition because it teaches real things.

original: phyin ci log dag mi ston pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyin ci log dag mi ston pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not a valid cognition because it teaches what is erroneous.

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: This is not true.

original: brtse ba la goms pa dang / thabs la goms pas skyob pa nyid bcom ldan 'das yin no //
analyzed: brtse ba la goms pa dang / thabs la goms pas skyob pa nyid bcom ldan 'das yin no //
translated: The Blessed One is a protector because he is accustomed to compassion and he is accustomed to the means.

original: yang ji ltar skyob @357a * //üîΩpa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar skyob @357a * // pa yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is he a protector?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / skyob pa nyid gzigs la ma gsungs pa //
analyzed: smras pa / skyob pa nyid gzigs la ma gsungs pa //
translated: He does not teach what he sees as a protector,

original: 'bras bu med phyir brdzun mi gsung //
analyzed: 'bras bu med phyir brdzun mi gsung //
translated: because it would be fruitless. He does not teach what is false.

original: thugs rje ldan phyir gzhan don yang //
analyzed: thugs rje ldan phyir gzhan don yang //
translated: He is compassionate. He is devoted to the welfare of others.

original: brtson pa kun la goms phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brtson pa kun la goms phyir ro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is accustomed to all the practices.

original: mtho ris dang thar pa'i lam nyid kyis gzigs nas gzhan la gsungs pa ni skyob pa ste /
analyzed: mtho ris dang thar pa'i lam nyid kyis gzigs nas gzhan la gsungs pa ni skyob pa ste /
translated: He is a protector because he sees the path to heaven and liberation and teaches it to others.

original: gang la bde bar gshegs pa nyid yod pa de la 'dod pa ci yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la bde bar gshegs pa nyid yod pa de la 'dod pa ci yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the Sugata because he has no desire for anything.

original: 'di ni brdzun mi gsung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni brdzun mi gsung ste /
translated: He does not teach what is false.

original: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir 'bras bu ma mthong bar su yang phyin ci log tu smra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir 'bras bu ma mthong bar su yang phyin ci log tu smra ba ma yin no //
translated: Because there is no result, no one would speak falsely without seeing a result.

original: thugs rje dang ldan pa'i phyir thabs la goms pas gzhan gyi don byed pa de bas na bcom ldan 'das phyin ci log tu gsung pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thugs rje dang ldan pa'i phyir thabs la goms pas gzhan gyi don byed pa de bas na bcom ldan 'das phyin ci log tu gsung pa ma yin no //
translated: Because he is compassionate, he acts for the benefit of others through the practice of skillful means. Therefore, the Blessed One does not speak falsely.

original: de bas na dgos pa med pa dang rgyu med pa'i phyir phyin ci log tu gsung ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de bas na dgos pa med pa dang rgyu med pa'i phyir phyin ci log tu gsung ba ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, he does not speak falsely because he has no purpose and no cause for speaking falsely.

original: brtse ba dang ldan pa dang / 'phen pa las mi gsung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: brtse ba dang ldan pa dang / 'phen pa las mi gsung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: He is not one who does not speak because he is compassionate and because he is restrained.

original: de'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa skyob pa nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa skyob pa nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Sugata, the Protector, is a valid cognizer.

original: 'o na mu stegs byed pa yang rang gi lam ston par byed pa yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na mu stegs byed pa yang rang gi lam ston par byed pa yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But don‚Äôt the tƒ´rthikas also teach their own paths?

original: de yong tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yong tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: They would be valid cognizers.

original: 'on te de dag lam ston pa nyid med de /
analyzed: 'on te de dag lam ston pa nyid med de /
translated: But they do not teach the path.

original: de lam ma yin pa'i phyir zer na /
analyzed: de lam ma yin pa'i phyir zer na /
translated: Because that is not the path.

original: lam 'di la yang yid rton par byed ce na /
analyzed: lam 'di la yang yid rton par byed ce na /
translated: But you trust this path.

original: 'di dag ni bdag med par mthong ba'am /
analyzed: 'di dag ni bdag med par mthong ba'am /
translated: These are seen to be without a self.

original: de'i rigs pa ni rigs pas 'thad pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das nyid tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i rigs pa ni rigs pas 'thad pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das nyid tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: Since that reasoning is the path of logical correctness, the Lord is a valid cognizer.

original: mu stegs byed rnams ni bdag med pa ma mthong zhing rigs pa med pa yin pa'i phyir de dag tshad ma ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mu stegs byed rnams ni bdag med pa ma mthong zhing rigs pa med pa yin pa'i phyir de dag tshad ma ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Since the tirthikas do not see selflessness and do not have reasoning, they are not valid cognizers.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni de las bzlog pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni de las bzlog pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the Lord is a valid cognizer because he is the opposite of that,

original: de phyir bcom ldan 'das tshad ma yin zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de phyir bcom ldan 'das tshad ma yin zhes bstan to //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúTherefore, the Lord is a valid cognizer.‚Äù

original: skyob pa yang /
analyzed: skyob pa yang /
translated: The protector

original: bden pa bzhi ni ston mdzad yin //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi ni ston mdzad yin //
translated: is the one who teaches the four noble truths.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: yang na bden pa bzhi ston pa ni skyob pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na bden pa bzhi ston pa ni skyob pa yin gyi /
translated: the one who teaches the four noble truths is the protector,

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: but others are not.

original: gal te stong pa de nyid rig byed la sogs pa rnams la ston pa yod pa de lta na yang bdag la sogs pa yod pas de dag gi lam ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir bden pa bzhi ston pa nyid skyob pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te stong pa de nyid rig byed la sogs pa rnams la ston pa yod pa de lta na yang bdag la sogs pa yod pas de dag gi lam ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir bden pa bzhi ston pa nyid skyob pa yin no //
translated: Even if the teaching of emptiness in the Vedas and so on existed, since the self and so on exist, the teaching of the four noble truths is the protector because it is not their path.

original: de bas na thun mong ma yin pa'i don ston pa'i tshig can bcom ldan 'das yin te bden pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na thun mong ma yin pa'i don ston pa'i tshig can bcom ldan 'das yin te bden pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One is the one who teaches the uncommon meaning, because the truth exists.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four noble truths?

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang lam mo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang lam mo //
translated: They are suffering, origination, cessation, and the path.

original: las @357b dang 'bral bu 'brel ba'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ston pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das slu ba med par nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: las @357b dang 'bral bu 'brel ba'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ston pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das slu ba med par nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: The Blessed One is certainly non-deceptive, because he teaches the four noble truths, which are the connection between action and result.

original: de bas na bden pa bzhi ston pa ni gtsor skyob pa yin no //üîΩ'dod chags la sogs pa bud med la 'khyud pa'i rgyu yis bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: de bas na bden pa bzhi ston pa ni gtsor skyob pa yin no // 'dod chags la sogs pa bud med la 'khyud pa'i rgyu yis bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, the one who teaches the four noble truths is the foremost refuge.üîΩBecause it is the cause of happiness through the cause of embracing a woman with attachment and so on, it is happiness.

original: zhe sdang yang dgra bcom pa'i rgyu yin pas bde ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang yang dgra bcom pa'i rgyu yin pas bde ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: And because hatred is the cause of the arhat, it is the cause of happiness.

original: gti mug kyang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan nyid can bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba dang / dregs pa dang / rgyags pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba'i rgyu yin pas na bde ba yin no //
analyzed: gti mug kyang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan nyid can bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba dang / dregs pa dang / rgyags pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba'i rgyu yin pas na bde ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, delusion is the cause of pleasure because it is the cause of the pride, conceit, and arrogance of self-grasping, which is characterized by the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa yang bde ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa yang bde ba nyid yin te /
translated: The body, etc., are also pleasure because they are the basis of attachment, hatred, etc.

original: bde ba'i rten yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba'i rten yin pa'i phyir /
translated: They are the basis of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba med kyi bde ba nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba med kyi bde ba nyid do //
translated: There is no such thing as suffering; there is only pleasure.

original: gal te skom pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal yin na yang rab tu tshim par byed pa'i rgyur che ba'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te skom pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal yin na yang rab tu tshim par byed pa'i rgyur che ba'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If thirst, etc., are suffering, then the body, etc., are pleasure because they are the cause of the alleviation of suffering.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa mi bden pa nyid pas skyob pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa mi bden pa nyid pas skyob pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the doctrine of the Lord is not true, and hence is not a refuge.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: sdug bsngal 'khor ba can phung bo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'khor ba can phung bo //
translated: The aggregates are suffering, and cyclic existence is the suffering ofüîΩchange.

original: goms las 'dod chags sogs bsal ba //
analyzed: goms las 'dod chags sogs bsal ba //
translated: Attachment, etc. arise from habituation,

original: mthong phyir 'dod rgyal nyid ma yin //üîΩrgyu med skye ba 'gal phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong phyir 'dod rgyal nyid ma yin // rgyu med skye ba 'gal phyir ro //
translated: not from chance, because they are seen.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is contradictory that there be an uncaused arising.

original: 'khor ba'i chos dang 'dres pa las dbugs ma phyin pa'i sdug bsngal gyis byas pa'i phung po rnams nyid ni sdug bsngal la mi shes pas bde ba'i rang bzhin du mthong nas /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chos dang 'dres pa las dbugs ma phyin pa'i sdug bsngal gyis byas pa'i phung po rnams nyid ni sdug bsngal la mi shes pas bde ba'i rang bzhin du mthong nas /
translated: The aggregates that are produced by the suffering of the world that is not at peace, which is mixed with the dharmas of sa·πÉsƒÅra, are seen by the ignorant to have the nature of pleasure.

original: 'dod chags sogs pa bde ba'i tshul can gyi bde ba'o zhes smra ba de la goms pa las skye ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rjes thogs su bad ba 'byung ngo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'dod chags sogs pa bde ba'i tshul can gyi bde ba'o zhes smra ba de la goms pa las skye ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rjes thogs su bad ba 'byung ngo zhes bshad do //
translated: Attachment, etc. arise from habituation to the idea that they are pleasure, which is the way of pleasure.üîΩBut that is not so, because attachment, etc. arise from the intrinsic reality of things that does not depend on habituation.

original: de ni goms pa la ma ltos pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid las 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung bas 'dod chags la sogs pa de yang 'dod rgyal ba nyid du skye na ni rtag par yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ni goms pa la ma ltos pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid las 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung bas 'dod chags la sogs pa de yang 'dod rgyal ba nyid du skye na ni rtag par yang 'gyur na /
translated: If attachment, etc. arose from chance, they would arise constantly,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: but that is not reasonable.

original: gang gi tshe 'dod chags goms pa nyid las de gsal ba mthong ba yin pa de'i tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa tsam yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa spang bar rigs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dod chags goms pa nyid las de gsal ba mthong ba yin pa de'i tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa tsam yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa spang bar rigs te /
translated: When one sees that desire is clear only through the cultivation of desire, then it is right to abandon the cultivation of desire, etc. because desire, etc. are mere false imagination,

original: byis pa'i rtsod mo la goms pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byis pa'i rtsod mo la goms pa bzhin no //
translated: just like the cultivation of childish quarrels.

original: de bas na dngos po bde ba med kyi /üîΩsems kyi mngon bar 'dod @358a * //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po bde ba med kyi / sems kyi mngon bar 'dod @358a * //
translated: Therefore, there is no pleasure in things.üîΩThe characteristic of the mind‚Äôs desire is the adherence to pleasure. Since that is reversed through the cultivation of reality, it is right to cultivate reality itself, not the cultivation of pleasure, etc.

original: pa'i mtshan nyid la bde bar zhen pa ni de kho na nyid la goms pas sems ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir de kho na nyid la goms pa nyid du rung gi bde ba la sogs pa goms pa las skye bas sdug bsngal gyi gdung ba thams cad bdeüîΩbar snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i mtshan nyid la bde bar zhen pa ni de kho na nyid la goms pas sems ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir de kho na nyid la goms pa nyid du rung gi bde ba la sogs pa goms pa las skye bas sdug bsngal gyi gdung ba thams cad bde bar snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because all the torments of suffering appear as pleasure through the arising of the cultivation of pleasure, etc.

original: de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa spang bar 'os kyi /
analyzed: de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa spang bar 'os kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is right to abandon desire, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyi chos bud med la 'khyud par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyi chos bud med la 'khyud par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Attachment and so on are not natural phenomena, and embracing a woman is not natural.

original: de bas na de kho na nyid la mngon par dga' ba'i blor bya ba 'di ni rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de kho na nyid la mngon par dga' ba'i blor bya ba 'di ni rigs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to take delight in reality,

original: de kho na nyid gang gis kyang 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid gang gis kyang 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because reality is not changed by anything.

original: gang yang 'dod chags la sogs pa bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba'o zhes zer ba de la smras pa /
analyzed: gang yang 'dod chags la sogs pa bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba'o zhes zer ba de la smras pa /
translated: Now, someone might say that attachment and so on are happiness because they are the cause of happiness.

original: gal te 'dod chags bde ba'i rgyu nyid kyis bde bar 'dod na /üîΩde bzhin du bde ba yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags bde ba'i rgyu nyid kyis bde bar 'dod na / de bzhin du bde ba yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If you maintain that attachment is happiness because it is the cause of happiness,

original: sdug bsngal du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal du 'gyur te /
translated: then in the same way, happiness would be suffering because it is the cause of suffering.

original: 'di ltar bde ba yongs su gyur nas sdug bsngal phul du byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar bde ba yongs su gyur nas sdug bsngal phul du byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: For, when happiness changes, it becomes the cause of the most intense suffering.

original: bde ba ni sdug bsngal nyid pas sdug bsngal 'khor ba can phung po zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba ni sdug bsngal nyid pas sdug bsngal 'khor ba can phung po zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since happiness is suffering, it is established that this cyclic existence, called the ‚Äúaggregates,‚Äù is suffering.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa gsal bar goms pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa gsal ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phyir sna tshogs pa 'di ni rang gi rigs snga ma'i rgyu can yin pas 'khor ba can nyid du grub po //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa gsal bar goms pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa gsal ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phyir sna tshogs pa 'di ni rang gi rigs snga ma'i rgyu can yin pas 'khor ba can nyid du grub po //
translated: because of the cultivation of desire, etc., desire, etc., would be possessed by the clear light, and this variety is caused by the previous type of self.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is the way it is.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni goms pa kho na las ni ma yin gyi /üîΩji zhig ltar ram /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni goms pa kho na las ni ma yin gyi / ji zhig ltar ram /
translated: But desire, etc., do not arise from cultivation alone.üîΩThey arise from some other cause.

original: rgyu gzhan dag las 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba de bas na bde ba la sogs pa don dam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan dag las 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba de bas na bde ba la sogs pa don dam pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, pleasure, etc., are ultimate.

original: yang na ji ltar bde ba la sogs pa goms pa de ltar sdug bsngal la sogs pa yang goms pa las 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar bde ba la sogs pa goms pa de ltar sdug bsngal la sogs pa yang goms pa las 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or else, just as pleasure, etc., arise from cultivation, so also suffering, etc., would arise from cultivation.

original: bde ba nyid 'khor ba can gyi phung por 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba nyid 'khor ba can gyi phung por 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, pleasure itself would be the aggregates of the transmigrator.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: 'dod rgyal ba'i phyir rgyu med pa'i skye bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'dod rgyal ba'i phyir rgyu med pa'i skye bar mi rung ste /
translated: Because of the capriciousness of the cause, arising without a cause is not tenable.

original: dus la sogs pa'i zhing 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyu gzhan las kyang ma yin te goms pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa gsal bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus la sogs pa'i zhing 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyu gzhan las kyang ma yin te goms pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa gsal bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it from other causes, such as time, that desire, etc. arise, because desire, etc. are seen to be manifest from habituation.

original: gang gis sdug bsngal bsgom par 'gyur ba su yang sdug bsngal goms par byed pa ni med de /
analyzed: gang gis sdug bsngal bsgom par 'gyur ba su yang sdug bsngal goms par byed pa ni med de /
translated: No one cultivates suffering, since it is cultivated by the contemplation of suffering.

original: 'on kyang gang gi tshe bde ba la sogs pas gsal bar rung gi / bde ba de rnams med na sdug bsngal ni su yang @358b goms par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gi tshe bde ba la sogs pas gsal bar rung gi / bde ba de rnams med na sdug bsngal ni su yang @358b goms par mi byed de /
translated: But when pleasure, etc. are manifest, no one cultivates suffering, since those pleasures do not exist.

original: bde ba 'dod na thams cad 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba 'dod na thams cad 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one desires pleasure, one engages in everything.

original: de bas na 'bad pas bde ba bsgrub par bya ba'i sdug bsngal ni bde ba med kyang ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa'i phyir dngos po la ni sdug bsngal med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'bad pas bde ba bsgrub par bya ba'i sdug bsngal ni bde ba med kyang ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa'i phyir dngos po la ni sdug bsngal med pa kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, since suffering is to be accomplished by effort, and since suffering exists by its intrinsic reality even when there is no pleasure, there is no suffering in reality.

original: sdug bsngal de yang 'jig pa goms pa nyid las yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de yang 'jig pa goms pa nyid las yin no //
translated: And that suffering is from the habituation to destruction itself.

original: de bas na sdug bsngal 'jig pa goms pa las 'byung gi / sdug bsngal thams cad la bde bar brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sdug bsngal 'jig pa goms pa las 'byung gi / sdug bsngal thams cad la bde bar brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the destruction of suffering arises from cultivation, but it is not the case that all suffering is described as pleasure.

original: yang na 'dir sdug bsngal ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid can yin la /
analyzed: yang na 'dir sdug bsngal ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid can yin la /
translated: Or, here, suffering has the characteristic of the suffering of conditioned states.

original: bde ba ni don dam par med kyi /
analyzed: bde ba ni don dam par med kyi /
translated: Pleasure does not exist ultimately.

original: 'on kyang goms pa la sogs pa las sdug bsngal nyid 'byung ngo /'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las skyes pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang goms pa la sogs pa las sdug bsngal nyid 'byung ngo /'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las skyes pa ma yin gyi /
translated: However, suffering arises from cultivation, etc. It is not produced from the cultivation of passion, etc.

original: 'on kyang bad kan la sogs pa'i chos ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on kyang bad kan la sogs pa'i chos ma yin nam /
translated: Are not passion, etc., the qualities of phlegm, etc.?

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags ni bad kan gyi ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags ni bad kan gyi ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: Thus, passion is the essence of phlegm,

original: gi mug ni rlung gi ngo bo nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: gi mug ni rlung gi ngo bo nyid yin zhing /
translated: aversion is the essence of wind,

original: zhe sdang ma khris pa'i ngo bo nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang ma khris pa'i ngo bo nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and pride is the essence of bile.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon bzhin du ;
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon bzhin du ;
translated: Just like the faults of passion, etc.,

original: seng sna la sogs pa'i skyon gzhan yang mkhris pa la sogs pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: seng sna la sogs pa'i skyon gzhan yang mkhris pa la sogs pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: other faults such as jealousy are the qualities of bile, etc.

original: mkhris pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis yod pas rgyu de las skyes pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa don dam pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mkhris pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis yod pas rgyu de las skyes pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa don dam pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because they arise from causes that exist by way of their intrinsic reality, such as bile, and so on, attachment and so on are ultimate.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'khrul phyir rlung sogs chos ma yin //üîΩgal te rang bzhin 'dres pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'khrul phyir rlung sogs chos ma yin // gal te rang bzhin 'dres pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of error, wind and so on are not properties.

original: skyon med ce na de las gzhan //üîΩchos kyang ci phyir de mi mthong //
analyzed: skyon med ce na de las gzhan // chos kyang ci phyir de mi mthong //
translated: If you say there is no fault because of mixing with intrinsic reality,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: why don‚Äôt you also see properties in that way?

original: gang zhig gang gi chos yin pa de ni de la mi 'khrul ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi chos yin pa de ni de la mi 'khrul ba yin te /
translated: Here, that which is the property of something is not in error with respect to it,

original: dper na mar me'i gsal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mar me'i gsal ba bzhin no //
translated: like the illumination of a lamp.

original: gal te rlung la sogs pa'i chos gti mug la sogs pa yin na de la 'khrul par mi 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: gal te rlung la sogs pa'i chos gti mug la sogs pa yin na de la 'khrul par mi 'gyur ba las /
translated: If the properties of wind and so on are delusion and so on, they would not be in error with respect to it.

original: 'khrul par yang mthong ste /
analyzed: 'khrul par yang mthong ste /
translated: But they are seen to be in error.

original: 'di ltar rlung gi ngo bo nyid can gyi 'dod chags can dang / bad kan gyi ngo bo nyid can gyi gti mug can mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rlung gi ngo bo nyid can gyi 'dod chags can dang / bad kan gyi ngo bo nyid can gyi gti mug can mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus one sees that one who has the intrinsic reality of wind is attached, and one who has the intrinsic reality of phlegm is deluded.

original: 'on te bad kan gyi ngo bo nyid yin yang gzhan gti mug gi ngo bo nyid can yin te /
analyzed: 'on te bad kan gyi ngo bo nyid yin yang gzhan gti mug gi ngo bo nyid can yin te /
translated: But even if it is the nature of phlegm, it is still the nature of another, delusion.

original: de bas na rmongs shing sdang bar 'gyur ba de lta na yang ngo bo nyid phan tshun 'dres pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'i skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na rmongs shing sdang bar 'gyur ba de lta na yang ngo bo nyid phan tshun 'dres pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'i skyon med do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, even though it is confused and angry, since the natures are mixed with each other, there is no fault of confusion.

original: de ltar na ni ji ltar rlung gi ngo bo nyid can la mkhris pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na ni ji ltar rlung gi ngo bo nyid can la mkhris pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, then just as the nature of wind has bile,

original: zhe sdang yod pas khas blangs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhe sdang yod pas khas blangs pa de bzhin du /
translated: since anger exists, you accept that.

original: bad kan gyi rang bzhin can la zhe sdang las gzhan pa'i mkhris pa las skyes pa'i rdul @359a * //
analyzed: bad kan gyi rang bzhin can la zhe sdang las gzhan pa'i mkhris pa las skyes pa'i rdul @359a * //
translated: In the same way, why is it that in those who are of the nature of phlegm, other than anger, the qualities of bile such as bile,

original: la sogs pa'i chos ci'i phyir dmigs par ma gyur /
analyzed: la sogs pa'i chos ci'i phyir dmigs par ma gyur /
translated: and so on, are not observed?

original: 'on te zhe sdang nyid mkhris pa'i chos yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te zhe sdang nyid mkhris pa'i chos yin gyi /
translated: But if you say that anger itself is the quality of bile,

original: rdul la sog pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rdul la sog pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but bile and so on are not,

original: 'o na ni grogs dag mkhris pa can gyi rdul ci las skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ni grogs dag mkhris pa can gyi rdul ci las skye bar 'gyur /
translated: then how could the companions of bile arise from bile?

original: mkhris pa nyid las skyes so zhes na /
analyzed: mkhris pa nyid las skyes so zhes na /
translated: If you say that they arise from bile itself,

original: rlung gi ngo bo nyid can la yang zhe sdang bzhin /
analyzed: rlung gi ngo bo nyid can la yang zhe sdang bzhin /
translated: Also, one would hate the nature of wind.

original: mkhris pa nyid las rdul la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkhris pa nyid las rdul la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, one would hate bile, and so on.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúThat is so, but

original: gang ji ltar mthong ba de 'dod chags kyi chos yin no //
analyzed: gang ji ltar mthong ba de 'dod chags kyi chos yin no //
translated: whatever is seen is the property of passion.

original: mkhris pa la sogs pa thams cad la 'dod chags mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: mkhris pa la sogs pa thams cad la 'dod chags mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt passion seen in all bile, and so on?

original: de ji ltar thams cad kyi chos ma yin zer na /
analyzed: de ji ltar thams cad kyi chos ma yin zer na /
translated: How can it not be the property of all?

original: de ni de bzhin te /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat is so, but

original: chos thams cad la mthong ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad kyi chos yin no zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mthong ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad kyi chos yin no zhe na /
translated: because it is seen in all properties, passion is the property of all.‚Äù

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: thams cad kyi chos thams cad min //
analyzed: thams cad kyi chos thams cad min //
translated: The property of all is not all,

original: 'dod chags mtshungs par thal phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags mtshungs par thal phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that passion is the same as all.

original: gzugs la sogs bzhin skyon med na //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs bzhin skyon med na //
translated: If there is no fault, like form, and so on,

original: de la'ang brtsad pa mtshungs pa yin //
analyzed: de la'ang brtsad pa mtshungs pa yin //
translated: then the same objection applies to that.

original: gal te da la khyad par can //
analyzed: gal te da la khyad par can //
translated: If you say that it is special,

original: las rnams bdag po min na'o //
analyzed: las rnams bdag po min na'o //
translated: then actions are not the self.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here we say:

original: rlung la sogs pa thams cad kyi chos su 'dod chags la sogs pa mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa thams cad kyi chos su 'dod chags la sogs pa mi 'gyur te /
translated: Attachment and so on would not be the qualities of all things such as wind,

original: thams cad kyi chos nyid du 'dod chags la sogs pa 'gyur na /
analyzed: thams cad kyi chos nyid du 'dod chags la sogs pa 'gyur na /
translated: because attachment and so on would be the reality of all things.

original: srog chags thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: srog chags thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that is accepted, then it follows that all living beings would have the same attachment.

original: 'di ltar srog chags gang dag rlung la sogs pa gang cung zad yod pa de nyid srog chags kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar srog chags gang dag rlung la sogs pa gang cung zad yod pa de nyid srog chags kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because whatever living beings have, such as wind, would be the basis of attachment and so on of living beings, attachment and so on would be the same.

original: de ltar 'dod mod gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba'i chos su khas blangs na yang 'byung ba'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod mod gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba'i chos su khas blangs na yang 'byung ba'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though you accept that form and so on are the qualities of the elements, they are distinguished by the particularities of the elements.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa rlung la sogs pa'i chos yin yang de'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byed do zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa rlung la sogs pa'i chos yin yang de'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byed do zhe na /
translated: In the same way, even though attachment and so on are the qualities of wind and so on, they are distinguished by the particularities of those.

original: ci ste khyed la yang gzugs la sogs pa de la brtsad pa mtshungs pa nyid de /
analyzed: ci ste khyed la yang gzugs la sogs pa de la brtsad pa mtshungs pa nyid de /
translated: If you say that, then the same critique would apply to you, because form and so on are the same.

original: gal te khyad par can gyi las rnams bdag po med pa de bas na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par can gyi las rnams bdag po med pa de bas na /
translated: If karma that is the basis of distinctions does not exist,üîΩthen the intrinsic reality of the elements would not be the cause of distinctions such as form.

original: 'byung ba'i chos nyid la gzugs la sogs pa khyad par yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i brtsad pa 'di khyed la yod pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i chos nyid la gzugs la sogs pa khyad par yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i brtsad pa 'di khyed la yod pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: This objection is only for you,

original: sangs rgyas pa la ni brtsad pa yod pa ma yin te /üîΩlas la sogs pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la ni brtsad pa yod pa ma yin te / las la sogs pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: but it is not an objection for Buddhists,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because the distinctions of karma and so on are the cause of the distinctions of form and so on.

original: @359b 'dod chags la sogs pa bad kan la sogs pa kho na'i chos ma yin te /
analyzed: @359b 'dod chags la sogs pa bad kan la sogs pa kho na'i chos ma yin te /
translated: Attachment and so on are not the qualities of phlegm alone,

original: 'on kyang rlung la sogs pa'i rgyu can ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang rlung la sogs pa'i rgyu can ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: but are they not the cause of wind and so on?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: skyon rnams khyad par yod na yang //
analyzed: skyon rnams khyad par yod na yang //
translated: Even if faults have distinctions,

original: khyad par med phyir ma grub pa //
analyzed: khyad par med phyir ma grub pa //
translated: they are not established because they are not distinct.

original: nyid min thams cad 'gyur ba yis //
analyzed: nyid min thams cad 'gyur ba yis //
translated: If they were not so, then all would be so,

original: 'gyur ba'i phyir kun la skye'ang min //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i phyir kun la skye'ang min //
translated: but because they are so, they do not arise in all.

original: rgyu ni 'phel bar gyur na yang //
analyzed: rgyu ni 'phel bar gyur na yang //
translated: Even if the cause increases,

original: 'bras bu 'grib par mi rung ste //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'grib par mi rung ste //
translated: the result cannot decrease.

original: tsha ba sogs bzhin 'dod chags sogs //
analyzed: tsha ba sogs bzhin 'dod chags sogs //
translated: Attachment, etc. arise from wind, etc.

original: 'gyur ba na yang bde sogs skye //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gyur ba na yang bde sogs skye // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Just as heat, etc. arise from fire, etc.

original: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa rlung la sogs pa las skye na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa rlung la sogs pa las skye na ni /
translated: If attachment, etc. arise from wind, etc.

original: de'i tshe bad kan 'phel na 'dod chags 'phel bar 'gyur na /üîΩji srid rlung la sogs pa'i skyon rnams khyad par du 'phel ba yod na yang gti mug la sogs pa khyad par med pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe bad kan 'phel na 'dod chags 'phel bar 'gyur na / ji srid rlung la sogs pa'i skyon rnams khyad par du 'phel ba yod na yang gti mug la sogs pa khyad par med pa de'i phyir /
translated: then when phlegm increases, attachment would increase.

original: rlung la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'dod chags la sogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'dod chags la sogs pa ma yin no //
translated: But as long as the faults of wind, etc. increase in particular, delusion, etc. do not. Therefore attachment, etc. are not the effects of wind, etc.

original: 'on te khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: If you say ‚Äúbecause there is no difference,‚Äù the reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar mkhris pa 'phel bar gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mkhris pa 'phel bar gyur na /
translated: Thus, when bile increases,

original: mkhris pa'i sdug bsngal gyis mnar bas zhe sdang phul du 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: mkhris pa'i sdug bsngal gyis mnar bas zhe sdang phul du 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: hatred increases because one is tormented by the suffering of bile.

original: ma grub pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: That is not unestablished.

original: rlung la sogs pa thams cad 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa thams cad 'gyur ba ste /
translated: All wind, etc. are transformations.

original: 'phel bar 'gyur bas zhes sdang la sogs pa 'phel ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phel bar 'gyur bas zhes sdang la sogs pa 'phel ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because anger, etc. are seen to increase.

original: zha dang chung pa ni rlung 'phel bar gyur kyang zhe sdang mi skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: zha dang chung pa ni rlung 'phel bar gyur kyang zhe sdang mi skye'o zhe na /
translated: Even though the wind increases, anger does not arise in one who is weak or young.

original: 'di dag mkhris pa 'phel ba la yang brtsad pa mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag mkhris pa 'phel ba la yang brtsad pa mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: The same argument applies to the increase of bile.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad las skye ba ma yin nam / thams cad gyur na 'gyur bar snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad las skye ba ma yin nam / thams cad gyur na 'gyur bar snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Is it not the case that anger, etc. arise from everything, since it is seen that anger, etc. arise when everything changes?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad las skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad las skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Anger, etc. do not arise from everything,

original: 'dod chags mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod chags mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: because it follows that anger, etc. would arise from everything.

original: gzhan yang rgyu bad kan la sogs pa 'phel bar gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu bad kan la sogs pa 'phel bar gyur na /
translated: Moreover, when the cause, phlegm, etc. increase,

original: 'bras bu 'dod chags la sogs pa 'grib par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dod chags la sogs pa 'grib par mi 'gyur te /
translated: the result, anger, etc. do not decrease,

original: dper na tsha ba la sogs pa 'phel bar 'gyur na mkhris pa 'phel ba dang ldan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na tsha ba la sogs pa 'phel bar 'gyur na mkhris pa 'phel ba dang ldan pa bzhin no //
translated: just as when heat, etc. increase, bile does not increase.

original: 'on te 'dod chags phul du byung ba ni khu ba'i rdzas dang nye bar ldan pa'i bad kan can la mthong ba nyid do zhes na /
analyzed: 'on te 'dod chags phul du byung ba ni khu ba'i rdzas dang nye bar ldan pa'i bad kan can la mthong ba nyid do zhes na /
translated: But the excess of passion is seen in the phlegm-type who is endowed with the substance of semen.

original: de ni bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bden pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not true.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba bde ba la sogs pa las skyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba bde ba la sogs pa las skyes pa yin gyi /
translated: Because the change of passion, etc. arises from pleasure, etc.

original: bad kan la sogs pa las skyes pa ni ma yin no / bde @360a * //
analyzed: bad kan la sogs pa las skyes pa ni ma yin no / bde @360a * //
translated: It does not arise from phlegm, etc.

original: ba yang la la la ci zhig ltar snang ste /
analyzed: ba yang la la la ci zhig ltar snang ste /
translated: And pleasure is seen in some way in all.

original: nang gi bag chags sad pa las skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi bag chags sad pa las skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from the arousal of internal propensities.

original: de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa skyon las skyes pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa skyon las skyes pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is established that passion, etc. do not arise from faults.

original: 'o na gal te yang bad kan 'phel ba las 'dod chags mi skye ba de lta na yang de tsam gyis bad kan rgyu ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na gal te yang bad kan 'phel ba las 'dod chags mi skye ba de lta na yang de tsam gyis bad kan rgyu ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: Now, even if passion does not arise from the increase of phlegm, that much does not make phlegm not a cause,

original: cha ma snyoms pa las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gegs byas pa'i nus pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha ma snyoms pa las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gegs byas pa'i nus pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the power to obstruct the arising of pain that arises from an imbalance.

original: gegs byed pas mi skye ba gang yin pa de rgyu ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gegs byed pas mi skye ba gang yin pa de rgyu ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: That which does not generate because it is obstructed is not a noncause,

original: thams cad rgyu med pa can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad rgyu med pa can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it would follow that everything would be causeless.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩma snyoms las skyes sdug bsngal gyis //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / ma snyoms las skyes sdug bsngal gyis //
translated: Here we say:üîΩIf desire is not generated from suffering

original: gal te 'dod chags mi skyed na //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags mi skyed na //
translated: arisen from imbalance,

original: ci skyed smros shig cha mnyam las //
analyzed: ci skyed smros shig cha mnyam las //
translated: then say what it is generated from!üîΩFrom the equal, intoxication increases.

original: myos 'phel de las 'dod pa na //
analyzed: myos 'phel de las 'dod pa na //
translated: From that, desire arises.üîΩFrom the imbalanced, the passionate one appears different.

original: skyon mi mnyam la'ang chags can dang // cha mnyam la yang gzhan du snang //
analyzed: skyon mi mnyam la'ang chags can dang // cha mnyam la yang gzhan du snang //
translated: From the equal, another appears different.

original: gzhan dag zad nas khrag 'dzag cing //
analyzed: gzhan dag zad nas khrag 'dzag cing //
translated: From the exhaustion of the other, blood flows.

original: bud med gcig la khu nges med //
analyzed: bud med gcig la khu nges med //
translated: In one woman, there is no certainty of semen.

original: des gcig la chags bod mi 'gyur //
analyzed: des gcig la chags bod mi 'gyur //
translated: By that, attachment to one does not occur.

original: gal te gzugs sogs yan lag ni //
analyzed: gal te gzugs sogs yan lag ni //
translated: If it is not the parts such as form,

original: min te kun ma nges phyir ro //üîΩnges pa med par yang mi 'gyur //
analyzed: min te kun ma nges phyir ro // nges pa med par yang mi 'gyur //
translated: it is not, because it is not ascertained in all.üîΩIt would not be ascertained,

original: yon tan mi 'dzin can gyi'ang 'gyur //
analyzed: yon tan mi 'dzin can gyi'ang 'gyur //
translated: and it would also be in one who does not possess the qualities.

original: gal te yon tan 'dzin de yang //
analyzed: gal te yon tan 'dzin de yang //
translated: If that which possesses the qualities

original: yan lag yin na thams cad dag / yon tan 'dzin pa can 'gyur te //
analyzed: yan lag yin na thams cad dag / yon tan 'dzin pa can 'gyur te //
translated: is a part, then all would possess the qualities.

original: rgyu la khyad par med phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la khyad par med phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference in the cause.

original: gnas skabs can gang chags can 'dod //
analyzed: gnas skabs can gang chags can 'dod //
translated: If one is desirous due to a certain condition,

original: de 'dra 'ang zhe sdang can mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de 'dra 'ang zhe sdang can mi 'gyur //
translated: One would not be desirous due to another condition.

original: de yi ngo bo mtshungs med phyir //üîΩ'di la nges pa mthong mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo mtshungs med phyir // 'di la nges pa mthong mi 'gyur //
translated: Because the nature of the two is not the same.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩgal te bad kan la sogs pa cha ma snyoms pa las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyis bad kan 'phel ba'i dus su 'dod chags mi skye na ni 'o na 'dod chags rgyu gang las skye ba yang smros shig /'on te bad kan la sogs pa mnyam pa las
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / gal te bad kan la sogs pa cha ma snyoms pa las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyis bad kan 'phel ba'i dus su 'dod chags mi skye na ni 'o na 'dod chags rgyu gang las skye ba yang smros shig /'on te bad kan la sogs pa mnyam pa las
translated: One would not see the certainty of this.üîΩIf attachment does not arise due to the suffering that arises from an imbalance of phlegm and so on, then tell us what is the cause of attachment?

original: nad med pa na rgyas pa de khu ba 'phel ba de las 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i 'dod chags skye ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nad med pa na rgyas pa de khu ba 'phel ba de las 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i 'dod chags skye ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that attachment arises from the increase of semen due to the increase of phlegm and so on when they are in balance,

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: then that is also not so.

original: gang gi phyir bad kan la sogs pa'i skyon ma snyoms pa las kyang kha cig 'dod chags can du snang la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bad kan la sogs pa'i skyon ma snyoms pa las kyang kha cig 'dod chags can du snang la /
translated: Because some people appear to be desirous due to an imbalance of faults such as phlegm and so on.

original: bad kan la sogs pa cha mnyam pa gzhan la yang 'dod chags chung bar snang ba'i phyir skyon mnyam par gyur pa'i tshe 'dod chags dang mi mnyam pa'i tshe zhe sdang yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa yod pa @360b ma yin no //
analyzed: bad kan la sogs pa cha mnyam pa gzhan la yang 'dod chags chung bar snang ba'i phyir skyon mnyam par gyur pa'i tshe 'dod chags dang mi mnyam pa'i tshe zhe sdang yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa yod pa @360b ma yin no //
translated: Also, when the three humors are in balance, desire is weak. Thus there is no certainty that desire arises when the humors are unbalanced, and anger arises when they are in balance.

original: gzhan yang bud med la mchog tu brten pa'i khu ba zad nas khrag kyang 'bab pa dang gzhan dag shin tu 'dod pa che ba de dag kyang khu ba zad nas 'dod pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang bud med la mchog tu brten pa'i khu ba zad nas khrag kyang 'bab pa dang gzhan dag shin tu 'dod pa che ba de dag kyang khu ba zad nas 'dod pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, when the semen of a man who is very attached to a woman is exhausted, her blood also flows. But when the semen of a man who is very attached to a woman is exhausted, it is not reasonable that she would not desire him.

original: khu ba yang bud med thams cad la thun mong ba can yin pa'i phyir bud med mdzes ma cig la chags par 'gyur ba'i nges pa med pa de bas na khu ba mtshungs par yod pa'i phyir btsun mo cig la chags pa bdo bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khu ba yang bud med thams cad la thun mong ba can yin pa'i phyir bud med mdzes ma cig la chags par 'gyur ba'i nges pa med pa de bas na khu ba mtshungs par yod pa'i phyir btsun mo cig la chags pa bdo bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, since semen is common to all women, there is no certainty that a man will be attached to a beautiful woman. Therefore, because semen is the same, it is not reasonable that a man‚Äôs attachment would be intense toward one woman.

original: khyad par can gyi bud med kyang rgyu ma yin nam /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi bud med kyang rgyu ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt a special woman the cause of attachment?

original: bud med kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i khyad par las kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa khyad par can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bud med kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i khyad par las kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa khyad par can du 'gyur te /
translated: Attachment and so on would also be different due to the difference in the form of a woman and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yang rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yang rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because form and so on are also the cause.

original: 'di ltar gzugs mtshar ba dang / lang tsho phul du byung bas yid dbang du gyur pa can gyi 'dod pa can ni rang gi chung ma bor nas bud med gzhan gyi drung du 'gro'o //üîΩres 'gar chags pa can gyi rjes su mthun par 'jug pa'i rgyu las kyang yin gyi khu ba 'ba' zhig ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu ma yin pas grogs byed pa yod pa'i phyir gcig la bdo bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs mtshar ba dang / lang tsho phul du byung bas yid dbang du gyur pa can gyi 'dod pa can ni rang gi chung ma bor nas bud med gzhan gyi drung du 'gro'o // res 'gar chags pa can gyi rjes su mthun par 'jug pa'i rgyu las kyang yin gyi khu ba 'ba' zhig ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu ma yin pas grogs byed pa yod pa'i phyir gcig la bdo bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thus, a lustful man whose mind is captivated by a beautiful form and the prime of youth abandons his own wife and goes to another woman.üîΩSometimes, the cause of engaging in accordance with the lustful is also the cause of attachment. Since semen alone is not the cause of attachment, it is possible for one to engage with a friend and for another to be inferior. There is no fault in this.

original: gzhan la dman par 'gyur ba 'di la skyon yod pa ma yin no zhe na de smras pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la dman par 'gyur ba 'di la skyon yod pa ma yin no zhe na de smras pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not said,

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams thams cad la 'khrul par mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams thams cad la 'khrul par mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it is seen that attachment and so on are confused about all forms and so on.

original: 'di ltar gzugs ngan pa la yang 'dod chags 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs ngan pa la yang 'dod chags 'jug pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, attachment arises with regard to an ugly form.

original: nye bar spyod pa'i cha la mkhas pas de la chags par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa'i cha la mkhas pas de la chags par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that attachment arises because of skill in the enjoyment of the form,

original: 'o na gzugs rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na gzugs rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then form is not the cause of attachment.

original: gzhan yang nye bar spyod pa mi shes pa'i gzugs las kyang 'dod chags skye ba de bas na nye ba'i spyod pa yang 'dod pa'i rgyur mi rung ngo//
analyzed: gzhan yang nye bar spyod pa mi shes pa'i gzugs las kyang 'dod chags skye ba de bas na nye ba'i spyod pa yang 'dod pa'i rgyur mi rung ngo//
translated: Moreover, attachment arises from a form that is not enjoyed, so enjoyment is not a cause of attachment.

original: gzugs dang rjes su spyod pa dang mi ldan pa la yang kha cig 'dod pa skye bar snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs dang rjes su spyod pa dang mi ldan pa la yang kha cig 'dod pa skye bar snang ba'i phyir /
translated: Attachment arises in some people with regard to a form that is not enjoyed.

original: gnyi ga yang rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, neither form nor enjoyment is a cause of attachment.

original: 'on te gzugs ma nges pa'i rgyu can du 'dod chags 'dod na ni gzugs la sogs pa nges pa med pa las de mi skya bar bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'on te gzugs ma nges pa'i rgyu can du 'dod chags 'dod na ni gzugs la sogs pa nges pa med pa las de mi skya bar bstan zin to //
translated: If you maintain that attachment has an uncertain cause, then we have already shown that attachment does not arise from an uncertain cause such as form.

original: gzugs mdzes par nges pa'i btsun mo gcig yod na /
analyzed: gzugs mdzes par nges pa'i btsun mo gcig yod na /
translated: If a king has a single queen who is very beautiful,

original: ma brtags par glo bur du 'ongs pa'i gzugs ngan pa la 'dod pa mi 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma brtags par glo bur du 'ongs pa'i gzugs ngan pa la 'dod pa mi 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: he does not have attachment to a suddenly arrived ugly woman who is not examined.

original: gzhan yang yon tan ma yin par 'dzin pa mi sdug pa'i 'du shes can so sor rtogs pa la sogs pa ldan pa yang chags par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te 'dod chags kyi @361a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang yon tan ma yin par 'dzin pa mi sdug pa'i 'du shes can so sor rtogs pa la sogs pa ldan pa yang chags par 'gyur ro // 'on te 'dod chags kyi @361a * //
translated: Moreover, those who possess the perception of the ugliness of the body, which is the cause of the non-grasping of the qualities, also become attached.

original: rgyu yon tan 'dzin pa yin na /
analyzed: rgyu yon tan 'dzin pa yin na /
translated: If the cause of attachment is the grasping of the qualities,

original: de lta na yang thams cad yon tan 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang thams cad yon tan 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case, everyone would grasp the qualities,

original: thams cad la yon tan 'dzin pa'i rgyur bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la yon tan 'dzin pa'i rgyur bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in the cause of grasping the qualities.

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan 'dzin pa'i rgyu de yang thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad la yon tan 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan 'dzin pa'i rgyu de yang thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad la yon tan 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the cause of grasping the qualities of external form and so on is also not different for everyone, so it follows that everyone would grasp the qualities.

original: 'on te gzugs la sogs pa'i yod pa las yon tan 'dzin pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs la sogs pa'i yod pa las yon tan 'dzin pa ma yin na /
translated: But if the cause of grasping the qualities is not the existence of form and so on,

original: 'o na yon tan ci yis 'dzin ce na //
analyzed: 'o na yon tan ci yis 'dzin ce na //
translated: then by what are the qualities grasped?

original: gal te thog ma med pa'i bag chags las dmigs pa med par yon tan rig na ni 'dod chags la sogs pa yang goms pa nyid las 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te thog ma med pa'i bag chags las dmigs pa med par yon tan rig na ni 'dod chags la sogs pa yang goms pa nyid las 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one knows the virtues without an object due to beginningless latent impressions, then one would obtain attachment and so on just through habituation.

original: gzhan yang gnas skabs gang la gnas pa'i chags pa de'i gnas skabs la sdang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gnas skabs gang la gnas pa'i chags pa de'i gnas skabs la sdang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, one who is attached to a certain state would not hate that state.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang de dag la mtshungs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang de dag la mtshungs pa med pa yin te /
translated: Those attachments and aversions would be equal,

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are mutually incompatible.

original: 'gal ba la gnas pa'i tshe 'gal ba gzhan mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'gal ba la gnas pa'i tshe 'gal ba gzhan mi 'byung ngo //
translated: When one abides in a certain incompatibility, another incompatibility does not occur.

original: 'on te gnas skabs mtshungs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gnas skabs mtshungs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if attachment and so on that exist in a certain state are not mutually incompatible,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.
